loans.name: Candida Rosa

texts.es: Cándida Rosa Martínez tiene 61 años, está soltera, y tiene una hija de 14 años. Sus propósitos son mantener activo su negocio, y antes de empezar con este negocio Doña Cándida se dedicaba a la costura. En sus momentos libres realiza la elaboración de prendas de vestir para comercializarlas, y con el fin de obtener más ingresos, establecerá una librería en su casa. Hace más de 17 años que tiene de poseer este negocio y poco a poco ha logrado mejorar su negocio. Cándida necesita financiamiento para realizar la compra de más productos para el negocio.  Sus sueños son de establecer un negocio para su hija y así podrá independizarse por sí sola. El monto a total es de 9.000 córdobas y el plazo mensual es de 12 meses.
texts.en:
Cándida Rosa Martínez is 61 years old, is single, and has a 14 year old daughter. Her goal is to keep her business active. Before starting this business Cándida worked as a seamstress. In her free time she makes items of clothing to sell, and with the goal of obtaining more income, she runs a bookstore from her house. She has owned this business for more than 17 years, and little by little she been successful in improving the business. Cándida needs this loan to buy more products for the business. Her dream is to establish a business for her daughter, so that her daughter can become independent. The total loan sum is 9.000 cordobas, to be repaid in 12 monthly installments.

Translated from Spanish by Sally Bolton, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Giovanna Elizabeth

texts.es:
Giovanna es socia del Bancomunal Mujeres Progresando.
Giovanna es casada tiene 38 años, tres hijos de 13, 10 y 7 años que estudian en la escuela estatal.
Giovanna  desde los doce años hacia tamales con su familia, cuando termino la escuela  estudio secretariado, se caso, tuvo sus hijos pero tuvo que dejar el trabajo  por no podía dejar solos a  sus hijos, nuevamente se dedico a la venta de  tamales los  vende  a fuera de una panadería por su casa,  semanal hace 600 tamales, cuenta con la  ayuda de  sus hijos.   
Giovanna necesita un préstamo de 2200 soles, para comprar una  cocina a gas, ollas, comprar maíz, especerías para la preparación de los tamales. 
Desde que está en Finca ha surgido más, aprendió a aprovechar las oportunidades de trabajo  cuando se presentan,  aprendió ahorrar y ha ser solidaria. 
El sueño de Giovanna comprar un carro con sus ahorros.
texts.en:
Giovanna is a member of the “Mujeres Progresando” (“Women Making Advances”) cooperative bank. She is married, 38 years old, and has three children ages 13, 10, and 7 that are studying at the state school. For the past twelve years, Giovanna has worked making tamales with her family. When she finished secretarial school, she married, had children, and had to leave her job to care for them. She then newly dedicated herself to making tamales, which she sells outside of a bakery near her house. With help from her children, she makes 600 tamales on a weekly basis. Giovanna needs a loan of 2,200 soles to buy a gas stove, pots and pans, corn, and other specialties needed for the elaboration of tamales. Since she has been with Finca she has made better progress, learning to take advantage of work opportunities as they present themselves and how to save. Giovanna’s dream is to buy a car with her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Giovanna needs a loan of 2,200 soles to buy a gas stove, pots and pans, corn, and other specialties needed for making her tamales.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: Maria vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos en la casa de sus padres. Se dedica a criar animales como ovejas y cuyes, desde hace 2 años y medio. Durante el día trabaja en la municipalidad de su localidad, y por las tarde cuida de sus animales. Al fin de mes, toma a los animales que están con un buen peso y los lleva a vender a las ferias ganaderas de su región. Para Maria esta actividad no es absorbente, lo ve como una recreación, por el momento con las ganancias que obtiene puede solventar algunas de sus necesidades, pero más adelante no solo quiere dedicarse a vender sus animales, sino que también quiere tener su propio negocio de venta de productos alimenticios. Es la primera vez para Maria participa en un  banco comunal, por lo que es su primer préstamo con MFP, ella quiere aportar al desarrollo de su grupo y mejorar cada día. El dinero que está solicitando es para la compra de alimento balanceado para sus animales y con una mínima parte comprará los útiles escolares de su menor hijo.
texts.en:
Maria lives with her husband and 3 children at her parent’s home. For the last 2.5 years, she has dedicated herself to raising raising sheep and guinea pigs. All day she works in the town center and in the afternoons she takes care of her animals. At the end of the month, she takes the animals that have good weight and sells them at the livestock markets in their area.

For Maria this isn’t a burdensome activity, she looks at it as a hobby and for the time being the profits she earns help her realize a few of her needs. She doesn’t only want to sell animals, but also wants to have a proper business selling food items as well. This is the first time Maria has participated in the community bank as it’s also the first loan request through the MFP. She wants to contribute to the development of the group to better it each day. The funds for this request will go towards purchasing a balanced diet for her animals and a small portion will goes towards purchasing school supplies for her youngest child.

Translated from Spanish by Jenson Abraham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a balanced diet for her animals

loans.name: Foinsah Grace

texts.en:
Grace is married and has seven children. She lives in Belo, Cameroon and sets up shop in the Belo Market. Grace runs a “Buyem and Sellem” store where she sells all sorts of goods. With this loan she plans to purchase clothing, specifically for women and children, in order to sell them to the community in Belo. She will also use part of the loan for covering the transportation costs she will incur while buying the clothing. 

Having grown a solid customer base, Grace can see that her business will be successful. She is a savvy business woman who is confident in her business skills. She also notes that the location of her business, near the market, is advantageous. 

Although Grace has many children, she still has a hard time thinking about the death of one of her sons. From the time he was born he was really sick. After 12 years he finally passed away. 

This is Grace's second loan from GHAPE since she became a beneficiary in 2007. With the profits from this loan, she plans to pay for her children’s school fees and test both her children and herself for HIV. She also has plans to add to her family farm. Grace takes out GHAPE loans because after comparing them to other microfinance NGOs she thinks the training they give makes them the best. 

About GHAPE
The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: Children and women’s clothing and transportation costs

loans.name: Cicilia

texts.en:
Cicilia K. sells charcoal from her home. She is requesting a loan to open up a shop. She is 38 years old and is married. Her husband works in the Ministry of Education, Science and Technology with the Government of Southern Sudan as a Director for peace and capacity building. Cicilia has four children. Two of her children are in primary level school and another two are in secondary level. With the extra profits from her business she hopes to be able to build a house for rental purposes.   

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To open up a charcoal shop

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: "Farmer, that is me. We have been tilling our rice field, me and my husband, to be able to support the needs of our children. Our harvest is intended for family consumption. When there is extra, we sell some of our rice to our neighbor at Php 37.00 per kilo," says Susan F., 48-year-old mother of six children from Agusan Del Sur in Mindanao. She would like to ask for a loan of Php 14,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to purchase five sacks of fertilizers and four sacks of seed. She thinks that by doing so, she will be doing something to improve their yield and income. CEVI gives not just loans to their clients. It also offers training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase 5 sacks of fertilizer and 4 sacks of seed

loans.name: Rafael Antonio

texts.es: Rafael Antonio C. vive en un pequeño cantón llamado el espino ubicado en el departamento de La Paz. Rafael vive con su esposa y sus dos hijas Maria de 6 años de edad y Ruth de 5 años de edad, ambas niñas van a kínder. Rafael se dedica a la agricultura siembra granos básicos y también comercializa frutas; Rafael se las ingenia mucho de cómo aumentar sus ingresos familiares es por ello que a veces se va a trabajar como albañil ya que estos son trabajos eventuales y  le dejan un poco más de su margen de ganancias mensuales, pero ahora el solicita un crédito por que quiere invertir en la compra de frutas.
texts.en:
Rafael Antonio C. lives in a small neighborhood called El Espino located in the department of La Paz. Rafael lives with his wife and two daughters; Maria is 6 years old and Ruth is 5 years old, both girls are in kindergarten. Rafael dedicates himself to agriculture and plants basic grains and also sells fruit; Rafael is always thinking of ways to increase his family’s income and because of that he sometimes works as a mason, given that these jobs are temporary and allow him to increase his monthly earnings. He is requesting a loan because he would like to invest in the purchase of fruit.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fruit.

loans.name: Chanda

texts.en: Chanda S. is from the city of Brgy. 25, Pandan, Gingoog City. She is 34 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. Chanda owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She is just starting this business. In 2009, Chanda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding her business. Chanda is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her 2nd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Barangay 25, Pandan, Gingoog City, Mis. Or.

loans.name: Estela

texts.es: Estela que en estos momentos cuenta con 41 años vive en anticrítico por la  zona del stadium junto a su esposo de 45 y un hijo de 20 años de edad. Estela tiene su propio taller de costura en su mismo hogar, con muchos años de experiencia en el rubro. Y su esposo el codeudor realiza trabajos de electricidad donde se lo soliciten. La competencia es baja ya que por su zona es la única que realiza este tipo de trabajo, mas aun que esta al lado de una plazuela cerca del stadium, por eso trabajo no le falta al igual que a su esposo. Estela ya compro su maquina de costura "singer" el resto lo ocupo en telas y otros. Este es el cuarto préstamo de Estela y todos los anteriores los a cancelado dentro de los plazos establecidos. Tiene dos pequeños créditos vigentes en otras entidades financieras.
texts.en:
Estela is 45 years old and lives as a renter in the zone near the stadium with her husband who is 45 and her son who is 20 years old. Estela has her own sewing workshop in her home with many years of experience in this field. Her husband, who is co-renter, works in electrical jobs when he is asked for. Competition is low around her neighborhood since she is the only one who does this type of work. Also, she is next to a plaza near the stadium so she does not lack work, nor does her husband. Estela already bought her Singer sewing machine.The rest of her loan will be used for cloth and other materials. This is her fourth loan. All the previous loans have been repaid within the established time frames. She has two small loans outstanding with other financial entities.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a sewing machine and other supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To stock his shop

loans.name: Hilderh Akinyi

texts.en:
Hilderh O. is a 45-year-old industrious lady married to Mr. O., a retiree. They have four children aged 24, 23, 20 and 16 years old. She has been in the tailoring business for 17 years, assisted by an employee. 

Hilderh had tried securing a bank loan but that was futile since the only tangible asset she had was her sewing machine, which was not acceptable within the banking circles. She learned about KADET Ltd through World Vision, the mother organization, from whom one of her children had accessed aid for school fees. This is her third loan from KADET Ltd. 

She hopes to use the money to increase her stock of materials and purchase another sewing machine in readiness for the fast approaching peak season. She aspires to open a wholesale shop and employ some more people to increase the scale of her business.

loans.use: To purchase another sewing machine and more material

loans.name: Isaias

texts.es: Isaías G. N. tiene 40 años. Es un hombre casado. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es un taller de carpintería. Hace más de  10 años que se dedica a esta actividad. El inicio cuando tenía la edad de 15 años por lo que su Papa tenía un taller y él le enseño este medio de trabajo para salir adelante  y por medio de este pudiera mantener a sus 3 hijos. El es un hombre muy responsable y le gusto mantener esta fuente de ingresos Isaías trabaja muy duro todos los días pues siempre tiene trabajos pendientes. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de madera, herramientas en su taller entre otras cosas. Su deseo es mejorar la calidad de sus productos.
texts.en:
Isaías G. N. is 40 years old and married. He has a carpentry shop and has dedicated himself to this business for more than 10 years. He began when he was 15 years old as his father had a shop and he taught him this work in order to be successful and through this work he has been able to support 3 children. He is a very responsible man and Isaías works hard every day to maintain his income and he always has jobs pending to complete. The financing that he seeks is working capital to buy wood, tools for his shop, and other items. His wish is to improve the quality of his products.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital to buy wood, tools, and other items for his carpentry business

loans.name: Zion Group

texts.en: Doris is a 35-year-old married mother of four children who all attend school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a town called Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana. Wiawso is a commercial and farming town. Doris is a trader of dried fish. She is the leader of a trust bank group called Zion. The group members are engaged either in farming or trading activities. They sell in their local market and nearby communities, and sometimes trek to nearby community markets. They want a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand their businesses.

loans.use: To buy dried fish in bulk for resale.

loans.name: Teodora

texts.en:
Mrs. Teodora N. is from Prk. San Jose, Brgy. Calumangan, Bago City. She is 53 years old and married to Ernesto N.. She has six school age children.

She has been a member of the NWTF-Project Dungganon since 1999. Before she joined, Teodora already had a small vegetable farm, but she kept it for their family's consumption only. When some of her neighbors started inquiring about buying some of the vegetables that her family could not consume, Teodora got the idea that it would be a good income source if she increased her production and sold vegetables in the local market. As the volume of production grew, she started building good customer relations and soon had many regular customers, some of whom bought vegetables in bulk. Teodora also raised pigs in her backyard as a supplementary source of income. All these ventures were made possible because she is able to access loans for capital from NWTF-Project Dungganon, and the relationship prospers because Teodora always pays her weekly installments on time and fully pays her loan within its loan term.

Because her vegetable farm can for now sustain itself, Teodora plans to expand her pig fattening business. She is planning to borrow PHP 25,000 for her 8th cycle loan for this specific purpose.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just of a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: Additional capital

loans.name: Phon

texts.en:
Mrs. Phon S. lives in Speu village in Takeo province. She is a Khmer cake seller. Her husband, Mr. Chhay Sorn (pictured here), is a farmer who owns 1-hectare field of land where he cultivates rice.

Although this couple tries to work hard, they still earn very little to support their family. So Mrs. Phon S. is requesting a loan to buy a cow for breeding. Mrs. Phon S. is 60 years old and her son is a policeman.

loans.use: Buy a cow for breeding

loans.name: Can Wange Pe Auma Edisa Group

texts.en: A. Edisa is the president of her group. She is a married business lady, 36 years of age, who is blessed with six children. Three of the children go to school. She has had a cereal business (maize flour) for over 10 years. She is requesting a loan to purchase maize and grind it into maize flour ready for sale. She is a creative and hardworking business lady whose dream is to educate her children and purchase a plot of land.

loans.use: To purchase more maize

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Danaya est  composé de cinq  femmes dont, une veuve et quatre mariées dans des ménages monogames. Elles ont en moyenne 50 ans, 5 enfants et habitent dans le quartier Bagadadji de la ville de Ségou  (4ème Région administrative du Mali)
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, professionnel  et exercent essentiellement  le commerce d’articles divers.
Après avoir correctement remboursé, les cinq prêts précédents, elles sont à leur 6ème  prêt solidaire qu’elles comptent utiliser pour acheter,  10 pièces de pagnes wax, 4 tenues en tissus brodés, 10 draps de lit, 5 tenues en cotonnade pour homme (Faso danfani,) 20 tenues en bazin de 5 m chacune, des produits nécessaires à la teinture, 3 tonnes de charbon de bois,1 chargement de camion en bois de chauffe, 15 sacs d’arachide en gousse et des ingrédients de l’encens (10kg de sarkatanè, 2kg de magnonkissè horon, 5 flacons d’eau de Cologne et 10 flacons de parfums .  
Elles s’approvisionnent en pagnes wax, tenues en tissus brodés, tenues en cotonnade pour homme « Faso danfani »et draps de lit une fois par mois à Lomé, Guinée Conakry et Burkina Faso, en bazins, produits de teinture  à Bamako, le bois de chauffe et le charbon de bois sont fournis par des transporteurs venant de Konobougou, l’arachide et les ingrédients pour l’encens est acheté au marché Château  avec les forains de Loulouni et de Koutiala. Actuellement avec l’approche de la fête les lieux d’approvisionnements et de ventes se multiplient. 
Les habits et l’encens sont vendus sur commande à Sikasso, Dioïla et à Macina, en ambulant à travers les quartiers d’Angoulême et de Bagadadji, le bois et le charbon sont vendus en demi gros et en détail à domicile, l’arachide est vendu à la foire hebdomadaire de Ségou et au marché de Ségou Coura. Les ventes se font au comptant, en détail, en demi gros et  à crédit  à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes. 
Elles  comptent réaliser un bénéfice  moyen mensuel de 62.500 FCFA qui servira à rembourser le prêt,  les tontines, à satisfaire les petits besoins familiaux, assurer les frais de nourriture et de déplacement des enfants étudiant à Bamako, à participer aux évènements sociaux. 
Leurs ambitions se résument à pérenniser leurs activités commerciales et assurer la formation et l’éducation de leurs enfants.
texts.en:
The Danaya group is composed of five women, one widowed and four in monogamous marriages. They are 50-years-old on average, have 5 children, and live in the Bagadadji quarter of Segou village (the 4th administrative region of Mali).They know each other through neighbors, are professional, and work trading miscellaneous articles. After having paid back their last 5 loans, they are together for their sixth loan. They plan on using it to buy 10 pieces of waxed cloth, 4 embroidered dress fabrics, 10 bed sheets, 5 cotton suits for men (Faso danfani), 20 5-meter damasque fabrics, products for dying, 3 tons of wood charcoal, 1 truckload of firewood, 15 sacks of unshelled peanuts, and supplies to make incense. They buy the cloth and linens in bulk once a month in Lomé, Guinée Conakry and Burkina Faso while they purchase the damasque fabric and dye products in Bamako; the firewood and charcoal are provided by transporters from Konobougou. The peanuts and the incense supplies are bought at the Chateau market at Loulouni and Koutiala's stalls. Now, with the holidays approaching, provisions and sales are increasing. They sell the clothing and incense in Sikasso, Dioila, and Macina, traveling across the Angouleme and Bagadadji regions, while the wood and charcoal are sold to households and the peanuts are sold at the weekly fair in Segou and at the Segou Coura Market. Sales, both wholesale and retail, are made in cash and credit to male and female customers. They expect an average monthly profit of 62,500 FCFA. This profit will repay the loan and the tontines, fulfill their small family needs, assure fresh food, pay for their children's travels to study in Bamako, and finance participation in social events. Their ambitious hard work continues to make their commercial activities profitable and assure the health and education of their children.

Translated from French by Kelly Percival, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Achat d’articles divers. - Buying of miscellaneous items

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira L. lives in Hacienda Malisbog 4, Brgy E Lopez, Silay City, Negros Occidental. She is 45 years old. Her husband, Rogelio, works as a tricycle driver within their village and around Silay City. She has two children who are presently attending school. Her dreams in life are to help her husband generate additional income for the family, so that her children can finish their studies. She also wants to improve her family's living conditions.

In 1998 Elvira joined the Kiva field partner, NWTF-Project Dungganon, to have capital to invest in a business. She used her loan for a tricycle as the source of their income. She also invested in the buying and selling of scrap, like empty bottles, scrap iron, plastics and many other things that can be useful and acceptable to sell. As she continued her loans with NWTF, her business grew and earned additional income for the family. She would get a minimum income of $77 a month, which she used for her family.

Previously, Elvira borrowed 19,500 PHP as additional capital for her scrap business and it was paid back on a weekly basis, and fully paid within her loan term without any delay. Because of her good credit performance, she was able to access a bigger loan. She recently borrowed 25,000 PHP for her 18th cycle loan, to use as additional capital for her scrap business. The income will be used for the education of her children and for her business.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional capital for her scrap business

loans.name: Erma

texts.en:
Erma C. is from the village of Cabuan, Guinsiliban Camiguin Province. She is 37 years old. Erma is married and has 6 school-aged children. To make a living, Erma owns and operates a specialized retail business. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling rice in the local community. Erma has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Erma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Erma is requesting a loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Erma from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Riel

texts.en: Riel R., age 40, is married with five children. Two of the children employed in the garment factory and other three are students and dependent on her income. She currently uses her own land next to her house to grow rice and vegetable crops to earn a living. Riel R. also relies on her husband’s income as a military policeman to support their family. Riel R. has bought housing equipment, which she plans to use to build a new house but the construction is not able to start due to the lack of some essential tool. Therefore, Riel R. decided to seek a loan of $1050 to be used to purchase enough tools to begin building new house.

loans.use: To purchase enough tools to begin building her new house

loans.name: Mercedes Del Carmen

texts.es:
Mercedes R. de 44 años de edad, vive en una zona periurbana en Paraíso de Guayaquil, tiene en su casa con agua y luz como servicios básicos, su esposo trabaja haciendo ladrillos con el tiene 4 hijas ya todos son mayores de edad. 
 
Mercedes empezó vendiendo verduras poco a poco pudo implementar productos comestibles. Cuando ya obtuvo ingresos necesarios se cambio a un local más grande. Ahora ella trabaja con sus hijas de lunes a domingos vendiendo arroz, azúcar, colas, legumbres, etc. Uno de los inconvenientes que tienen es la transportación de la mercadería a la tienda.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar arroz, verduras, azúcar, colas para incrementar más su tienda. En el futuro quiere comprarse una camioneta para poder transportar la mercadería y poder construir mejor su casa.
texts.en:
Mercedes is 44 years old and lives in a suburb of Paraíso de Guayaquil. She has basic services in her home, such as water and electricity. Her husband is a brick maker. She has had four daughters with her husband, and they are all adults.

Mercedes began selling vegetables and little by little added other edible goods. When she has enough savings, she will move to larger premises. She now works Monday through Sunday with her daughters, selling rice, sugar, soft drinks, vegetables, etc. One of the inconveniences that she faces is transporting the merchandise to her shop.

With this loan, she wants to buy rice, vegetables, sugar, and soft drinks,to increase her stock. In the future, she wants to buy a van to transport her merchandise and to improve her house.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy vegetables, rice, sugar, soft drinks

loans.name: Moulikatou

texts.fr: A. Moulikatou est née le 15 avril 1973 à Parakou, au Nord du Bénin.  Mariée à HOUNTOMDJI Clif, un réparateur de véhicule ou de moto, Moulikatou est mère de deux enfants tous scolarisés, dont un est a sa change. Moulikatou vit ensemble avec son enfant et son mari au quartier Agla à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin.  Il y a environs six ans que la famille vit dans ce quartier.  Le couple supporte ensemble les charges de la famille.  Moulikatou n'a fait que l’école primaire.  Moulikatou vend de glacières et des ustensiles de cuisine.  C’est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, que Moulikatou s’approvisionne.  Moulikatou mène cette activité depuis environs sept ans. Moulikatou a déjà obtenu des crédits à ALIDé.  Ces crédits ont été bien remboursés.  Moulikatou sollicite un autre crédit auprès de ALIDé pour renforcer son activité et acheter d'autres ustensiles de cuisine.  Elle voudrait améliorer le niveau de vie de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Moulikatou A. was born on the 15th of April, 1973, in Parakou, in the north of Benin. She is married to Clif Hountomdji, a car and bike mechanic, and has two children of school-age, one of whom is in her care. Moulikatou lives with her child and husband in the Agla quarter of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. The family have lived in this quarter for the past six years. The couple work together to meet their family´s needs. Moulikatou only attended primary school. She now sells coolers and cooking utensils for a living, and sources these materials from the international market of Benin. She has been doing this for the past seven years. Moulikatou has already received loans from ALIDé and these have all been repaid. She is seeking another loan from ALIDé in order to bolster her business and buy more cooking utensils, and her end goal is to improve her children´s standard of living.

Translated from French by Danielle Treharne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of coolers and cooking utensils

loans.name: Teresa De Jesús

texts.es:
La Señora Teresa de Jesús H. tiene un negocio de venta de ropa para niños y ropa interior en el mercado central de Chinandega de la iglesia el calvario cuadra y media al oeste en la acera de una casa. La señora H. solicito el crédito par surtir su negocio ya que nesecitaba surtirlo para poder tener ventas.
Abre su negocio a las siete de la mañana y lo cierra a las cinco de la tarde de lunes a domingo se esfuerza bastante para poder llevar el sustento a su casa es madre soltera de 3 hijos a su cargo anteriormente ella era doméstica pero se aburrió y decidió poner su propio negocio con  un capital de C$ 500.00 capital propio y vendiendo ambulante ya tiene 16 años de tenerlo en un punto fijo.
Tiene cinco años de trabajar con ceprodel y siempre estos financiamientos les saca provecho ya que a incrementado su negocio y su casita la ha mejorado poco a poco
texts.en:
Teresa de Jesús H. has a business selling children’s clothes and underwear in the central market of Chinandega. It is a block and a half west of the Calvario church on the sidewalk of a house. Mrs. H. is requesting a loan to stock her business because she needs to be able to have sales. She opens her business Monday through Sunday at seven in the morning, and she closes it at five in the afternoon. She works so hard in order to be able to support her household. She is a single mother, and she has three children under her care. She worked previously as a domestic employee, but she got bored. She decided to set up her own business. She used 500,000 NIO of her own money, and she was a traveling salesperson. She has had a fixed location for 16 years. She has worked with Ceprodel for five years. These loans have always been beneficial. She has expanded her business, and little by little she has improved her house.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy underwear for children and adults

loans.name: Nuevo Emprendimiento Group

texts.es:
Las integrantes de este comité  se dedican a variadas actividades entre las que se puede destacar  la venta de ropas, minutas , como empanadas , tortillas, croquetas ,asaditos de carne etc, reciclaje de carton , plastico ,y todo tipo de metales en desuso,entre otras actividades todas  ellas son en su mayoria cabezas de hogar en sintesis las que administran y se encargan de llevar a casa el pan del dia a  dia. 
 Actualmente este comité  se encuentra en su tercer ciclo en donde se puede destacar el sentido de responsabilidad y los deseos de progresar que tienen de cada una de las que integrantes  ademas de la responsabilidad en los pagos. Podemos hablar de la Sra. Rosa    
Ruíz que se dedica a la venta de golosinas y todas mercaderías de uso doméstico, ella realiza su compra en Clorinda (ciudad fronteriza de la Argentina) y las vende en colectivos y en su barrio. Desea que sus hijos no pasen por las mismas limitaciones laborales y educativas,  por ello se esfuerzan el doble para poder brindar a sus hijos la oportunidades de progreso.
texts.en:
The members of this committee work at various activities, among which we can highlight selling clothes; selling food such as empanadas, tortillas, croquettes, roast meats, etc; recycling cardboard, plastic, and all types of metals; and other activities. They are all heads of their households and are responsible for putting bread on their tables day in and day out.

Currently, this committee is in its third loan cycle, and they are distinguished by the sense of responsibility and the desire to progress that each of them possesses, in addition to the responsibility for their repayments. We can speak of Rosa who sells candy and domestic supplies. She makes her purchases in Clorinda (a city on the border of Argentina) and sells to collectives in her neighborhood. She hopes that her children are not held back by the same work and education limitations, and so she doubles her efforts to be able to offer her children all opportunities to progress.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy noodles, sugar, flour, oil, and other supplies

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul Kipkoech K. is 40 years old and married to Mercy Chepkoech, who is 26 years old. Paul has been blessed with children: Enock, Kibet, Diporah and Chepngetich. Paul describes himself as dedicated and hardworking.

Paul operates an electronics shop which he has been doing for the last four years. From this shop, Paul makes an average profit of 9,500 Kenyan shillings (KES) and an extra 10,000 KES from other sources. Mr. K.’s business is situated along Kabarnet Eldoret road and most of his customers are Kabarnet residents.

Paul was introduced to KADET by a staff member during a marketing session. He has borrowed 50,000 KES of which he will use 5,000 KES to purchase 100 chicken layers, 6,000 KES to purchase chicken broilers, 30,000 KES to purchase materials for construction of a poultry house, and the remaining 9,000 KES will be used to purchase layers and broilers mash and feed. If this loan boosts his business, Mr. K. intends to purchase a plot of land, on which he hopes and dreams to later construct his own house and rental houses. Mr. K. wants to educate his children to the highest level possible and to have a better standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase chicken layers and broilers

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua A. is married and has five dependants. She has received junior high education.  Ekua bakes bread and sells locally made porridge (made from millet) as well, within the locality of Jukwa. Her husband is a farmer. Ekua uses the income she generates from the sale of porridge to help her husband with the payment of school fees and utility bills. Ekua will use this loan to purchase more flour, sugar and other ingredients to bake larger quantities for people to sell for her. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ekua plans to save to buy land.

loans.use: To purchase more flour, sugar and other ingredients to bake bread

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more tailoring materials to sell

loans.name: Srey

texts.en: Mrs. Srey Y. has a small trade selling fresh fish at a busy local market, earning a suitable profit for her family. Her husband works in the construction sector. The couple helps each other to earn money to ensure that their three school-aged children have good educations. Srey Y. faces difficulty with traveling because she doesn’t have her own vehicle for commuting. Therefore, she decided to request a loan to add to her savings so she can buy an old motorcycle to provide transportation for the family. (Mrs. Srey Y. was busy at her business when the photo taken so her husband is shown instead.)

loans.use: To buy an old motorcycle for transportation

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael G. is from the village of Maribucao, Gingoog City. He is 38 years old. Michael is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Michael owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Michael has been engaged in his business for over  years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Michael joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Michael has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Michael is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Michael from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve his house and for the education of his children.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: buy additional products to sell

loans.name: Jimmy Henry

texts.es: Jimmy Henry G. M. de 26 años de edad, posee un comedor en el cual elabora desayunos y almuerzos, así mismo por las noches elabora pupusas. Todo esto lo hace con la ayuda de su esposa quien le ayuda a preparar los alimentos, el trabajo que realiza lo elabora con el deseo de poder brindarles todo lo necesario a sus dos hijos y así mismo contar con una vida estable. Su negocio esta ubicado a la salida del pasaje en el cual reside Jimmy, el cual esta ubicado en Soyapango, debido a que esta es una zona muy comercial ya que hay diferentes negocios, centros comerciales y fabricas, el cuenta con muy buenas ganancias diarias. Es por esto que solicita un préstamo a Integral a través del cual pueda invertir más en el comedor, comprando: verduras, bebidas, frutas, diferentes tipos de carnes, jugos, maíz, queso y otros ingredientes más, los cuales le den la oportunidad de elaborar más alimentos y más pupusas, las cuales son de los platillos que más se venden. Para Jimmy es de mucha importancia mejorar las condiciones de su negocio, ya que es este la única fuente de ingresos con la que cuenta para sostener su hogar y a su familia, es por ello que su mayor deseo es incrementar sus ventas y poseer más clientes y esto lo podrá lograr comprando todos los productos necesarios por mayor, de esta manera contará con los recursos necesarios para elaborar más comida.
texts.en:
Jimmy Henry G. M. is 26 years old, and has an eatery where he makes breakfast and lunch. He also makes pupusas at night. He does all of this with the help of his wife, who helps him prepare the food. He does all of this work in the hopes of providing for every necessity of his two children, and also to have a stable life. His business is located where Jimmy resides, at the exit of a narrow street in Soyapango. Since this is a very commercial area with many businesses, malls, and factories, he makes very good earnings daily. This is why he is asking for a loan from Integral, which will allow him to invest more in his dining room by purchasing vegetables, drinks, fruit, different types of meat, juice, maíz, cheese, and other ingredients. These will give him the opportunity to make more food and more pupusas, which sell the most. For Jimmy, it is very important to improve the condition of his business, since it is the only source of income that he has to support his home and his family. This is why his biggest hope is to increase sales and to have more clients. He can achieve this by purchasing all necessary products in bulk. In this way, he will have the necessary resources to make more food.

Translated from Spanish by Flavia Garcia, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of primary ingredients to make meals and pupusas

loans.name: Kalomp Group

texts.en:
These are members of the “Kalomp” group. They are men with small-scale businesses in the small town of Waterloo, where “Shine on Sierra Leone” partnered with SMT to start a branch. They are seeking a loan of SLL 2,600,000 from SMT/Kiva in order to improve on the size and quality of their businesses.

Mohamed K. (pictured right) is the leader of this group. He was born in Masiaka village. He is thirty-eight years of age, is married to a businesswoman, and they have three children.

Mohamed sells lace, shoes, slippers/flip-flops, and sandals and has been managing this business for twenty years now. With the help of this loan, he will buy footwear in large quantity to improve the size and quality of his business.

loans.use: To buy footwear in large quantity to improve on the size and quality of his business

loans.name: Las Golondrinas De Chajabal Group

texts.es: Doña Adelaida es Madre Soltera, cursó el tercer grado Básico, tiene un hijo de ocho años y ella cubre todos los gastos necesarios de su hijo, ella se dedica a la Tejeduría, (Elaboración del Cortes Típicos), tiene 11 años ya con este negocio. Contando con entusiasmo, deseos de superación, convoca a algunas de sus vecinas para organizar un grupo, y poder solicitar un préstamo. El Banco Comunal se denomina LAS GOLONDRINAS DE CHAJABAL, el nombré fue elegido por todas las integrantes y también incluye el nombre de la ubicación. El grupo cuenta con 11 integrantes mujeres, quienes se dedican a diversas actividades entre ellos podemos mencionar, la crianza de animales, tejeduría, y venta de artículos de consumo diario.  El préstamo ella lo utilizará para compra de materia prima y así incrementar el volumen de ventas. Ya que una de las dificultades de ser la dueña del negocio ha sido la falta del capital, pero ha salido adelante y espera que su negocio sea más grande y productivo.
texts.en:
Mrs. Adelaida is a single mother who has finished the third level of basic education. She has an eight year old son for whose expenses she is completely responsible. She is a weaver and for the past 11 years has created a business making traditional textiles. Relying on enthusiasm and the drive to improve, she called together some of her neighbors to organize a group in order to be able to solicit a loan. The communal bank is called LAS GOLONDRINAS DE CHAJABAL (The Swallows of Chajabal). The name was elected by all the members and also includes the name of the group’s location. The group consists of 11 women members who dedicate themselves to various activities including animal husbandry, weaving, and selling basic necessities. The loan will be used to buy primary material and in this way increase the volume of sales. One of the difficulties of owning a business is lack of capital, however Adelaida has been able to continue forward and she hopes that her business will be bigger and more productive.

Translated from Spanish by Emma Felten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Benkadi 8 Group

texts.fr:
Constitué de six femmes toutes mariées, les membres du groupe BENKADI 8  ont  une moyenne d’âge de 35ans ont en moyenne 4  enfants et  vivent la plupart dans des  familles polygames à COMOROW un des villages de la commune de LOULOUNI dans la sous préfecture  de LOULOUNI, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. Elles sont à leur septième prêt avec l’institution et tous  les six prêts précédents se sont bien dénoués.
Les  spéculations cultivées sont : le manioc, le sésame et le riz avec MAKOURA C..
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants et les petits matériels pour entretenir : 1hectare. 
Les productions sont vendues au niveau du village et au marché de LOULOUNI après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 50.000FCFA en fin de  campagne, qui lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi de préparer le trousseau de mariage de sa fille aînée.
Elle souhaite entretenir  cette collaboration avec Soro Yiriwaso afin d’ exploiter un espace cultural encore plus grand pour mieux en tirer plus de gains.
texts.en:
The Benkadi 8 group consists of six married women, on the average 35 years of age, with four children, who live mainly in polygamous families in Comorow, a village of the community of Loulouni in the Sub-prefecture of Loulouni, the third administrative district of Mali. They collaborate with the microfanice instiution Soro Yiriwaso in order to better manage their agricultural enterprise during the winter season. They are now on their seventh loan, and all previous loans have been fully repaid. In the case of Makoura C., the grains cultivated are manioc, sesame and rice. With this loan, she plans to purchase agricultural inputs and small tools needed for working 1 hectare [about 2.5 acres] of land. After harvesting, the produce is sold locally at the market of Loulouni, to a customer base composed of both men and women. She plans to achieve a revenue of 50,000 West African Franks at the end of the season, which will allow her to repay her loan and also provide the bridal trousseau for her eldest daughter. She would like to continue collaborating with Soro Yirwaso in order to be able to work a larger field and obtain higher revenues.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing agricultural inputs and small tools

loans.name: Musa

texts.en:
Twenty-nine-year-old Musa is a married man with three children. He lives in a house in Kyenjojo, Uganda.

To earn income, Musa supplies power in Kyegegwa town using a generator and wants a loan to service his generator.

Musa dreams of building a permanent residential house and becoming the sole supplier of power with support from government.

loans.use: To service his generator

loans.name: Antonieta

texts.es: Antonieta, de 51 años, vive en su casa propia en compañía de su esposo Jorge de 70 años y de sus 2 hijos que ya son mayores, juntos habitan una morada ubicada al norte de la ciudad. Desde muy joven le gustó trabajar, es por eso que se ha dedicado al comercio toda su vida. Y hace 6 años vende productos de belleza de una reconocida marca a nivel mundial, dice que el negocio es bastante tranquilo, pues ofrece los productos por catalogo a sus conocidas y amigas, luego les trae los pedidos y se los ofrece a crédito. Esta muy satisfecha porque puede trabajar desde su casa, gana regular dinero, de esta manera no descuida las labores de su hogar, afirma que no le gusta vender a personas desconocidas, pues desconfía que le puedan pagar a tiempo. Como es una mujer muy emprendedora para más adelante tiene planeado ampliar su negocio de venta de productos de belleza y comprar una vitrina para surtirla con mejores productos y accesorios para ofrecerles a sus clientes. Es el primer crédito que tiene con MFP, y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente, pues no quiere defraudar a las personas que hicieron posible el dinero que le permitirá continuar trabajando. Antonieta tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de mayor cantidad de productos de belleza pues quiere mejorar su stock y así espera mejorar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Antonieta, 51, lives in her own house, located in the north of the city, with her husband, Jorge, 70, and their two adult children. She has enjoyed working from a very young age; she has been involved in commerce her entire life. For the last 6 years she has sold beauty products of a world renowned brand. She says the business is quite tranquil because she offers the goods via catalogue to her acquaintances and friends and then brings them their fulfilled orders which she offers on credit. She is very satisfied because she can work from home; she earns steady income without neglecting her household chores. She states that she doesn’t particularly like to sell to people who are unknown to her because she fears they may not pay on time. Because she’s a very enterprising woman later on she’d like to expand her beauty products sales business and buy a display case to stock it with the best products and accessories to offer her customers. This is the first loan she’s had with MFP and she promises to repay on time because she doesn’t want to disappoint all the people who made the financing that will allow her to continue to work possible. Antonieta plans to use the money to buy a larger amount of beauty products because she wants to improve her stock thus improving her profits.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock up on beauty supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy appliances.

loans.name: Alex Karatina

texts.en:
Alex has made a living raising animals in the town of Naivasha for the last four years.  He is 32 years old, married to Neopapa Ene Karatina and has two children.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by a friend and is now applying for his first loan. He plans to buy 15 young goats which he will raise and sell. This is a good business to be in in this part of the world because goat meat is a delicacy among locals and many people who vacation in the area.

He hopes to grow his business so that he will be stable financially in the future, and be better able to provide for the basic needs of his family.

loans.use: To buy 15 young goats which he will raise and sell later at a profit.

loans.name: Aura Gioconda

texts.es: La Sra. Aura Gioconda H. E.  ella es Trabajadora activa del colegio público los E. desempeñándose como secretaria tiene  diecinueve años de trabajar para el ministerio de educación es casada actualmente tiene dos hijo en edad escolar. Ha tenido  once créditos con CEPRODEL y cada uno lo  ha realizado para la compra de materiales de construcción y  mejorar su casa de habitación los cuales los créditos con Ceprodel le han beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esa manera ella ha  mejorado su condición de vida de ella y su familia.
texts.en: Aura Gioconda H. E. works at the Los E. public school, in the position of secretary. She has worked for the Ministry of Education for 19 years. She is married and has two school-aged children. She has had eleven loans with CEPRODEL, and she has used each one of them to buy construction materials and improve the home where she lives. The loans from CEPRODEL have benefited her greatly, since they have allowed her to improve her living conditions, for herself and her family.

loans.use: Buying cement, sand and stone blocks

loans.name: Elizabeth Aba Egyirba

texts.en: Elizabeth Aba Egyirba A. is single. She has no educational background. She sells cloth at Abura. She has been in the cloth business for three years now. Elizabeth uses her income to take care of herself. The loan will serve as additional working capital to expand her business. With the new profits from her expanded business, Elizabeth plans to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: additional working capital to expand her business.

loans.name: Hernan

texts.es:
El Señor Hernan G. en la compañia Gral. Resquin, vive en  casa propia,  tiene 28 años de edad, esta casado con la señora Carmen Figueredo de 25 años de edad.
 
           El cliente tiene un negocio de ventas y activación de celulares, tambien realiza recargas de saldos.  Su señora tambien tiene un comedor en el centro de dicha ciudad, ambos se ayudan para progresar cada dia más.
           
          El cliente no tiene operaciones de créditos con otras entidades, solamente con la Fundación Paraguaya, y está muy agradecido por los beneficios recibidos, ya que con los crédito que recibio anteriormente pudo comprar los modelos de celulares que frecuentemente solicitan sus clientes.
En esta oportunidas nuevamente solicita para la compra de nuevos modelos de celures y ademas desea comprar memorias, carcasa y otros accesorios para celulares.
texts.en:
Sr. Hernan G. González is from Gral, Resquin.  He is 28 years old, lives in his own home, and is married to Sra. Carmen Figueredo who is 25 years old.  

Hernan has a business where he sells and activates mobile phones.  He also performs phone charges.  His wife manages a diner in the city.  Both of them help each other make progress each day.

Hernan has not engaged in credit transactions with other entities, only with Fundación Paraguaya.  He is very grateful for the benefits he has received.  His previous loan was used to buy mobile phone models that are frequently requested by his customers.  With this new request, Hernan will buy new models of mobile phones as well as memory chips, cases, and other phone accessories.

loans.use: Purchase mobile phones, cases, memory chips, and other accessories

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en: Patrick is a 48-year-old father of two.  He is able to raise his family with the income from his van ("matatu") transport business.  In his business, he has employed two people.  He was previously running a retail shop.  He has benefited from Faulu Kenya because he has been trained in business record keeping.  This has helped him to run his business well.  He hopes to own buses for transport in the future.  He has requested 40,000 Kes to insure his van and buy tires.

loans.use: To insure his van and buy tires

loans.name: Elmira

texts.en:
Elmira is from the village of Mahayag Zamboanga del Sur. She is 60 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income comes primarily from their farm. Elmira has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2009, Elmira joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elmira has  a new loan of 50000  PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Elmira from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of the borrower's family.
About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.
*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase chemicals  and fertilizers

loans.name: Jagvaral

texts.en:
Ms. Jagvaral is 27 years old and lives with her mother, younger brother and sister in Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. Together they live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian felt tent, in the outer ger housing districts of the city. In 2007, Ms. Jagvaral graduated from the Mongolian State University of Agriculture with a concentration in food engineering and technology. Ms. Jagvaral’s brother is a secondary school student and her sister is a cook for a local construction company. Her mother is retired and stays at home.

Ms. Jagvaral is in charge of operating the small food store in her family’s yard with regular help from her mother.  The food store is in a small wooden cabin that must be kept warm by constantly keeping a fire burning in the winter. Currently, the food store sells mainly vegetables to neighbors in the surrounding ger district. With this loan of 1,500,000 MNT, Ms. Jagvaral’s family wants to expand their food store to sell a constant variety of foods beyond vegetables, such as flour, meat, rice, and candy. 

In the future, Ms. Jagvaral wants to expand the store’s size. Also, she wants to build a permanent brick house for her family in their current yard.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of food products to sell in the grocery store

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria C. G. tiene 62 años, es casada vive con su esposo, en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. Tiene 2 hijos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. DIVINO NIÑO se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Estero Lindo pertenece al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla de 12 miembros se dedica a las labores agrícolas en ciclo corto de siembra de maíz, arroz.

Maria  se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Compra sus productos en  Agro Servicios San Jacinto y vende en el mismo lugar.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz, y arroz, compra de insumos, semillas y pago de trabajadores. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es comprar un terreno 

Le gusta ver televisión, escuchar música.
texts.en:
Maria C. G. is 62 years old, she is married and she lives with her husband in Ventanas, a canton of the Los Ríos Province. She has 2 children.

The V.R.C. Divino Niño (Divine Child Communal Bank) is located in the Estero Lindo precinct, located in the Ventanas canton; it is composed of 12 members who engage in short-cycle agricultural labor, growing crops like maize and rice.

Maria engages in agriculture, growing maize and rice. She buys her products in the Agro Servicios San Jacinto and sells them in the same place.

The loan she is requesting will be used to sow maize and rice by buying supplies and seeds, and to pay her workers. The loan will help her economically, as thanks to it she will fulfill her needs, as well as face challenges such as pests, illnesses and climate changes. She dreams of buying some land.

She likes watching television and listening to music.

loans.use: To buy supplies and seeds.

loans.name: Roukan

texts.ar:
ركان في عمر 33 سنة متزوج وله اربع اولاد يحب عمله هو يعمل في بيع وصيانه الدواليب يحب عمله ويريد التوسع فيه 
لديه صدق في العمل ما يميزه هو الدقة في العمل والمثابرة على التطور والتجدد له تاريخ جيد مع المجموعة وكان يلقى الدعم الكامل يريد من خلال طلب قرض له من المجموعة الى شراء دواليب جديدة للمصلحة
texts.en: Rakan is 33, married with four children and loves his job. He works in the manufacturing and selling of tires and would like to expand his shop. He is honest and pays attention to detail in his work and is determined to develop his business. He has a good credit history with Al-Majmoua and has attained thier full support in the past. With the loan requested from Al-Majmoua, he would like to purchase more tires to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more stock for his shop

loans.name: Kashebeya K Tukorerehamwe Grp Group

texts.en: B. Yeusi is the leader of the Kashebeya K Tukorerehamwe Grp. He is 46 years old and married, with 5 children all older than 8 years and in school. B. Yeusi is a farmer who grows and sells tea and tea leaves to the Kayonza Tea factory. He has been in business for 10 years and has been successful because there is a ready market of the factory and consumers. As a result, he makes a weekly profit of 100,000 UGX. B. Yeusi is a very hardworking and focused man whose dream is to expand his tea farm and his banana plantation and to have a happy family.

loans.use: to expand his tea farm

loans.name: Nelson Heriberto

texts.es:
Nelson, reside en San Rafael Oriente departamento de San Miguel, vive con su esposa y su hijo de dos años de edad, Nelson se dedica a la venta de ropa y hamacas, comenzó con el negocio gracias a unos amigos, el horario de atención es variado pues como el negocio es  propio lo atiende a toda hora.
Por el momento solicita un préstamo para comprar mercadería, ya que desea mejorar el movimiento de las ventas, espera que con la inversión se pueda lograr, e ir incrementando poco a poco las ganancias y la clientela. Él sueña con ampliar el negocio, atender mejor a los clientes ofreciéndoles buena mercadería, ropa al gusto y de moda, al igual que las hamaca, pues los clientes son la razón de ser de este negocio y de su situación económica actual.
texts.en:
Nelson lives in San Rafael Oriente in the department of San Miguel. He lives with his wife and two-year old son. Nelson sells clothing and hammocks. He started the business with some friends. He has a varied work schedule because it is his own business and he is always attending it. 

He requests a loan to purchase merchandise in order to improve his sales. He hopes that this investment he will be able to progressively increase his earnings and his clientele. He dreams of expanding his business and to better attend his clients, offering them good quality merchandise and clothing to suit personal tastes and styles. He hopes to do the same with the hammocks. His clients are the reason for the existence of his business and the success of his current financial situation.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for his business.

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: Maria tiene 58 años de edad, es viuda y tiene un hijo. Vive en casa propia en la parte rural del distrito de Lambayeque. Desde hace cuarenta años, se ha dedicado a la cultivación de arroz en un terreno situado cerca de su domicilio. Vende su arroz a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona en donde reside. Aprendió esta actividad de su padre, es decir conoce a la perfección el rubro. Cuentan con el apoyo de su único hijo que vive con ella. Desea usar su crédito para comprar semilla y otros productos para sembrar una hectárea de arroz. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
58-year old Maria is a widow and has a son. She lives in her own home in the rural part of Lambayeque district. For the last 40 years she has earned her living by growing rice on land near her house. She sells the rice to business people who come regularly to the area where she lives.

She learned about rice growing from her father who is an expert in this field. Her only son, who lives at home, helps her. Maria wishes to use the loan to buy seeds and other agricultural products and sow another hectare of rice. For this reason she approached Kiva partner Edpyme Alternativa to ask for a loan of S/.1000.

loans.use: to buy rice seed

loans.name: Geoffrey

texts.en:
Geoffrey is 37 years old and married to Maureen Jemptum who runs a salon. Geoffrey rears poultry on his farm thus supplying eggs to the nearby centre of Ndurio in the town of Kapsabet. He has been in business for a period of six years earning a monthly income of KES. 6,000

Geoffrey has taken out his first loan from KADET LTD of Ksh 10,000. He wants to use the money to pay for chicken feeds and also add chicks to the poultry house. 

The profits will be used to expand the poultry house and purchase more chicks to rear and sell later at a profit. He hopes to become a major supplier of eggs in the town.

loans.use: to buy chicken feeds

loans.name: Epifania

texts.en:
Epifania A. is from the village of Yumbing, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 46 years old. Epifania is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Epifania owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling seafood products including dried fish and squid in the local community. Epifania has been engaged in her business for more than seven years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Epifania joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Epifania has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and working capital. Epifania is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional dried fish and squids. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Epifania from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: to purchase additional dried fish and squids

loans.name: Nver

texts.en:
Nver Tonyan lives in the Shirak region of Armenia in the village of Nor Kyank (which means New Life in English).  Nver is married, with a sixteen year old daughter.  He is making plans and saving money for his daughter to attend university. 

Nver has a high school education and has been a private entrepreneur for the past seven years. In order to expand his business, he is looking for a loan to purchase flower seeds and fertilizer. According to Nver’s business plan, this investment will increase his net income by twenty percent.  He is pleased with the convenient services of microfinance.  Nver was born in “New Life” and enjoys his rural life surrounded by close friends and relatives.

loans.use: to purchase flower seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Ana Rosa

texts.es:
Ana, se dedica a comprar y vender ganado, ella tiene 35 años de edad, es originaria de la comunidad Santa Teresa ubicada en Condega municipio de Estelí , esta casada , es madre de tres hijos, lleva tres años dedicándose a esta actividad , su esposo se va atrabajar a Costa Rica por temporada y con lo que ha ahorrado es que ella utiliza para comprar y vender ganado, así ha mantenido a sus hijos , su esposo ha su principal ayuda ,mientras ella dirige el negocio de comercialización de reses(vacas).
Solicito el préstamo para poder comprar dos vaquillas(vacas). Con esta adquisición espera utilizarlo para producir crema, queso y de esta manera obtener otras fuentes de ingresos para su familia y ayudarse ella misma en el negocio. Ella tiene dentro de sus planes poder comprar terreno, componer su casa, seguir trabajando para darles un mejor futuro a sus hijos pues para ella son su mayor prioridad.
texts.en:
Ana buys and sells livestock for a living and has been in this business for three years.  She is 35 years old and from the Santa Teresa community in Condega, in the town of Estelí.  She is married and the mother of three children, and her husband works in Costa Rica on a temporary basis.  What he has been able to save has been invested in the livestock business which supports their children.  Her husband is her main support and she manages the sales aspect of the cattle.

The loan use is to buy two dairy cows to make cream and cheese in order to expand the business and increase family income.  Her plans include buying more land, building a house and continue working to provide the best future she can for her children as they are her main priority in life.

loans.use: To buy two dairy cows.

loans.name: Davy

texts.en: Davy, 34, resides in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia, one of the largest rice-producing regions in Cambodia. Davy is a housewife, while her husband is a motorbike repairman earning an income of USD 12 per day to help cover the family expenses. Each month, the family has to spend USD 70 on food and USD 25 on the other necessary expenses. Davy is requesting a loan of USD 1200 to purchase motorbike spare parts to expand her husband’s business. This will be her first from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy motorbike spare parts to resell.

loans.name: Damirbek's Group

texts.en:
Damirbek is a member of this group. He is 31 and married. Together with his wife, he raises his daughter and son. Damirbek works as a loan officer in the financial group “Kompanion.” 

In addition to his job, he also sells foodstuffs to make additional money to meet the family needs. He started this business a year ago with an initial investment of 30 000 soms. He earns an additional 4200 soms per month for this business. 

With the money received from the loan, Damirbek wants to purchase more foodstuffs for resale. In the future he wants to purchase a vehicle with the money gained from the business, and will try to help his brother finish building his house.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase foodstuffs.

loans.name: Rovshan

texts.en: Rovshan is a 30 year old man who sells home furniture in the rental market in Agsu city.  He is married and is a responsible father of two children.  He started his business in 2004 with 100USD starting capital and then step by step he was able to make his business profitable.  Now Rovshan is applying for a 1000 AZN loan in order to increase his profit and improve the life conditions of his beloved children.

loans.use: to purchase more home furniture to increase sales.

loans.name: Gulmaddin

texts.en: Gulmaddin is 54 years old. He is married and has two children. Gulmaddin is the sole breadwinner for his family and his only income comes from raising large livestock and selling them at the local market. Every six months he buys young heifers from farms in adjacent villages. He has been raising the cattle with the help of his wife for the last four years. He then sells the adult cows and cattle to local butchers or in the Agsu bazaar. His monthly income is 250 USD. Today Gulmaddin is thinking about expanding his business, since the income from his present herd isn't enough to provide for his family. He plans to purchase additional young cattle. To do this, he needs to invest an additional 1,300 AZN in his business. This is the second loan from AqroInvest and he paid it without any delinquency.

loans.use: purchase  two young cattle and one cow

loans.name: Afiam Maame

texts.en:
Afiam is married and has a senior high school educational background. She sells provisions such as milk, canned fish, rice and other items in Abura, which she has done for just a year. Her husband is a farmer.  She assists her husband in taking care of their home. 

Afiam will use the loan to purchase more provisions sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to save to buy land.

loans.use: buy more provisions resell

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.es:
Guillermo tiene 43 años de edad, vive con su esposa e hijo en su casa propia, cuenta con sólo  servicio de luz, ubicada en el distrito de Pítipo que pertenece al departamento de Lambayeque.  Esta zona tiene como actividad agricultura y ganadería.

Guillermo desde hace algunos años se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales (cerdos, gallinas y pavos), su corral se encuentra en la parte posterior de su casa, los alimenta con comida balanceada y granos naturales, una vez que sus animales llegan a su crecimiento óptimo podrá ofrecerlos en los diferentes mercados de la zona y así pueda obtener muy buenas ganancias para solventar los gastos de su casa.  También cuenta con tierras de cultivo donde siembra maíz.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2000 nuevos soles para comprar animales y para el mantenimiento de sus tierras, con la finalidad de que pueda tener más variedad de animales y mejor producto, con los ingresos que obtenga podrá cubrir su crédito y mejorar su nivel de vida.  Guillermo es una persona trabajadora y empeñosa que lo único que quiere es que su negocio crezca cada vez más y brindarle más comodidades a su familia en casa.
texts.en:
Guillermo is 43 years old. He lives with his wife and his child in their own house. The house only has electricity. It is located in the Pitipo District in the department of Lambayeque. This is an area known for farming and ranching.
For many years Guillermo has been raising and selling animals (pigs, chickens and ducks). His pens are located behind his house. He feeds the animals with balanced food and natural grains. When his animals have matured he sells them at different markets in his area. This is how he makes good earnings in order to pay for his household expenses. He also has land where he grows corn.
He is requesting this loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 2000 new soles in order to buy animals and to maintain his land. His goal is to have a greater variety of animals and a better product. With the earnings that he will have he will be able to cover the cost of his loan and improve his quality of life. Guillermo is a hardworking and earnest person. The only thing he wants is that his business grows each year. In this way he can bring more comfort to his family and his home.

loans.use: to buy animals and for the maintenance of his farm land.

loans.name: Andrea

texts.en:
Andrea works hard to support her family. She is married and has a sari-sari (general) store business in the Philippines. 

Andrea requested a 15,000 Philippine Peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store. She has been in this business for 10 years. 

In the future, Andrea would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store

loans.name: Nancy Adelaida

texts.es:
Nancy es socia del  Banco Comunal “Mujeres al Progreso de Juli”, ubicado en el distrito de Juli, provincia Chucuito, departamento de Puno, tiene 30 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene un hijo.  Cuenta con educación superior incompleta.
Nancy se dedica a la venta de artesanía en bordados y venta de leña.  Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 25 ciclos, su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio venta de artesanía, en bayetas y lanas.
Con éste nuevo préstamo de S/.  1,000.00 nuevo soles, comprará cinco árboles para sacar leñas y venderlas por arrobas,  también comprará bayetas para sus bordados.  La señora nos cuenta que es su esposo quien corta los árboles para sacar la leña.
Su sueño es tener su carro para transportar su mercadería y así mejorar sus ganancias-	
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal  es la capacitación que recibe y lo que gana sus ahorros
texts.en:
Nancy is a member of the Communal Bank "Mujeres al Progreso de Juli”, which is located in the district of Juli, in the province of Chucuito and  department of Puno.  She is 30 years old with a live-in partner and a child.  She has an incomplete high-school education.

Nancy works selling embroidered handicrafts and selling firewood.  She has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for 25 lending cycles.  Her first loan was for 300 New Soles, money which she invested in her business selling handicrafts, cloths, and wool.  With this new loan of 1,000 New Soles, she will buy five trees to make firewood and sell it by the bundle.  She will also buy cloth for her embroidery.

The Señora tells us that it is her partner who cuts the trees to make the firewood.

Her dream is to have a vehicle to transport her merchandise, and so increase her earnings.

What she likes about the Communal Bank is the training that she receives, and that she can have savings.

loans.use: to buy five trees to make firewood.

loans.name: Brenda
