texts.en: Brenda is a 26-year-old married woman with one child and she rents a house in Kasese, Uganda. She takes care of the family with the help of her husband who is a businessman. She has been in the retail shop business for two years and she used her monthly salary as a teacher to start up her current business. Her hardship is bad debtors and her vision is a wholesale business plus educating children. Brenda wants the loan to buy sugar and soap to sell.

loans.use: To buy sugar and soap to sell.

loans.name: Winfred

texts.en:
Winfred is 37 years old, married lady blessed with three children. She owns a carpentry business for the past two years. She earns a monthly income of about KES. 40,000 which she uses to support her family. 

Winfred has applied for a loan of KES.30,000 by KADET LTD and this serves as her first loan cycle from the company. The lady intends to use her loan to purchase additional timber, Jack planes, as well as other required items necessary for the business to operate as needed.  


The client wishes to use the anticipated profit from her workshop to continue supporting her family by educating her children as well as save some of it for future investments.

loans.use: to buy more timber  for the  workshop

loans.name: Felicita

texts.es:
La señora Felicita tiene ya mas de nueve años con su negocio de venta de abarrotes. 
Solicita un préstamo para invertir en mercancía que es (verduras, frutas, productos de lácteos, quesos, leche y productos de carnes fría, jamón y salchichas), ya que sus clientes le están solicitando que tenga estos productos a la venta para su comedida de ellos. 
Doña Felicita no cuenta con el dinero necesario para realizar la inversión que a su negocio le esta haciendo falta y no quiere descapitalizar los ingresos. 
Planea pagar el crédito con las ganancias que obtiene de las ventas de su negocio, ya que su esposo el señor Bernave se encargara de los gastos familiares y escolares de sus tres hijos que están estudiando, con el sueldo que reciba de su trabajo en la construcción. 
La señora Felicita y el señor Bernave son originarios de la ciudad de Chapas México y tiene ya casi toda una vida viviendo en Nuevo Laredo.
texts.en:
Felicita has had her general store for more than 9 years.  She is requesting a loan to buy merchandise (fruit and vegetables, dairy products, cheese, cold cuts, ham, sausages) because her customers are requesting that she stock these items for sale.
Felicita does not have the money to make this investment in her business, and she does not want to decrease her revenues. She plans to pay her loan with the earnings from her business.  Her husband, Bernave, takes care of the family and educational expenses for their 3 children who are in school with the salary he receives from working in construction.  


Felicita and Bernave are originally from the city of Chapas, México and have lived almost their entire lives in Nuevo Laredo.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Evangelina

texts.es:
Evangelina, solicita un nuevo préstamo, lo necesita para comprar más mercadería (tomates, plátanos, cebollas, chiles),de esa forma tendrá más variedad y mas surtido el negocio, para ofrecerles a sus clientes. Este al igual que el prestamo anterior le han permitido a Evangelina mejorar su comercio, ya que la compra de productos nuevos le atraen mucho a los clientes por que estan frescos.
Su condicion familiar ha mejorado, ahora tiene una mejor solvencia economica.
texts.en:
Evangelina requests a new loan. She requires it to purchase more merchandise (tomatoes, bananas, onions, chilies). This will add to the variety and more selection to offer her clients. The previous loan helped Evangelina improve her business by purchasing new products that attract more clients for their freshness.

Her family condition has improved because she now enjoys improved finances.

loans.use: to purchase tomatoes, bananas, onions, and chilies for her business

loans.name: Mercedes Susy

texts.es:
Susy pertenece al banco comunal “San José de Urubamba” de la ciudad de Urubamba. Las reuniones de las socias del banco comunal son cada treinta días en la ciudad de Urubamba de la provincia de Urubamba del departamento del Cusco. 

Susy vive en la ciudad de Urubamba y donde realiza sus actividades económicas. Su actividad económica principal de Susy es la elaboración de tejidos con maquinas de coser y también de forma artesanal. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. 

En esta oportunidad Susy requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales de trabajo como por ejemplo lana y hilo. 

Susy agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales.
texts.en: Susy belongs to the “San José de Urubamba” community bank in the city and province of Urubamba, department of Cusco, Peru. The group meets every 30 days in Urubamba, where Susy lives and makes a living. Her principal activity is making woven products, using a sowing machine and knitting. She has dedicated herself to this business for a number of years and it is going very well. At this time, Susy is requesting the loan to purchase materials for her work, such as wool and thread. She is grateful and values the loan, and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase materials such as wool and thread.

loans.name: Domingo

texts.en:
This is Domingo, 54, resident of Tanza, Cavite, Philippines. He is married to Agustina, an overseas contract worker and mother to their only child.  Domingo,  manages his own household while operating the business. At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses and support his child’s schooling. 

Domingo operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. He earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. His regular customers are the local community. He earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To continue operations of his business, he is requesting a Php 10,000 loan. He will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products needed in his business. He expects a boost in his business income as he expands his business. 

Domingo hopes to be able to expand soon, just as he fervently hopes that his child will be able to graduate one day, and finish their studies. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and other inventory for the store.

loans.name: Alili

texts.en:
This is Alili, 60, a resident of Manila, Philippines. She is married to Juanito, a vendor, and a mother to her three children .She, together with her husband and children, manage their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Alili operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 1000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 38,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Alili hopes to be able to expand soon, just as she dreams of being able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.en:
Antonio is married with three children. He is 60 years old and resides in Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.

Antonio is operating a livestock business, raising pigs for sale to earn a living. He has been in this business for two years. Each month, he earns 5,000 Philippine pesos doing this type of work.

He requested a loan of 50,000 to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. Antonio has been a member of GDMPC for four years. In the future, Antonio wants to save money as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Luis Arturo

texts.es:
Luis Arturo tiene 21 años de edad es casado tiene 3 hijos, vive con la esposa y con los hijos de  de 2, 3 y 1 año de edad  en Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar.
Es integrante de la VRC VENTANAL se encuentra formada en la comunidad Guantuncoto, Parroquia Julio Moreno Cantón Guaranda, a una distancia de 30 minutos de la oficina Los habitantes de la Comunidad se dedican a diferentes actividades como son: agricultura, ganadería, crianza de animales (cerdos, pollos, ovejas) comercio y construcción.
Luis se dedica a la agricultura, avicultura además se dedica a la construcción y el deporte.
Las compras y las ventas lo hace en Guaranda.
Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas, fertilizantes, urea, abonos y mejorar la situación económica de la familia y tener buenos progresos.
Con la ayuda del crédito utilizará muy bien el dinero y poder invertir en la agricultura.
El sueño es poder tener otro negocio que incremente los ingresos para mejoras de la familia.
El desafío que se le han presentado es la sequedad del tiempo o mucho invierno. En los tiempos libres le gusta disfrutar de las festividades del carnaval.
Con la yuda del crédito anterior pudo comprar los insumos, abonos, semillas para mejorar la producción. mejoró la calidad de vida de la familia, los ingresos han mejorado satisfactoriamente.
texts.en:
21-year old Luis Arturo is married and has three children. He lives with his wife and children aged 2, 3, and 1 in Guaranda in the province of Bolivar.

Luis belongs to the Guantucoto community bank in the parish of Julio Moreno in Guaranda canton, located half an hour from the main office. The members of the community work in agriculture, raise livestock such as pigs, chickens, sheep), commerce, and construction.

Luis is a farmer and raises poultry. He also works in construction. He enjoys sport. He buys goods and sells his produce in Guaranda.

Luis is seeking a loan to buy seeds, fertilizer, urea, manure so he can improve the financial situation of his family and make progress. He will make good use of the money by spending it on supplies for his crops. His dream is to have another business so he can increase his income and improve his family’s situation.

The challenges that Luis faces are lack of rain or too long a winter. In his free time he enjoys going to festivals and carnivals. 

With his previous loan he was able to buy farm supplies, fertilizer and seeds and improve production. He improved his family’s standard of living and his income increased satisfactorily.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, urea, and manure

loans.name: Jacklin

texts.en:
Jacklin is a 40-year-old a married woman with seven children; four of them are in school. She's had a food stall in Yei, South Sudan for five years.

Jacklin is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase tomatoes and onions. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase tomatoes and onions for sale.

loans.name: Zoila Del Carmen

texts.es:
Zoila, vive con sus tres hijos, los tres estudian, ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de cerdos, tiene 15 años de estar en el negocio, comercializando cerdos, con estas ventas ha logrado mantener su hogar y cubrir todos sus gastos.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de quintales de concentrado y dos cerdos, esta compra es con la intención de mejorar la alimentación de la granja y tener suficiente alimento para un lapso de tiempo.
Ella quiere tener una granja estable, que le garantice los ingresos para su familia, brindándoles una vida más cómoda.
texts.en:
Zoila lives with her three children, all of whom go to school.  She works raising and selling pigs.  She has had her business for 15 years.  With her sales, she has been able to maintain her home and cover her expenses.

She is asking for this loan to purchase 100 pound bags of feed and two pigs.  She wants to make this purchase to improve her animal's diet and to have a sufficient amount of feed for a period of time.

She wants to have a stable farm that will guarantee an income for her family, so that she can provide them with a more comfortable life.

loans.use: to purchase feed and two pigs.

loans.name: Maria Del Pilar

texts.es:
María es una joven de 25 años de edad, madre de dos de 7 y 2 años de edad respectivamente, originaria de León, la cual se dedica a la crianza de cerdo. Ella inicio este negocio hace tres años, con al experiencia de su esposo pues fue el quien le enseño a ella todo acerca de la crianza de estos animales. Hoy en día su esposo se dedica a la carpintería y también la ayuda a ella con la crianza juntos administran el negocio para hacerlo mas prospero y productivo.
Ella realizo el crédito para la compra de cerdos de desarrollo. Pues su expectativa el lograr tener una crianza reproductores y vender cerdos de raza. Así poder tener mejores ingresos y darles un mejor futuro a sus hijos.
texts.en: María, 25, is a young mother of two children who are 7 and 2 years of age respectively.  She’s from León and works raising pigs.  She started the business three years ago with help from her husband who taught her everything about raising these animals.  Today, her husband works in carpentry and also helps her care for the animals; they run the business together so that it will be more prosperous and productive.  She took out the loan to buy pigs to raise because her hope is to have breeding stock and to sell pedigree pigs to obtain better income and provide a better future for her children.

loans.use: to buy pigs to raise.

loans.name: Pititos Group

texts.es:
Ellas son el grupo de Pititos. Se hacen llamar así debido a que son comandas por Guadalupe, a quien de cariño le dicen “Pititos”. Guadalupe es una mujer de lucha y emprendedora. Busca constantemente salir adelante por sus propios medios y reconoce en los medios las alternativas para invertir en su negocio.
Se comprometió con este crédito para poder invertir en mercancía para su negocio, pues tiene vista en las compras decembrinas y con ello tener mejores ganancias y seguir creciendo su negocio.
Guadalupe, trabaja día a día para tener una mejor calidad de vida. Ella es un ejemplo de perseverancia.
texts.en:
These women comprise the Pititos group. They are named after the leader of their group, Guadalupe, whose nickname is "Pititos". Guadalupe is a fighter and an entrepreneur. She is always trying to get ahead on her own and looking for alternative resources to invest in her business. 

Guadalupe requested this loan in order to buy merchandise for her business, with an eye towards December sales. She expects to increase her earnings and continue growing her business. 

Guadalupe works hard every day to have a better quality of life. She is an example of perseverance.

loans.use: to invest in merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Alfred

texts.en:
Alfred has been operating his own carpentry shop for about five years now and the recent years his business has been experiencing growth according to him.
Alfred is 29 years old and married; he has 2-year-old twins. They live in the northern Albania, yet prior to this current location they lived further up in the north.” Life there was very difficult; we were trapped by snow for six months. We couldn‘t come out of our homes. So, during the summer time we would stock up on food and other survival items for the winter. Poor animals they couldn’t resist the extreme cold weather and they often died. Our living was extremely poor. Now we live here and are much better and we are glad that we made such a move. We experienced difficulties in the very beginning, but now we are happy.” Alfred said.
Alfred will use this loan to buy raw material for his carpentry shop.

loans.use: to buy raw material for his carpentry shop

loans.name: Haby's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupement mise en place le 23 mars 2007, est composé de femmes qui en plus des liens de bon voisinage ont su développer depuis la création du banc villageois  une solidarité entre elles en plus de leurs activités génératrices de revenues qui tournent principalement autour du petit commerce.

Madame Haby (debout à l’extrême droite), est l’emprunteuse vedette de ce groupe. Elle est âgée 50 ans, elle est mariée et mère  d’une fille et de quatre garçons. C’est une femme d’un engagement sans faille dans le banc villageois. Son activité s’inscrit dans la vente de sucre, d’huile raffinée et de savon dans son village. Elle se procure la marchandise au marché central régional en gros et demi-gros pour la revente au détail. Pour exemple le sac de sucre acheté à 25 000 F CFA est revendu par sachet de 100 F CFA ainsi pour chaque sac elle peut avoir un bénéfice d’au moins de 5 000 F CFA.

Avec son nouveau prêt elle compte acheter des bidons d’huile palme de 20 litres et divers autres produits alimentaires pour la revente.

Elle compte avec les bénéfices améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille et acheter une vache.
texts.en:
This group was created on the 23rd of March 2007. It is made up of women who have developed good neighbourly relationships and a sense of solidarity, as well as their revenue-generating activities which are mostly small retail businesses.

Haby (standing on the far right in the picture) is the group's featured borrower. She is 50 years old, married and the mother of 1 girl and 4 boys. She has an unwavering commitment to the "banc villageois". She sells sugar, refined oil and soap in her village. She buys her supplies at the central regional market wholesale and semi-wholesale, and resells it to retail customers. For example, a bag of sugar worth 25 000 francs is resold in small bags at 100 francs per bag, giving her a profit of at least 5 000 francs on the original purchase. She plans to use her new loan to buy some 20-liter cans of palm oil and various other food products for resale. She plans to use her profits to improve her family's living conditions and to buy a cow.

loans.use: to buy some 20-liter cans of palm oil and various other food products for resale.

loans.name: Annsay

texts.en: Annsay is a humble mother who wakes up every morning at 5 o’clock to work on her farm. She is fully dedicated to her farm work and thinks only of progressing. Annsay resides in the Chuka area of Kenya which is a remote town with harsh living conditions because of the bad terrain in the region. She is happily married and, together with her husband, has a lovely family. Annsay’s primary sources of income are dairy goat milk and some personal business she engages in to make ends meet. Annsay has managed to take care of her family with her income from milk selling. The Chuka area has conditions that favor dairy goat farming. Annsay has always wanted to take care of another dairy goat but the lack of capital has prevented her. She is seeking a loan to buy an additional dairy goat. The dairy goat she intends to buy is not just an ordinary goat. It’s a breed that produces between 2-5 liters of milk a day. With this goat, she will produce more milk which will translate to more income. Demand for goat milk in the Chuka area is high but the supply is low. So, through this loan, Annsay is going to have more milk and comfortably meet the demand. Her increased income will allow Annsay to provide a secure future for her school-going children by paying their tuition fees. She believes that education is the gateway to success. Her vision is to keep even more dairy goats. Help her out!

loans.use: To buy a dairy goat

loans.name: Oliver

texts.en:
Oliver lives in Kimara area of Dar es Salaam.Oliver after finishing a secondary school was married.Up to when her husband died she had two children.She now has a task of raising the family of five people herself.Her first born is in secondary school and her second born in primary school.
Oliver makes and sales Batik( a type of locally decorated cloth).She had a training on batik making from Small Industries Development Organization (SIDO).Since she started this business ten years ago she has acquired a lot of customers from her own made Batik. She is now focusing to make a lot of sales on this coming Christmas.She needs USD  550 to add a stock of raw materials for Batik making. 
 Oliver has a known credibility with lending institutions.All loans  loaned to her were returned in full and on time.

loans.use: BUSINESS  EXPANSION

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en: Mrs. Veronica I. specializes in the sale of ice blocks. She started her business in the year 2000. She is married with 4 children and lives in a semi-rural area in Benin City, Edo state, Nigeria. Veronica says that the loan will enable her to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional freezer for ice blocks

loans.name: Anatolyi

texts.en:
Anatolyi is married with two daughters. He owns a little store that specializes in vegetable seeds, light-shade clear film for greenhouses, crop protection supplies and simple farming tools. Some of the attractions of his business are its convenient location, a big assortment of inventory, consistency in working with clients and affordable prices.

Anatolyi has been in this business for four years. He is always looking to grow and develop his business and improve his entrepreneurial skills. He is very ambitious and determined and is a leader in his community. Currently, Anatolyi’s monthly gross business income is about $5,000.

Anatolyi is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase some new equipment for his store and increase his inventory. He believes that offering high quality products in combination with the best customer service is a win-win strategy for both his customers and himself as a businessman. Eventually, Anatolyi would like to use generated profits to do some remodeling on his house and expand his store.

loans.use: To purchase new equipment for his little store

loans.name: Andrés

texts.es:
Andrés is a young man with big desires of success and self-improvement. Presently he is attending his fifth semester for a technical degree in refrigeration. He is the oldest of five siblings. His father's salary alone is not sufficient to cover all the costs of living and the education of his children. This is how Andrés began his own grocery store business, so he can pay for his studies and improve his family's quality of life.

Now he hopes to be able to continue growing and for this reason he is requesting a loan of $250 dollars, which he will invest in purchasing merchandise to increase the variety of products that he offers and improve his service. He promises to return this loan in three months. Be a part of Andrés' success. He greatly appreciates the opportunity to improve and grow his business, which you make possible.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

Andrés es un joven con grandes deseos de superación, actualmente esta cursando el quinto semestre de la carrera técnica en refrigeración, él es el mayor de cinco hermanos y solo con el salario de su padre no es suficiente para cubrir todos los gastos de su hogar y de la educación de sus hijos, así es como Andrés inició su propio negocio con la venta de abarrotes para poder pagar sus estudios y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.

Ahora desea poder continuar creciendo y para esto solicita un crédito de $ 250 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía para incrementar la variedad que productos que ofrece y mejorar su servicio, él se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en solo 3 meses. Se parte de los logros de Andrés, él agradece mucho la oportunidad que le brindas de mejorar y hacer crecer su negocio.

loans.use: Buy grocery merchandise

location.town: San Nicolás de los Garza, Nuevo León

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Hello, my name is Isabel and I dedicate myself to the sale of kitchen articles, clothing, shoes, creams, cosmetics and other things. I have had this business for three years. My customers give me their orders, I buy them and then sell them; in this way I manage to obtain a little more profit. I have two children who I help with their studies. Right now I need to invest capital since as of this month I begin to prepare for my christmas sales.

Translated from Spanish by Pax Bobrow, Kiva Volunteer.

Hola mi nombre es Isabel y me dedico a la venta de articulos de cocina, ropa, zapatos, cremas, cosmeticos y otros. Este negocio lo tengo desde hace tres años, mis clientes me hacen los pedidos los compro y despues se los vendo, de esta manera logro obtener un poco mas de ganancias. Tengo dos hijos a quienes he ayudado en sus estudios. En este momento necesito invertir capital para vender ya que a partir de este mes comienzo a preparme para mis ventas de navidad.

loans.use: Purchase of various items, women's clothing, shoes, jewelry, creams and other items - Compra de ollas, ropa para dama, zapatos, adornos, cremas y otros.

loans.name: Malik

texts.en: Malik is 47 years old , divorced, and has 3 children.   He lives in the village of Yenikand in the Salyan region.  He has 15 years of experience in the farming business. He is requesting a loan of US$1200 to buy fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Sou

texts.en: Mrs. Sou S. V., age 28, works on her plot of land growing vegetables and raising domestic animals. Her husband would like to operate a motor-taxi business to increase the family’s income. They support one child who is too young to attend school and her elderly father who also lives with them. She would like to request a loan of $800 in order to purchase a motorbike for her husband to operate a taxi business. They anticipate this will earn the family an additional $5 per day in revenue, which will help raise their standard of living and pay for their child’s education.

loans.use: To purchase a motor-bike for her husband to operate a taxi business.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en: Mrs. Gina C. is 29 years old.  She is married, has three children, and lives in Benin City. She sells drinks. She is requesting a loan of $450 to buy more drinks to sell.  She spent six months learning about the trade before starting her business in 2005.  Mrs. C. is very committed to her business and thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more drinks to sell

loans.name: Busei A South A Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Hellen B.. She is currently in the business of tailoring and selling clothes, and is requesting a loan to buy more sewing machines. Hellen is 47 years old and is a widow. She has 4 children ranging from age 17 to 28 and three of them go to school. Each week, Hellen makes approximately UGX 40000 in profits, and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy another sewing machine. Hellen has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 200000 in order to pay school fees for the children, and the loan was paid back on time.

Hellen is joined in her small group by Mariam K., Norah B., Sarah N., and Fatuma K.. Mariam K. has a business in tailoring and clothing sales and wants to rent a bigger area for business. Norah B. is currently operating a business in battery charging and wants a loan to buy more battery charging machines. Sarah N. operates a grocery business and wants to increase the amount of groceries traded. Fatuma K. is currently in the business of trading used clothes and is requesting a loan to expand and trade a bigger variety of clothes.

loans.use: To expand tailoring business

loans.name: Phally

texts.en:
Mr. Phally S. is married and has two sons and two daughters. Three of his children study in the local school and the youngest one stays at home. The family lives on Mekong’s Island about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mr. Phally has been in the business of raising pigs and producing rice wine since 1996. His wife, Mrs. Sorin Van, has been a silk weaver since 1996. It’s a skill she learned from her neighbor. She sells her finished product inside the island.

Mr. Phally is requesting a loan for the seventh time in the amount of $800 for buying feed and baby pigs for raising.

loans.use: For buying feed and baby pigs for raising

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
I need to put up a wall around my home and also to repair a window since it is in bad condition and therefore I cannot use the room. I am asking for $1,000 US in order to put up a wall and repair the window.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

Tengo al necesidad de levantar una barda enseguida de mi vivenda y también reparar una ventana ya que esta en malas condiciones y asi no puedo habitar el cuarto" Solicito $ 1,000.00 dlls para levantar la barda y reparar la ventana.

loans.use: To put up a wall and repair a window at my house

loans.name: Rum

texts.en:
Mr. Rum R. (pictured with his mother) is single and lives with his mother. He has one brother, who is a wooden house builder, and one sister. The family lives on an Island on the Mekong River about 12 km from Phnom Penh.

Mr. Rum has been in the business of wooden house building for four years. It’s a skill he learned from his neighbor. His mother is a farmer.

He is requesting a loan of $300 to purchase a construction crane for use in his business.

loans.use: To purchase a construction crane for home building

loans.name: Suesue

texts.en: Fuefue S., 26, is married and is a mother expecting her first baby next month. She has 1 year of experience in the Canteen business. She sells to the students of their village primary school 3 days per week. She has no previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 280 Tala (~116 USD).  SPBD loans are Fuefue’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.  Her husband is employed at a shipping company.

loans.use: Purchase a kerosene stove, a sack of flour, a sack of rice, lamp flaps and chickens

loans.name: Fereni

texts.en:
Fereni M. is a 41-year-old married woman with 11 children. She has 2 years of experience in the crafts/mowing contract business, and her husband helps run and operate the business as the manager. In practice, she sells their crafts to the village community and to the public at large 5 days per week. On average, her weekly net cash flow is approximately 520 Tala ($216 USD).

This is the first loan she has requested via SPBD. In fact, SPBD loans are Fereni’s only access to capital because she has never able to qualify for a loan from any of the traditional banks. The loan proceeds will primarily be used to repair her family's house, but also to pay for her kids' school fees.

loans.use: To repair her family's house and to cover her kids' fees for school

loans.name: Faustina

texts.en: For the past four years, Faustina has been trading in palm oil. She is a 50-year-old married woman, with two children who are in school. She treks to Asamang, a town in the eastern region of Ghana, to purchase palm oil from the producers in bulk so she can sell it to her customers. She says increased prices of rice and fuel have affected her working capital and she can no longer buy enough palm oil to sustain her business. She wants to use the loan to buy palm oil in bulk to avoid price hikes and frequent travel. She hopes to increase her savings to support her husband in paying the children's school fees. She is a member of the group called Gold Trust Group. Members agree to guarantee for one other as social collateral and help each other to repay the loans.

loans.use: To buy bulk gallons of palm oil.

loans.name: Lolonu

texts.fr: Lolonu  A. est âgée de 40 ans, mariée et mère de 5 enfants.  Elle est une commerçante ambulante de produits génériques qu’elle vend en détail à Kpalimé une ville située au sud-ouest du Togo à 120 Km de Lomé la capitale Togolaise. Mme Lolonu est un bon membre puisqu’elle a déjà bénéficié de plus de trois crédits et les remboursements ont été réguliers.Avec ce crédit, elle souhaite approvisionner davantage en produits afin d’être plus compétitive sur le marché des particuliers. Les profits qui se dégageront de son activité lui permettront de supporter les besoins de ses enfants et améliorer ses conditions de vie.
texts.en:
Lolonu A. is 40 years old, married, and the mother of five. She is an itinerant merchant of generic pharmaceutical products, which she sells retail in Kpalimé, a city located in the southwest of Togo and about 120 km from Lomé, the Togolese capital. Ms. Lolonu is a good member, since she has already been the recipient of more than three loans, and the payments have been regular. With this loan, she would like to have more inventory to be more competitive in the private marketplace. The profits that will be derived from her business will enable her to cover the needs of her children and to improve her living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy generic pharmaceuticals for resale

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet E. sells fresh and dried fish where she lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria.  She is 40 years old, married and has 6 children.

Janet loves the fish business because the demand for her product is high.  The dried fish is smoked in fire and this keeps it dry for a long time.  Because of the high demand, Janet needs a loan of $875 to purchase more fish to sell.

Janet says thank you to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To buy more fresh and dried fish to sell

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Juana tiene 54 años, es natural D. un distrito llamado Vilquechico, pero resiD. en la ciudad D. Juliaca casi toda su vida (50 años), es divorciada, así que vive con sus hijos Edita D. 26, José Carlos D. 24 y Julio César D. 22.  Se dedica a la fabricación D. calzado, gracias a las enseñanzas D. sus padres que también se dedicaban a este negocio.  Empieza desD. muy temprano, cociendo, pegando y demás, para que por las tardes pueda contabilizar lo producido y entregar a las personas que hicieron los pedidos, terminando como a las 7 u 8 D. la noche.  Lo que más le gusta D. su trabajo es diseñar los modelos que se realizarán, pero por otro lado el trabajo D. cocido es bastante trabajoso, haciendo que esta sea la parte difícil. Juana desea que sus hijos también formen sus empresas o que alguno, en el caso que le pasara algo, se hiciera cargo del negocio. Con el préstamo solicitado comprará mayor cantidad D. materiales y D. mejor calidad, para hacer D. su negocio el mejor.
texts.en:
Juana is 54 years of age and is originally from the Vilquechco district but has lived in the city of Juliaca for almost all of her life (50 years). She is divorced which is why she lives with her children Edita, a 26 year-old, José Carlos, a 24 year-old, and Julio César, a 22 year-old. She works in the making of shoes thanks to the teachings of her parents who also worked in this business. She starts very early, sewing, gluing and more so that in the afternoons she can account for what she has produced and deliver to people who have placed orders with her, ending at about 7 or 8 at night. What she most likes about her work is designing models that she will later make. On the other hand, the work of sewing is plenty tiresome, making this the hard part. Juana wants for her children to have their own business or that one, in case something happens, can take over her business. With the requested loan she will buy a greater quantity of and better quality materials to maker her business the best.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The Purchase of Better Quality Materials for the Making of Shoes

loans.name: Mujeres En Victoria Group

texts.en:
"Mujeres En Victoria" is the name of a group of 5 women hoping to receive a loan. Marie is the representative of this group, and she plans on starting a business where she will sell different types of food. Initially, Marie will sell things such as rice, beans, and salt, but she hopes that the business will continue to grow in such a way that she can someday have her own colmado (small grocery store).

She states that she needs to change things for the better in her life because she has three young kids to feed. Unfortunately, she and her family have been living in extreme poverty in recent years. She and her husband have been working hard to be able to send all of their children to school, but at times the children need to help make money to ensure that there is food on the family's table. She feels that starting her own business will enable all of her children to attend school and to thereby better their future. Marie is a very hard-working person, and she is confident that she will make this business work! This is just the first step for her to better her life!

loans.use: To start a business by purchasing food products to resell to her customers

loans.name: Nadiya

texts.en:
Nadiya is married and has 4 children. She sells jeans at the central market in Vinogradovo City. Her kiosk is located at the center of the city market. Her gross income is 10,000 UAH per month, and her profit is about 4,000 UAH.

Nadiya has been in this business for 6 years. She decided to start her business because she needed to provide for her growing family. Jeans are has always in demand, so Nadiya decided to sell this kind of goods. She is a hard-working person and desires to develop her business even more.

Nadiya would like to receive a loan of 1,000 UAH for 1 month to purchase winter jeans wear. She hopes that the loan would help her to increase her profit.

loans.use: to increase the assortment of jeans for sale

loans.name: Heng

texts.en: Heng S. is 39 years old and is a rice farmer in Pursat Province, Cambodia. She grows her crop twice per year, in both the dry and rainy seasons. She has been farming for a long time. She is married and the mother of three teenage children, all of whom are students. Her husband, Lim Sokha, is aged 47. He earns a living by driving a motorcycle taxi and is also a bee hunter who sells the honey he finds. Normally he explores for bees in the forest. His motorcycle is Sokha's main way to earn money. Unfortunately it has broken, so he and his wife are applying for a loan to purchase a new motorcycle to replace the existing one and thus fulfill his customers' requirements.

loans.use: to purchase a new motorcycle

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary A. is 50 years old. She is a wife and mother of eight kids. Currently all her kids are in school. She lives with her husband and the children at Koforidua, a suburb of Offinso, in the Ashanti region of Ghana. She loves selling goods, the business through which she obtains her daily source of livelihood.

She has been selling bags of maize, peppers, onions, and tomatoes for eight years to support her family. Maize is one of the favorite cereal foods that supply carbohydrate components in diets. She takes delivery of stock from farmers who provide her with a direct supply. This enables her to avoid middlemen who buy from the farmers and re-sell to her at higher prices. With this loan, she wants to buy bulk supplies of maize, peppers, onions, and tomatoes to serve her customers. She hopes to use part of her profit to keep her kids in school.

Mary believes this will help expand her business to raise more income to help her husband to provide food and finance her children's education. Mary belongs to a village bank called Chance. She hopes to receive GHS 500 to make business progress by restocking her inventory.

loans.use: To buy more bags of maize, peppers, onions, tomatoes, etc.

loans.name: Dalila

texts.es:
Dalila recién empezó, con su hija, su negocio de cabinas públicas de internet, solamente tiene dos meses.
Inicialmente tenía un taller de artesanías junto a su esposo, y así cubrían los gastos de la familia y del hogar. Lamentablemente su esposo se falleció bastante joven, y Dalila tuvo que encontrar otro trabajo. Empezó trabajando en servicios de casa, y luego vendió golosinas, chupetes, gaseosas y detergente como ambulante en Huaycán, su distrito, durante siete años. 
A sus cincuenta y ocho años se ha juntado a su hija para empezar con este negocio nuevo, y también cuenta en el apoyo ella para cubrir sus gastos de subsistencia. En el futuro, esta pensando  poner una vitrina de golosinas en la tienda de Internet.
texts.en:
Dalila started an internet cafe with her daughter just two months ago. Initially, she had an handicrafts workshop with her husband, which they used to cover their family expenses. Unfortunately, her husband died quite young, and Dalila had to find another job. Over the past seven years, she worked in other people's homes and then worked as a traveling saleswoman in Huaycán, selling candy, pacifiers, soft drinks and detergent. At 58 years of age, she has united with her daughter to start this new business, and counts on her to help cover living expenses. In the future, she hopes to put a candy case in her internet cafe.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in internet cafe business

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es: La Sra. Elsa V., se dedica a la atención de su tienda hace 4 años, es ella quien reparte su tiempo tanto a su familia como a su negocio es un persona responsable y trabajadora, trabaja en nuestra institución desde el 2001 mostrando desde siempre puntualidad en sus pagos y seriedad en su trabajo, es la segunda vez que se le otorga un crédito Kiva. Es madre soltera tiene dos hijos en edad escolar.
texts.en:
Mrs. Elsa V. has had her store for 4 years. She divides her time between her family and business. She is a responsible and hard-working person. She has worked with our institute since 2001 always being punctual with her payments and seriousness toward her work. This is the second time that she is receiving a Kiva loan. She is a single mother with two school-aged children.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise (oil, sugar, rice, etc.)

loans.name: Afde No 22 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe Association Femme Développement Entreprise Numéro 22 est constitué de dix femmes, dont la plus jeune a 27 ans et la plus âgée a 57 ans.  Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles élargies au quartier Grand Thiès, une ville de 70 kilomètres de Dakar, le capital de Sénégal.  Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de parenté. Elles exercent presque la même activité de vente de céréales locales.  Elles sont bien expérimentées et très sollicitées dans cette activité. Dans le cadre de l’amélioration de la qualité de leurs services et l’agrandissement de la taille de leurs activités, les membres du groupe confiance ont décidé d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance l’IMCEC.  Elles ont déjà reçu un prêt de groupement auprès de l’IMCEC, et elles l’ont bien remboursé. Elles comptent utiliser ce prêt pour reconstituer leur stock d’arachides, pain de singe (le fruit de Baobab), mil, et oignions qu’elles vont vendre en détail, au comptant au marché grand Thiès.  Elles espèrent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 15,000 CFA ($30) au cours de ce cycle qui sera utilisé pour rembourser les intérêts du prêt, subvenir au besoin de la famille et investir le reste dans les activités.
texts.en:
"Association Femme Développement Entreprise Numéro 22" is a group composed of ten women. The youngest is 27 years old, and the oldest is 57. They live in large traditional extended families in the Grand Thiés district of Thiès, a city located 70 km from Dakar, the capital of Senegal. The women know one another through ties of community and kinship, and they do almost the same work, selling local grains. They are very experienced and in high demand in this field.

With regard to improving the quality of their services and expanding their businesses, the members of this reliance group decided to join the micro-finance institution IMCEC. They had received a group loan from IMCEC before and repaid it.

With this loan, the group members plan to replenish their stock of peanuts, monkey bread (the fruit of the baobab tree), millet, and onions that they will sell retail, cash accepted, at the grand marketplace of Thiès.

The group member hope to realize an average profit of 15,000 francs CFA in the course of this cycle. The profits will be used to make loan interest payments, to provide for the family, and to invest the rest in business.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy local grains

loans.name: Nurali

texts.en:
K. Nurali is 29 years old and is married with three children. Nurali sells confectionery and other foodstuffs in the market. He has been in this business already for ten years. This activity generates the main income for Nurali’s family.

As long as Nurali is very popular in the market selling the fresh and tasty pastry, he tries to maintain a wide range of goods. Thus, today Nurali requests $750 for the term of 12 months for purchasing more confectionery to sell.


More about Tajikistan and IMON International
Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase more confectionary to sell

loans.name: Ronke

texts.en: Ronke O. is 40 years old, married and has two children. She owns a shop where she sells medicines and various provisions. Ronke is applying for this loan to buy more items to sell to her customers. She extends her thanks to the lenders who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To buy more medicines and provisions to sell

loans.name: Elvin Antonio

texts.es: Elvin Antonio S. C. tiene 32 años, es un hombre casado. Tiene 1 hijo a su cargo y asiste a clases. La actividad económica de Elvin es la venta de camarones. Comenzó este negocio hace más de 9 años. Inicio con muy pocos camarones por lo que no tenía mucha experiencia en este negocio y no sabia si realmente tendría algún éxito, algunas veces salía a las calles a ofrecer sus productos con su hijo porque no tenía una persona que lo cuidara, pero aun así con el cansancio de recorrer muchos lugares, su hijo y el visitaban a sus clientes con una sonrisa en su rostro. Actualmente Elvin recurre a un financiamiento destinado para capital de trabajo que se utilizara para la compra de camarones para satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes. El sueño de Elvin es que su hijo logre finalizar sus estudios para que el día de mañana sea un buen profesional.
texts.en:
Elvin Antonio S. C. is a 32-year-old married father with one son, who is in school. Elvin makes a living selling shrimp. He started his business more than nine years ago with very few shrimp because he didn't have much experience and didn't know whether he could really find some success. Sometimes he walked the streets offering his products with his son because he didn't have anyone else who could care for him. But even though they tired from traveling all over, he and his son always received customers with a smile on their faces. Currently he is requesting a loan that he will use to purchase more shrimp to satisfy the demands of his customers. Elvin's dream is for his son to successfully complete his education and one day become a professional.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more shrimp for his business

loans.name: Sor

texts.en: Sor S., 35, is a professional hairdresser who resides in Phnom Penh. She typically makes $8 of profit every day. However she must also support an older father and mother at home. Food prices have soared in the past year as inflation has gotten out of control in Cambodia. To make more money, she is asking for a loan of $500 to purchase hairdressing materials.

loans.use: To purchase hairdressing materials

loans.name: Teresita

texts.es:
Teresita M. B. es una señora de 43 años de edad que vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos uno de 12 y el otro de 17 años. Ellos viven en una comunidad llamada Cimarrón de Santa Teresita de Turrialba, Provincia de Cartago.  Es una pequeña comunidad rural de aproximadamente dos mil habitantes. Sus pobladores se dedican a la producción de leche y la agricultura. Tiene un relieve irregular y mucho del terreno se mantiene como bosque tropical húmedo. Cimarrón se localiza aproximadamente a una hora y media en bus de Turrialba, el centro de comercio más cercano. Sin embargo, varias veces al año el camino se vuelve intransitable por las lluvias

Doña Teresita se dedica a la venta de cosméticos, ropa y perfumes y otros artículos personales casa por casa. Su esposo le ayuda ocasionalmente con el transporte pero él también tiene otros trabajos.

Doña Teresita ha solicitado un microcrédito por un monto de ¢500.000 (Quinientos mil colones) para comprar y vender mercadería en su pueblo. Su negocio va bien pero por falta de dinero no ha podido hacerlo crecer más. Con el préstamo que está solicitando ella espera aumentar las ventas y así mejorar la condición económica de su familia y poder brindarles mayores oportunidades a sus hijos que actualmente están estudiando, uno en la escuela y el otro en el colegio.

Doña Teresita es socia de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Nuevas Esperanzas para Cimarrón, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su tercer préstamo y con él espera continuar creciendo a nivel personal y económico además de participar activamente en la organización de crédito en su comunidad
texts.en:
Teresita M. B. is 43 years old and lives with her husband and two sons, who are 12 and 17. They live in a community called Cimarrón de Santa Teresita de Turrialba, in the Province of Cartago. It is a small rural community with approximately two thousand inhabitants. Most people there are involved in dairy and agriculture. It has a rough landscape, and much of the land around it is a humid tropical forest. Cimarrón is about an hour and a half by bus from Turrialba, the nearest commercial center. However, the road becomes impassible several times a year because of rain.

Teresita sells cosmetics, clothing, perfume, and other personal items door-to-door. Her husband sometimes helps her with transportation, but he also has other jobs.

Teresita has requested a microloan of 500,000 colons to buy and sell merchandise in her town. Her business is going well, but she has not been able to expand it because of lack of money. With the loan she is requesting she hopes to increase sales and improve her family's economic condition. She hopes to give better opportunities to her sons, who are in school.

Teresita is a member of the Empresa de Crédito Comunal Nuevas Esperanzas para Cimmarón (the New Hope for Cimmarón Communal Bank), one of the 100 member organizations of EDESA in Costa Rica. This will be her third loan, and with it she hopes to continue growing on both a personal and economic level, as well as participate actively in the credit organization in her community.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Iverson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy inventory

loans.name: Cusi Ccoyllor De Chinchero Group

texts.es:
Los socios son un número de 18, ellos pertenecen al banco comunal “CUSI CCOYLLOR DE CHINCHERO”, ubicado en el distrito de Chincheros, perteneciente a ala provincia y departamento del Cusco. A una distancia de 40 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco.

Los socios de este banco son personas emprendedoras con muchas ganas de salir adelante, y se dedican a diversas actividades, entre ellas la agricultura (papa, habas, olluco), la ganadería, la crianza de animales menores (cuyes, pollos, gallinas, patos), Nuestros socios requieren el préstamo para reinvertir en sus diferentes negocios menores.

Nuestros socios agradecen y valoran el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio, y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These are the 18 members of the community bank "Cusi Ccoyllor de Chinchero," located in the district of Chincheros, in the province and department of Cusco, about 40 minutes away from the city of Cusco.

The members of this bank are entrepreneurial people with a great desire to succeed. They are involved in various activities, including agriculture (potatoes, beans, and olluco), livestock, and the raising of small animals (guinea pigs, chickens, hens, ducks). Our members need a loan to invest in their different small businesses.

Our members are grateful for and value the loan given by this medium, and promise to comply with the repayment schedule that has been established.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Iverson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital

loans.name: Altantsetseg

texts.en:
Altantsetseg Dayanjalvuu is a cell phone merchant who lives with her parents in the province of Arkhangai. She started the business in 2005. She was able to increase her working capital by 1.5 times due to her sustainable and profitable business. Her family's living condition have improved as a result of her success.

As well as selling cellphones for cash, she took a proactive approach to reach people who don't have cash readily by offering her products through bank loan. In the future, she wants to expand her business and open a grocery store. Altantsetseg is requesting a loan of 3,600,000 MNT to purchase cellphones from UB and Beijing.

loans.use: To purchase more mobile phones for her business

loans.name: Agustin

texts.en:
Agustin S. is from the village of Luksoon, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. He is 34 years old. Agustin is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Agustin owns and operates a motorcycle-transport business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing motorcycle transport services to local community members. Agustin has been engaged in his business for more than two years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Agustin joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Agustin is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This will be the first loan taken out by Agustin from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Sugeydi Pascuala

texts.es: Sugeydi Pascuala vive en la comarca  Paraiso de Aguas Sarcas de Nueva Guinea, trabaja como maestra de primaria en esta comunidad, esta solicitando su 2do crédito a la institución de AFODENIC para construir una  habitación y asi mejorar las condiciones del hogar, con el crédito anterior solo logro comprar materiales de construcciòn y ahora desea cumplir su sueño de construir, esta joven se ha caracterizado por ser una docente  muy responsable, honesta, ha demostrado  buena conducta y moral crediticia,  su esposa trabaja como docente  en la misma comarca donde ellos viven,  son una familia de escasos recursos econòmicos que han luchado para seguir  adelante y para seguir estudiando , actualmente  esta estudiando su ultimo año de magisterio.  Sugeydi sueña con tener una vivienda con mejores condiciones, tener estabilidad laboral, seguir estudiando y salud para su familia.
texts.en:
Sugeydi Pascuala lives in the region Paraiso de Aguas Sarcas of Nueva Guinea. She works as an elementary school teacher in this community. She is requesting her second loan with the institution AFODENIC, to build a room and thus improve the conditions of her home. With the previous loan she bought the building material and now she wants to fulfill her dream and build. This young lady is a very responsible and honest teacher, she has shown good conduct and credit moral. Her husband works as a teacher in the same region where they live. They are a family of limited economic resources who have struggled to get ahead and continue studying. At the moment she is studying her last year to become a certified teacher. Sugeydi dreams of having a more comfortable home, work stability, of continuing to study and health for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a room

loans.name: Maruja

texts.es:
Maruja es socia del Banco Comunal Morenita.
Maruja es conviviente, tiene 33 años y 2 hijos, Maruja tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende verduras, abarrotes, frutas, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Maruja necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar.
Los sueños de Maruja son tener estabilidad económica y brindar educación a sus hijos para que sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Maruja is a member of "Banco Comunal Morenita". She lives with her significant other, is 33 years old and has 2 children. Maruja has a general store at her house where she sells vegetables, groceries, and fruits on a daily basis.

Maruja needs a loan of 2000 soles to be invested in buying rice and sugar. It is her dream to have economic stability and offer schooling to her children so they may become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice and sugar.

loans.name: Vivencia

texts.en:
Vivencia S. is from the village of Basag, San Calos. She is 43 years old. Vivencia is separated from her spouse and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Vivencia owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Vivencia has been engaged in her business for more than three years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Vivencia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Vivencia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase new items to expand her product offering. Vivencia is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Vivencia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Florentina

texts.en:
Florentina D. is already 43 years old and married to Constancio, who works as a carpenter. “Prayer accompanied by hard work” is Florentina's guiding principle . The couple together with their children are happily living in the village of Quezon, San Isidro. Their children are: Jonathan-24 years old, college undergraduate; Jerwin-22 years old; and Jayson-18 years old, who is a high school graduate.

Florentina says that through her business she tries to support her family. But due to the high cost of commodities, the income that she generates from her general store is insufficient for their daily needs, thus she is requesting a loan of Php 5,000, allowing her to make the general store progressive. This amount will serve as a big help in expanding her business and fulfilling her dreams as well.

loans.use: additional capital for business improvement

loans.name: Rachelle

texts.fr: Z. Rachelle est née le 23 Juin 1976 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Mariée à HOUNKPE Sévérin un infirmier, Rachelle est mère d’un enfant qui est scolarisé. En plus de cet enfant, Rachelle a un autre enfant en charge. Il y a trois ans que Rachelle vit avec ses enfants et son conjoint à Cocotomey, non loin de Cotonou. Seul le conjoint de Rachelle assure les charges de la famille. Il y a deux ans de cela que Rachelle mène comme activité, la vente de vêtements  et de sous-vêtements dans sa barraque à son domicile. Rachelle s’approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin ; à Comé et à Lomé au Togo. Rachelle a déjà obtenu de ALIDé, un crédit qui a été bien remboursé. Afin d’augmenter son fonds de roulement et d’agrandir son activité pour satisfaire plus sa clientèle en ces période de préparation des fêtes,  Rachelle sollicite un deuxième crédit de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Z. Rachelle was born on June 23, 1976 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin.  Married to Mr. HOUNKPE Sévérin, who is a nurse, she is the mother of one child who is attending school.  In addition, she has another child to support.  For three years, she has been living with her children and husband in Cocotomey, not far from Cotonou.  Rachelle's husband is the only one ensuring that family expenses are covered.  For two years, Rachelle has been running a business selling clothing and undergarments in a stall at her house.  She supplies herself from Dantokpa, the international market of Benin; from Comé; and from Lomé, Togo. She has had an ALIDé loan before, which has been repaid.  In order to augment her working capital and to expand her business, so as to satisfy her customers further preparing for these holidays, she's requesting a second ALIDé loan.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 4 dozen outfits with blouses and a dozen undergarments

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional stock of phone accesories in bulk

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza R. is a 39-year-old married woman who lives in Cansig-id Banga, Bayawan City, Negros Oriental. She earns her living by raising hogs.
 
Flordeliza’s husband helps her in raising hogs, cows and other animals to sell, and they have five children, some of whom are still in school while the others are adults. They also help their parents in the business as part of their daily chores.

Flordeliza joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1999 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve the quality of life of their family. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD, she has been able to increase their family income by engaging in hog raising and other animals to sell. Now she earns an average monthly income of Php 10,000 from her business activities.

Flordeliza is a member of good standing. Her previous loan of Php 15,000 was used to fund operations of her hog raising and other animals, and had a positive impact on both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now she is borrowing her 14th loan in the amount of Php 15,000, which she  intends to use on her hog raising business. Flordeliza is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which is to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

About NWTF:
  In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of  thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means "Honorable"). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them "Dungganon" -- a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional capital

loans.name: Ayiko Yesco Stella Group

texts.en:
Y. Stella is the group president; she is 35 years old, married, and has five children, three of whom are going to school.

She operates a local brewing business, started twenty years ago. This loan is helping her to raise capital, as she is trying to stock as much as she can of the local brewing ingredients, such as millet, sorghum, yeast, and so forth, for making the local brew to sell. The loan is encouraging Y. to work very hard with no letup.

She is an active and hardworking businesswoman whose dream is to build and to obtain a cow with the increased revenue.

loans.use: To stock local brew ingredients

loans.name: Cornelia's Group

texts.en:
Cornelia O. is from the village of San Isidro. She is 47 years old. Cornelia is the group leader of a 4-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Cornelia is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Cornelia owns & operates egg retailing & pig raising businesses.The main source of income for the business comes from selling eggs in the local community. Cornelia has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Cornelia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cornelia has successfully repaid previous loans from PMPC. Cornelia is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 6th loan taken out by Cornelia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Conforte

texts.fr: Née le 02 Décembre 1984 au Nigéria, Etat voisin du Bénin, K. Conforte est mariée à SAGBO Joseph, un cuisinier. Conforte est mère de deux enfants, mais a un autre enfant à sa charge. Certains des enfants sont scolarisés. La famille s’est installée depuis environs 5 ans à l’Etoile à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la famille. Conforte n’a jamais été à l’école. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges, Conforte vend des biscuits de façon ambulante. Conforte s’approvisionne à Lomé au Togo, pays limitrophe du Bénin. C’est depuis 4 ans que Conforte mène cette activité. C’est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé qui rembourse bien ses crédits. Conforte a eu quelques difficultés financières lors du remboursement de son crédit passé, à la suite de la brûlure de son enfant qui l’a conduit à des dépenses. Aujourd’hui, Conforte ambitionne agrandir son activité afin de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle et de se faire plus de revenu à la hauteur de ses charges. C’est la raison pour laquelle Conforte sollicite un autre crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Conforte K. was born on December 2, 1984, in Nigeria, a country that borders Benin. She's married to Joseph SAGBO, a cook. She's the mother of two children, and has another child to support. Some children attend school. For approximately five years, the family has been living in l'Etoile in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. The couple supports the family together. Conforte never attended school. To provide for herself, she sells biscuits as an ambulant saleswoman. She gets her supplies in Lomé, Togo, a country that border Benin. She's been running this business for four years. She's a previous client of Kiva's partner, ALIDé, who repays her loans without problems. Conforte experienced some financial difficulties when repaying her previous loan: one of her child got burned, a situation which induced expenses. Today, she ambitions to expand her business in order to better satisfy her customers and raise her income to match her expenses. This is why Conforte is seeking another loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy boxes of biscuits

loans.name: Aura Mercedes

texts.es:
La señora Aura Mercedes T. tiene su negocio en su casa  de habitación vende ropa nueva y usada, sus financiamientos los ocupa para comprar ropa ya que ella entrega conforme a pedido.
Tiene dos hijas ambas en edad escolar, trabaja de lunes a domingo buscando pedido en su clientes sus hijas le ayudan a vender a ella, anteriormente ella era doméstica y vendía ambulante manzanas y uvas dentro del mercado siempre hemos luchado mi esposo me ayuda con lo de la casa  tiene cuatro años de trabajar con ceprodel y nos dijo que le hemos ayudado mucho porque gracias a Dios y  a la institución a sacado adelante su negocio y preparar a sus hijas a poco a poco.
texts.en:
Aura Mercedes T. sells new and used clothing from home; she uses her loans to buy clothing since she delivers based on prior orders. She has two, school-age daughters. She works Monday to Sunday taking orders from her customers. Her daughters help her sell. She used to work as a domestic and sold apples and grapes in the market. "My husband and I have always struggled; he helps me with household expenses." She has collaborated with Ceprodel for four years and she told us that we have helped her much because, thanks be to God, the institution has made it possible for her business to succeed and has helped her to prepare her daughters little by little.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To fill orders for men's and women's clothing.

loans.name: Yrma

texts.es:
La Sra. Yrma, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Hacia el Futuro II”, del Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martín y Departamento de San Martín. Es Soltera, tiene 58 años y es madre 04 hijos, todos independientes.

Yrma de dedica a la venta de comidas preparadas (Menú) , ubicada en su casa un lugar amplio y acondicionado donde atiende a diario a su clientela . Con el primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles, invirtió en comprar pollos en javas, aceite en litros, condimentos para el aderezo de sus preparados y utensilios de cocina, así empezó su pequeño negocio. 

Con el préstamo de S/1,000.00 Nuevos Soles comprará, arroz y azúcar en kilos, aceite en litros, papa, cebolla, zanahoria en kilos, utensilios de cocina, ollas, vasos, platos y cubiertos para dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes. Ella se siente con muchas fuerzas aun a pesar de su edad.

Yrma, manifiesta su agradecimiento a Manuela Ramos por permitirle crecer como empresaria y Mujer. Su sueño es tener un Restaurant grande
texts.en:
Mrs. Yrma belongs to the “Women Looking to the Future II” Community Bank in the Tarapoto District, in the Province of San Martín, in the Department of San Martín. She is single, 58 years old and the mother of four children who are all independent. Yrma sells prepared food from her house. Her house is a spacious place with air conditioning. She sells the food each day to her customers. With her first loan of 300.00 new soles she bought chicken, liters of oil, condiments for the adornment of her meals and kitchen utensils. This is how she began her small business. With this loan of 1,000.00 new soles she will buy rice and sugar by the kilo, oil by the liter, potatoes, onions, carrots by the kilo, kitchen utensils, pots, glasses, plates and silverware in order to provide better service to her customers. She has a lot of energy in spite of her age. Yrma is thankful to Manuela Ramos for allowing her to flourish as a businessperson and a woman. Her dream is to have a big restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy ingredients to use in food preparation.

loans.name: Angelita Del Carmen

texts.es: La Señora Angelita G. se desempeña en el bello arte de la costura, ella realiza diferentes variedades de diseño, su negocio está ubicado en el Municipio de Nindirí, con los ingresos que le genera esta actividad logra mantener a su familia, tiene un hijo que está en la Universidad y ella le provee los gastos para su carrera ya que ella quiere que el cumpla sus sueños de ser un profesional. Ella se ha acercado a CEPRODEL a solicitar nuevamente crédito el que lo ocupará para  la compra de tela como satín strech, dacron strech, linos e insumos ella se muestra satisfecha porque siente que le ha ayudado bastante ya que con este dinero puede cubrir la demanda de sus clientes y así poder ella tener un buen nivel de vida junto a su familia.
texts.en:
Sra. Angelita G. engages in the fine art of sewing, producing different varieties of designs. Her business is located in the town of Nindirí. With the revenue that she generates, she is able to support her family. She has a son who is attending the university and provides for his expenses so that he can obtain his degree. Angelita wants him to fulfill his dream of becoming a professional.

She came to CEPRODEL in order to request a new loan to buy fabrics such as stretch satin, stretch dacron, linens, as well as supplies. Angelita is satisfied with the loans because the money has helped her with meeting the demands of her customers and achieving a good standard of living for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabrics & supplies

loans.name: Douglas Felipe

texts.es:
el sr. Douglas Felipe M. es un tipico San Marqueño como comunmente se les conoce, trabajador y muy amable.
Douglas se dedica a la fabricacion y venta de botas baqueras, las que son bien aceptadas en la zona y las cuales 
tambien vende en otras ciudades del pais.
tiene 43 años de edad y 23 años de dedicarce a este tipo de actividad, el que asegura hace con mucho gusto.
es padre de 2 hijos que estan estudiando.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar materia prima asi como algunas herramientas para su taller.
texts.en:
Douglas Felipe M. is a typical San Marqueño (someone from San Marcos), as they are commonly known: very hard-working and kind. He makes and sells cowboy boots which are very well received in his area and which he also sells in other cities throughout the country. He is 43 years old and has been in this line of work for 23 years; he tells us that he enjoys his work very much and does it quite happily. He has two children who are students. He will use the funds to buy raw materials as well as some tools for his workshop.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy leather, polish, brushes, thread, sponges and tools.

loans.name: Elda Maritza

texts.es: Elda Maritza tiene 33 años de edad. No es la primera vez que obtiene este tipo de experiencia de financiamientos, pues para ellas han sido lo más indispensables en su vida para mejorar su negocio. Es madre soltera. Tiene 4 hijos a su cargo. Ella se dedica es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica a este negocio, para Elda no fue fácil realizar este trabajo ya que no tenía suficiente experiencia al ofrecer sus productos a los clientes esto es algo que ella ha logrado aprender con el tiempo, para ella lo más difícil pues también es Madre y tiene que atender a sus hijos. Pues ella ha puesto de todo su empeño por mejorar. Solicita un financiamiento destinado para capital de trabajo para la compra de cosméticos, ropa, colonias, sandalias, toallas y sabanas. El deseo de ella es mejorar cada día en la buena atención que ofrece a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Elda Maritza is 33 years old. This is not the first time she has obtained this type of financing, and this access to credit has been indispensable to her in improving her business prospects.
