She is a single mother with 4 children in her care. She dedicates herself to selling general merchandise, an activity she has carried out for more than 5 years. It was not easy for Elda to realize this type of work, as she didn’t have enough experience in how to offer her products to customers. This is something she has managed to learn over time. The hardest part for her is also being a mother, and having to work and simultaneously care for her children. She has put forth all her effort to get ahead. She requests a loan to serve as working capital for the purchase of cosmetics, clothing, colognes, sandals, towels and sheets. Her wish is to make strides each day in the level of service she offers her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy local produce to resell.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth M. is from the village of Malibud, Gingoog City. She is 48 years old. Elizabeth is married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Elizabeth owns & operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling vegetables  in the local community. Elizabeth has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Elizabeth joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elizabeth has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Elizabeth is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will also be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Elizabeth from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Elvio

texts.es:
El  señor es soltero, tiene 45 años de edad, el mismo es corredor  de quiniela (venta de juegos de azar), realiza sus ventas por toda la zona de Pilar; también es dueño de una empresa, taller de construcción de obras civiles donde realizan trabajos de todo tipo, como ser construcciones de obras civiles, reparaciones,etc. El Cliente cuenta con casa propia en el barrio Crucecita, en su residencia particular se refleja que cuenta con todas las comodidades para el bienestar de su vida cotidiana.
Solicita el crédito para invertir en la compra de ladrillos, cementos, mezcladoras y otros materiales que utilizara en las construcciones.
texts.en:
This man is 45 years old and single. He is a “quiniela” (Spanish equivalent of the football pools) agent (the sale of games of chance). He makes his sales all over the Pilar area. He also has a business, which is a shop for the construction of public works. They do all types of construction of public works and repairs, etc. He has his own house in the Crucecita neighborhood. Said residence has all of the amenities for convenience in his daily life. He is requesting a loan to buy bricks, cement, mixers, and other materials; which he will use on construction jobs.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials

loans.name: Soraya Cecilia

texts.es:
Cecilia tiene 24 años de edad vive en el kilometro tres y medio a la carretera a Sacaba una provincia de la ciudad de Cochabamba, ella vive con su madre y con su abuelita, estudio Fisioterapia trabaja con personas de escasos recursos en hospitales de la ciudad.

Cecilia mantiene a su madre  y su abuelita que son personas mayores, el papá de Cecilia les abandono cuando ella tenía tres años de edad y se quedo con su madre y su abuela, ella se puso a trabajar desde muy niña para poder estudiar y poder ayudar a su madre en la enfermedad de su abuelita la cual tiene reumatismo, ella trata de ayudar  en todo lo que puede a su abuela ya que el tratamiento con el traumatólogo es muy caro las consultas y los medicamentos para calmar los dolores que tiene.

Cecilia solicita el crédito para comprar materiales de trabajo con los cuales puede realizar sus terapias ya que ella tiene un consultorio en su  casa donde realiza las terapias, de la misma manera ella va realizar sus trabajo a domicilio de sus pacientes, trata de trabajar lo mas que puede para tener más ingresos con los cuales ayudaría mucho los gastos que tienen en casa, Cecilia es una persona muy responsable y trabajadora.

Ella en futuro quiere tener una clínica con la cual ayudara a todas las personas que vayan a necesitar fisioterapias y tratamientos en los cuales ella pueda realizarse como profesional, ella sueña con brindarle mejor vejes a su madre ya que es la persona que siempre está con ella y que siempre tuvo su apoyo tanto moral como económico, Doña Delina quiere que su hija tenga un futuro mejor que la que tuvo ella que pueda encontrar una persona con la cual realice su  vida y pueda tener familia y ser muy feliz.
texts.en:
Cecilia is 24 years old, and lives with her mother and grandmother on the outskirts of the Sacaba district of Cochabamba. She studied Physiotherapy and works with people of limited resources in the hospitals around the city. She looks after her mother and elderly grandmother; her father abandoned them when Cecilia was three years old. She has been working since she was very young to be able to help her mother, who is sick, and her grandmother, who suffers from rheumatism. Cecilia tries to help her grandmother however she can, because the visits to the specialist, and the medicines she has to take for the pain, are very expensive. Cecilia is seeking the loan to buy materials for her therapy work. She already runs a clinic at home where she can treat patients, just as she does when she visits them at their homes. She is trying to work as much as possible and maximise her income so she can help as much as she can with the household exprenses. Cecilia is a very responsible, hard-working woman. In the future, she would like to have a surgery where she can help everyone who comes needing physiotherapy treatment. She dreams of offering her mother a better old age, because she is always there for her and gives her moral support as much as economic support. Her mother, Doña Delina, says she wants her daughter to have a better future than she had. She hopes Cecilia will meet someone to spend her life with, have a family and be very happy.

Translated from Spanish by Rosa Oswald, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy medical supplies for physiotherapy

loans.name: Tomas Segundo

texts.en:
Tomas Segundo C. I. is 33 years old. He lives with his 3 children, aged 3, 17 and 18, in San Miguel canton, in the province of Bolivar.

Tomas is a member of the rural loan group called “Hope of the sower”, which is located 2 hours away from San Miguel. There are 14 group members, who are dedicated to agriculture: corn, beans, potatoes and blackberries mostly.

Tomas is a farmer. He cultivates blackberries, beans and potatoes. He purchases and sells his products in the town of San Pablo (an hour away from where he lives). Blackberries sell weekly, and potatoes and beans once a year.

Tomas requests this loan to buy fertilizers (chemical and organic ones). He thinks this credit will help him purchase what he needs. His dream is to buy more land and enable his children to study. He faces major challenges with crop diseases, such as “lanchas” in corn and beans, that endanger the harvest

He likes to play volleyball and indoor soccer in his free time.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers (chemical and organic ones)

loans.name: Sindiya (Consanguinité) Group

texts.fr:
Sindiya est un regroupement de femme du premier quartier de Koutiala (région de Sikasso) qui se connaissent bien et qui vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents. Elles ont en moyenne 35 ans, sont mariées et mères d’au moins 4 enfants.
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels, le charbon de bois, le  bois de chauffe, les habillements,  les céréales, les légumes etc. 
Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso il y a 2 ans. Elles sont à leur troisième prêt de groupe et tous les prêts précédents  ont été bien remboursés. 
Awa C. qui est un membre du groupe Sindiya, fait du commerce d’articles divers tels le charbon de bois, les condiments alimentaires, le bois de chauffe, les légumes, etc.  
Elle compte utiliser son prêt actuel pour acheter, des chargements de charrettes en charbon de bois et en bois de chauffe et des  fruits et légumes (concombre, gombo, papaye, ignames, etc). 
Elle se procure  de ces marchandises auprès des  paysans producteurs dans les différents marchés hebdomadaires tels Zangasso, Koro barrage et Dogonasso. Elle vend le charbon  de bois en détail et au comptant  à une clientèle diverse et variée, quant aux légumes, ils sont vendus en gros au fur et à mesure à une clientèle composée de revendeuses. 
Tandis que Les membres du groupe Sindiya comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 120 000FCFA  chacune au  cours de ce cycle Awa C. compte réaliser 160 000FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
Sindiya is a group of women from the first neighborhood of Koutiala (region of Sikasso) who know each other well and who live in large traditional families with their husbands, children and other parents. They are on average 35 years old, married and the mothers of at least 4 children each. This group of women runs businesses selling various goods such as charcoal, firewood, clothing grains, vegetables, etc. To increase the size of their businesses, the members decided to join the loan program Soro Yiriwaso 2 years ago. They are on their third group loan, having fully paid back all of their previous ones. Awa C., who is a member of the group Sindiya, runs a business selling various goods such as charcoal, condiments, firewood, vegetables. etc. She expects to use her loan to buy cartloads of charcoal and firewood and fruits and vegetables (cucumber, okra, papaya, yams, etc). She gets her merchandise from peasant farmers in the different weekly markets, such as Zangasso, Koro barrage and Dogonasso. She sells charcoal for retail and for cash to a varied and diverse customer base; as for the vegetables, they are sold wholesale as one goes along to a client base made up of resellers. While the members of the group Sindiya expect to make an average profit of 120,000 FCFA each during the course of the loan, Awa C. expects to make 160,000 FCFA. Besides paying back the loans, they will use a part of their income to deal with their families' current expenditures.

Translated from French by Martha Schmitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of various goods

loans.name: Swagila

texts.en:
Swagila is married with four children and all of them are at school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members.  She lives in Najjanankumbi, along the Entebbe road and that is also where she works from. Swagila owns a shop selling second hand clothes. She buys these clothes from the Owino market and uses public transport to and from shopping. She goes shopping for supplies once a week. 

Swagila wants to use this loan to buy more bales of second hand clothes.  She has been in this business for over ten years.  She sells to all categories of people but mainly women.  She has no additional source of livelihood and works six days a week.  She depends on this job for a living. 

She resides in and rents a house which has electricity and piped water. She aspires to import second hand clothes and also building her own house. She decided to work with MCDT because of their good  customer care.   Her business  challenges are transportation and seasonality. She resides in and rents a two roomed house and the family has access to electricity and piped water.   Her monthly expenses includes food, rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bales of second hand clothes

loans.name: Mercedes Lorena

texts.es:
En las afueras de  Portoviejo, ciudad hermosa con un clima agradable y con una rica variedad de platos típicos. Encontramos el Banco Comunal  Los  Ángeles que se reúnen cada quince días.

Aquí conversamos con la señora Mercedes, desde hace ocho años se separo de su marido y ahora es padre y madre de dos hijos, los cuales son menores de edad y están estudiando en el colegio. Vive con sus hijos en la casa de su mama y comenta que tiene que luchar mucho para que a sus hijos no les falte nada.

Es así como un día empezó a vender productos de Hervalife (productos naturales) entre los productos que mas vende están los adelgazantes, vitaminas, crema de baba de caracol, entre otros. Su forma de vender es puerta a puerta aunque ya tiene sus clientes fijos. Trabaja cuatro horas al día todos los días, aprovecha cuando sus hijos están en el colegio ya que después tiene que atenderlos.

Este crédito lo va a utilizar en comprar adelgazantes y vitaminas por que tiene muchos pedidos. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace tres años.
 
Su meta es tener su propia casa y sacar a sus hijos adelante.
texts.en:
In the suburbs of Portoviejo, a beautiful city with an agreeable climate and with a rich variety of regional dishes we find the "Los Ángeles" Communal Bank which meets every fortnight. Here we speak with Mercedes, she separated from her husband eight years ago and now is father and mother to two children, who are young and are studying at school. She lives with her children at her mother's house and comments that she has to really struggle so that her children do not lack anything. And so she started to sell Hervalife (natural products). The products that she sells the most are the weight-loss products, vitamins, wrinkle creams among others. She sells door to door although she has some regular customers. She works four hours per day every day, taking advantange of the time when her children are in school since she has to look after them after school. This loan will be used to buy weight-loss products and vitamins because she has a lot of orders. She has belonged to the Communal Bank for three years. Her goal is to have her own home and give her children a good start in life.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy weight-loss products and vitamins.

loans.name: Hadicha

texts.ru: Очилдиева Хадича проживает в районе Шахритуз. Возраст, 26 лет. Разведена, детей не имеет. Живет вместе с родителями. Образование среднее. Занимается животноводством. Разводит скот в дальнейшем для перепродажи. В этой области более 4 лет. Кредит берет для закупа крупно - рогатого скота, чтобы увеличить их количество.
texts.en:
Hadicha O. lives in the Shahrituz district. She is 26 years old, divorced and has no children. She lives together with her parents. Hadicha has a secondary education. She is inolved in animal husbandry and breeds livestock for future resale. She has been in this field for over 4 years. Hadicha is requesting this loan for the purchase of cattle in order to increase its quantity.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cattle

loans.name: Robinah

texts.en:
A serious work ethic is a sure means of success in any business.  With diligence, one will always progress, even when the status quo of the business is not really up to the mark. 52-year-old, self-assured Byakika Robinah carries the conviction that hard work will always keep her head and shoulders above her competition in her chalk manufacturing and sales business in Namizzi East-Jinja.   Her business has now lasted 3 years. 

This likable single mother of four says her first business was an outside catering service. She opened new horizons for herself when she diligently set forth in this business. In a month, her profits total  450,000 shillings and she is requesting this loan to be able to revamp her business with the purchase of better chalk making equipment. By and large she wants to improve the operation of her business with this Kiva loan.

loans.use: The purchase of better chalk manufacturing machines and overall improvement of her business

loans.name: Joshua Tadeo

texts.es:
Joshua M. vive en departamento de Jinotega. Es soltero  y muy emprendedor y trabaja actualmente buscando la manera de llevar el sustento a su mesa.

Se ha propuesto la meta de comprar algunos electrodomésticos para su uso en su casa de habitación y es por este motivo que está solicitando el crédito esperando que le sea otorgado y así mejorar sus condiciones de vida tanto para él como para los familiares con quienes vive.
texts.en:
The customer, Joshua Tadeo M. Páez, lives in the Jinotega department, Llano de la Cruz section, 50-Vrs monument towards Jinotega.  He is a single man who currently works for the Santa Rosa del Peñon Municipality as a project technician.  He has worked for 3 years with that organization.
The customer has his own home, which he wishes to work on. 
The purpose of the loan is to buy appliances to improve his home and make his family more comfortable.
This will enable the customer to have a better life with his family.

loans.use: Compra de Electro Domestico

loans.name: Kai A.'s Group

texts.en:
Salone Micronfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you teachers of the R.C Musaia primary school near Kabala town. This school was founded in 1954 to educate the children of Mosaia village. Today, the school is staffed with eight teachers and has 450 pupils. This school is proud itself as the most organised, clean school, with an up-to-date record keeping system - an award given to the school by UNICEF.

Staff from various schools and other government offices within SMT's operational areas come to SMT to seek loans. At the end of each month, these institutions' bursar is directly responsible for deducting the repayment from their salaries and pays SMT on their behalf. With the help of these loans, these teachers can do or buy things that their mere salaries alone can not do or buy. 

The leader of this group of teachers is Kai A. G.. The fifty-year-old Kai was born in Kono, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. He is married and has seven children who are attending school. Mr. G. is going to use his share of this loan to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: Pay school fees for his children

loans.name: Luchadoras Group

texts.es:
Es  un comité conformada por 11 mujeres, la compañía Lomai; todas estas mujeres han manifestado que es la primera vez que han escuchado de la Fundacion Paraguaya y admiraron el préstamo para mujeres, ellas se encuentran motivados por la oportunidad.
      La presidenta del Comté es la Sra. Justina B. y se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo familiar.
Ella es una señora muy trabajadora por que ademas de su negocio ella cuenta con crias de varios animales, como gallinas, cerdos,  vacas, todos para el consumo de la familia y otras para vender.
Comenta que el negocio es muy importante para ella ya que cubre todos los gastos de alimentacion de la familia y desea continuar con un negocion bien surtido y completo para sus clientes.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de mercaderias para su despensa como harina, fideos, azúcar, lácteos, panificados, y otros.

     Todas las integrantes del comité son trabajadoras  en su zona quienes se dedican a la agricultura agradecen a la fundacion Paraguaya la oportunidad que les da para ir creciendo.
texts.en:
Lomai Company is a group of eleven women. This is the first time this group has joined The Paraguayan Foundation. They were attracted to this organization’s loans to women. They decided to take advantage of this opportunity.
   The president of the committee is Mrs. Justina. She sells items that are commonly used by families. She is a hardworking woman. In addition to this business she raises young animals such as chickens, pigs and cows. Her family consumes some to the animals and she sells the rest.
She says that this business is very important to her as it covers the cost of feeding her family. 
She would like to have a good assortment of items in her store to sell to her customers. She is asking for this loan in order to buy merchandise for her store such as flour, noodles, sugar, milk products, bread and other items.
All of these members are part of a hardworking committee located in an agricultural zone of Paraguay. They are thankful to the Paraguayan Foundation, which provides them with the opportunity for future growth.

loans.use: She will buy flour, noodles, sugar, milk products, breads and other items.

loans.name: Mujeres En Desarrollo 1, 2 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Mercedes is one of the members of her group Mujeres en Desarrollo 1, 2 & 3 (Development women). Mercedes makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and one child. She says that her most difficult challenges are to work hard and have a better life. In the meantime, she plans to continue enjoying upholstering.

Mercedes is excited to be taking her 5th loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She has had her business for 5 years, starting by taking a technical class in upholstering. She operates an upholstery  business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying fabrics, wood, and other items. She will use the profits to invest in her business. The Christmas season is better because people like to upholster their furniture and buy new furniture, too.

This Esperanza associate began with us because she needed capital for her business. Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally, many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti. Her group is located in San Pedro D. Macoris, a city famous for baseball players and sugar cane industries. The main economic activities are a free traD. zone and a cement factory. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas in the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity which can't be counted on.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, wood and other items

loans.name: Bayasgalan

texts.en:
Bayasgalan R. is 47 years old and lives with his wife and two sons in Uvurhangai province, Mongolia. His youngest son attends a local high school. He and his family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent.
Bayasgalan operates a raw material trading and transportation business in his local town. He has been engaged in this business since 2004 after moving to his current town. He purchases a variety of raw materials from the countrysides and transports those products to his local town in order to sell them as a retailer. His wife helps him with the business. He transports loads between Uvurhangai and Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. After years of operation, he has gained much experience as a driver and has built a stable operation. Bayasgalan says, "I want to expand my business further and my dream is to have my own shop in the future." He is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan in order to purchase more coal and wood to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more coal and wood for resale

loans.name: Confiance Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe CONFIANCE sont essentiellement des  femmes mariées  avec une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans  et 2 enfants. Elles  vivent  dans des familles monogames à OUAYERMA I  un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur douzième  collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle.  Tous les prêts précédents ont été  bien soldés. Elles font la vente de condiments et de la restauration.  KADI S. qui est la présidente du groupe excelle dans l’achat vente des condiments alimentaires.  
Avec son nouveau prêt, elle compte acheter 15 colis de condiments.  Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché  de Sikasso.
Elle vend à domicile et dans  les villages voisins, au comptant  souvent à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
 Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 48.500 FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour l’épargne et les besoins de la famille, l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
texts.en:
The ten members of the group CONFIANCE are essentially married women averaging 35 years of age and two children.  They lives in monogamous families in OUAYERMA I, a district in Sikasso City (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The group members are on their twelfth collaboration with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to meet the needs of their customers.  All the previous loans have been settled. The women of the group sell condiments, and they work in food service.  

KADI S., who is the group’s president, excels in buying and selling condiments for cooking.  With her new loan, she is planning to buy 15 packs of condiments.  She gets her supplies at the big market of Sikasso.  Accepting cash and often credit from a customer base composed of men and women, she sells out of her home and in neighboring village.  KADI envisions making an average monthly profit of 48,500 francs CFA.  Part of the profits will be put into savings and used to meet family needs.  The other part will be invested in her business.

loans.use: Buying condiments for cooking

loans.name: Jamal

texts.ar:
جمال في عمر 30 سنة يعمل في محل لبيع قطع السيارات المستعملة والجديدة له في عمله 10 سنوات متزوج وله ولدان يحب عمله
يريد دائما التجديد في العمل هو طموح مثابر يسعى الى التطور والتقدم يريد تأمين العيش الكريم له ولعائلته له تاريخ جيد
وكان يلقى دائما الدعم المعنوي والمادي يريد من خلال طلب قرض له من المجموعة الى تقوية المصلحة وشراء معدات جديدة وبضائع
texts.en: Jamal is a 30-year-old husband and father of two who strives to secure a dignified life for his family and who in turn is showered with their moral and physical support. Jamal has ten years of experience selling parts for new and used automobiles. He is very gung ho about his work and is always trying to improve. Given his good standing with Al Majmoua, Jamal wanted to apply for another loan to purchase new equipment and merchandise for his business.

loans.use: To purchase spare car parts for reselling

loans.name: Nyadzua

texts.en:
Nyadzua is a married woman with five children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

She has operated a firewood selling business for the past one year, selling to her neighbours. In addition she also operates a food stall business which contributes to her other source of income. Nyadzua faces a major challenge with the high cost of transportation in her business. She hopes to expand and establish another business in the future.

With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase bundles of firewood for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of firewood for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase gardening materials and set up a flower nursery

loans.name: Jose Herbert

texts.es:
José de 25 años de edad, reside en Concepción  Batres, departamento de Usulután, vive con su esposa, poseen casa propia, él trabaja realizando viajes en moto taxi, desde hace 2 años.

Él actualmente tiene dificultades con su medio de transporte por lo que solicita un préstamo para llevar la moto taxi al mecánico, para hacerle la respectiva revisión y mantenimiento, este préstamo le será muy útil pues él no cuenta con los fondos necesarios para realizar la reparación.

Su objetivo es mantener la moto taxi en buenas condiciones, para dar a sus clientes un mejor servicio, cómodo y seguro, al mismo tiempo esta asegurando trabajo para vario tiempo y ganancias para su hogar.
texts.en:
José is 25 years old and lives in Concepción Batres, in Usulután department, with his wife.  They own their own home.  He has been providing transport services with his 'mototaxi' (a motorbike with a cabin in back for transporting passengers) for 2 years.

José is currently experiencing problems with his vehicle and is requesting a loan so that he can take his mototaxi to the garage so that it can have its inspection and service.  This loan will be very useful to him as he doesn't have the money he needs to have his vehicle repaired.

José's goal is to keep his mototaxi in good condition so that he can provide his customers with a better service that is both comfortable and safe.  At the same time, he is ensuring work and money for his household.

loans.use: To have his mototaxi serviced and repaired

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” CHOQUEQUIRAO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco,  perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Sonia; la socia tiene 31 años de edad, casada y tiene 2 hijos; la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de compra y venta de materiales de construcción como arena, piedras entre otros, la socia lleva años en este negocio el cual trabaja conjuntamente con su esposo, la socia es una persona bien alegre y con muchas ganas de salir adelante.

La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales de construcción para así poder tener más variedad de productos que ofrecer a sus clientes.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Sra. Sonia is a member of the Communal Bank “Choquequirao” which is located in the District, Province, and Department of Cusco.

She is 31 years old, married, and has two children. Sonia divides her time between her daily activities and managing her construction materials business. She buys and sells sand, stones, and other products. Sonia has been in this business for several years and works with her husband. She is a cheerful person and has tremendous desire to succeed. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy construction materials so that she can offer a wider variety of products to her customers.

Sonia is happy with the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Lesvia Neris

texts.es:
La señora Lesvia Neris P. H. tiene 44 años de edad, vive en el barrio Alto de los Toros de la ciudad de San Lorenzo y se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo diario, ademas vende ropa americana y calzado.
Su pulperia la tiene ubicada en su casa de habitacion, la ropa y el calzado los vende en diferentes colonias y barrios de San Lorenzo.
La señora Lesvia utilizara el credito para comprar abarroteria al por mayor, asi tendra mas surtida su pulperia y generara mas ganancias.
su meta es hacer crecer su negocio y que este le genere buenos ingresos para mejorar su calidad de vida y la de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Lesvia Neris P. Hernández, 44, lives in the Alto de los Toros neighborhood in the city of San Lorenzo; she sells groceries and also American clothing and shoes.  Her grocery store is located in her home and she sells the clothes and shoes in various neighborhoods of San Lorenzo.

Lesvia will use the loan to buy assorted groceries at wholesale so that her store will be better stocked thus generating more profits.

Her goal is to have her business grow and that it generates good income for better quality of life for herself and her children.

loans.use: to buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es: Maribel tiene 26  años y es soltera. Vive en casa propia y tiene 03 hijos menores. Reside en el caserío Tranca Fanupe, ubicado a 20 minutos de la ciudad de Mórrope en el norte de Perú. Maribel gana la vida alquilando su mototaxi, la cual le reporta una ganancia diaria. Alquila su mototaxi a conductores en su caserío y zonas aledañas. Maribel también posee una bodega que funciona en su domicilio. Allí ofrece en venta a los vecinos y clientes de la zona diversos productos de consumo diario, entre productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes. El negocio cuenta con muy buena acogida debido a la buena calidad de los productos que ofrece y a la buena atención que brinda. Adicionalmente se dedica a la venta de aves de corral como pavos, patos y gallinas. Gracias a estas actividades ella ha podido mantener a su familia y sacarla adelante. Solicita un crédito para ayudar con el mantenimiento de su mototaxi. También desea comprar más abarrotes para su bodega. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles. Maribel ha manejado préstamos en el pasado y pagó sus cuotas de manera puntual.
texts.en:
Maribel is 26 years old and single. She lives in her own home with her three young children in the village of Tranca Fanupe, which is 20 minutes away from the city of Mórrope in northern Peru.

Maribel earns her living by renting out a motorcycle taxi that generates a daily income. The vehicle is rented out to drivers in her village and in the surrounding areas. Maribel also has a store that she manages from her home. There she offers her neighbors and local customers different everyday consumer products as well as good service. In addition, she raises poultry such as turkeys, ducks, and hens. Thanks to these business activities she is able to support her family and move them forward.

Maribel is requesting a loan to help with maintaining her motorcycle taxi. She also wants to buy more groceries for her store. For this reason, she is requesting a loan of 1000 PEN from Edpyme Alternativa. Maribel has handled loans in the past and submitted her payments on time.

loans.use: To repair her motorcycle taxi and acquire more merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Fatumah

texts.en:
Fatumah N. is 21 years old and lives in the town of Kireka in the Kampala central region of Uganda.  She is single and has no children. Fatumah has had a business selling clothes for two years.         

To help expand her business, Fatumah has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more clothes for resale. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Fatumah hopes to generate greater profits and take care of herself.  In the future, Fatumah hopes to own a big boutique.  Fatumah is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by helping her become self employed.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Delvis Joel

texts.es:
Delvis tiene 19 años de edad, vive con su madre. Su casa está  ubicada en el sector de Licapa,  una zona rural del distrito de Paijan en el departamento de La Libertad   , 

Delvis se dedica a ofrecer servicios de transporte público, en una mototaxi (moto con una cabina para transportar personas). Delvis tiene más de 2 años dedicándose a esta labor donde ha ganado experiencia en el rubro y tiempo en el cual  ha adquirido clientela fija.

Delvis esta solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para que  pueda darle mantenimiento al motor de su mototaxi haci como también el cambio de carpa y algunas piezas 

Delvis cuenta con muy buenas referencias  por parte de sus vecinos y conocidos , lo consideran una persona trabajadora y responsable.
texts.en:
Delvis is 19 years old and lives with his mother.  Their home is located in Licapa sector, a rural area of Paijan district, in La Libertad department.

Delvis offers a public transport service in a motorcycle taxi (a motorcycle with a cabin for transporting passengers).  Delvis has been in this business for more than two years.  He has gained experience and, over time, he has also acquired regular customers.

Delvis is requesting a loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa so that he can have the engine of his motorcycle taxi serviced.  He also needs to replace the canopy and some other pieces.

Delvis has very good references from his neighbors and acquaintances who consider him to be a hard-working and responsible person.

loans.use: to have his engine serviced and to renew the canopy on his motorcycle taxi as well as some other parts

loans.name: Ambrose

texts.en:
Ambrose is a farmer from Kitale town in western Kenya. He has been practicing mixed farming for the last 6 years and employs one farmhand. He sells his milk, tomatoes, and beans to the local market. He mainly depends on the income from his farm to cater to the basic needs of his family. Ambrose is 37 years old and married with five children.

He has requested for this loan of 31,200 Kes through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income from the sale of milk will enable him to improve the living standards of his family. His biggest challenge has been competition from other farmers and this has affected the market prices of farm products. He however hopes to expand his farm and improve the quality of his dairy cows in the near future.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua sells boodo — a local, baked dish made from flour, sugar, maize and other ingredients — at Ankwanda near Elmina. She is married and has five dependants. Her husband is a fisherman. Efua has been selling boodo, for 10 years. She supports her husband in providing for the daily needs of the family. Her loan will be used to buy flour, suagr, and maize. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy flour, suagr, and maize.

loans.name: Kings Of Kings Group

texts.en: Fatuma, 34 years old, has operated a retail shop in Lugazi for the last decade. The mother of 5 says she began this business after she realized there was no general merchandise retail outlet in her neighborhood. Prior to that, Fatuma did subsistence farming. She still does subsistence farming though on a much smaller scale. Fatuma's monthly profits total 300,000 UGX. She plans to use this loan to purchase more retail commodities to resell.

loans.use: to purchase more retail commodities to resell

loans.name: Robina

texts.en: Robina is currently in the business of selling fresh fish. She hopes that after receiving a loan she can buy more fish to sell. She is 28 years old. She is  married. Her husband is a farmer. She has two children, and her children go to school. A loan will help her increase her profits and also to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.es: Benjamín, tiene la edad de 61 años, está casado, vive con su hija, nieta  y su esposa. El pretende con el crédito realizar la compra del equipo necesario para seguir con el proyecto apícola. El cuenta ya con una pequeña granja establecida  y lo que quiere es fortalecer el proyecto para seguir avanzando con él. El quiere lograr con su granjita seguir abasteciendo el mercado local de su comunidad y también producir para vender en lugares donde se pueda comercializar para así generar ganancias para su bienestar y el de su familia. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja
texts.en: Benjamin, 61, is married.  He lives with his wife, daughter and grandchild.  He plans to use this loan to buy equipment for a bee-keeping project.  He already has a small operation and he wants to move it forward now.  He plans to continue supplying honey to his local market and produce enough to sell to commercial vendors.  His goal is to generate earnings for himself and his family.  This is his first FUDECOSUR loan.  He has never borrowed from a state bank, but FUDECOSUR provided the loan without a lot of requirements and at an attractive rate of interest.

loans.use: to buy equipment for honey bees-ness.

loans.name: Komla

texts.fr:
Komlan est âgé de 28ans.Il est célibataire et sans enfant.
	
Il travaille comme revendeur de portables depuis 2010.Il revend des portables au feu rouge de moov sur les pavées vers le grand marché et s’approvisionne à Lomé chez des grossistes.

Il a requis son premier crédit à WAGES afin de s’approvisionner en portables.
texts.en:
Komlan, 28, is single and has no children. He has been working selling cell phones since 2010. He sells his cell phones at the Moov traffic light on the pavement going toward the big market and buys his wares in  Lomé from wholesalers. 

He has requested his first loan from WAGES so that he can stock up on cell phones.

loans.use: to buy cell phones.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 57 years old and married. She has seven children she supports with her husband. She was given a loan of  KES.45,000 which she invested in her business. She earns an income of 39,000 KES per month. She will use the loan to add more to her stock of cereals. 

The anticipated profit will be used to educate her children. This is her second loan with KADET Ltd., she paid her first loan successfully. 

Her hope for the future is to have a happy family.

loans.use: To add more stock of assorted cereals like maize, beans, and greengrams (mung beans)

loans.name: Flor Narcisa

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Ave Fénix.
 
Aquí conocimos a la señora Flor, tiene años 53 de edad, es madre soltera de dos hijos los mismos que son mayores de edad e independientes, con ella viven dos nietos de 11 y 3 años que son de un compromiso de uno de sus hijos y que son como sus hijos el mayor estudia en escuela.
 
Nuestra amiga comparte su tiempo entre su trabajo, el comercio y el cuidado a sus nietos, ella es maestra en una escuela de la localidad y además de esto también se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, nos cuenta que la mayoría de los padres de familia de la escuela en donde imparte sus conocimientos son sus clientes, allí también les vende a sus compañeros de trabajo, ella vende de lunes a viernes medio día ya que en las tardes y fines de semana  les dedica todo el tiempo a sus queridos nietos. Lleva 8 años que se dedica a esta actividad comercial.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace 8 años y le gusta porque con su primer crédito empezó con su negocio. 

Sus sueños es seguir adelante en su negocio y con sus queridos nietos.
texts.en:
In the city of Portoviejo, capital of Manabí, known since many years past as the City of the Royal Tamarinds, the members of the “Ave Fénix” (Phoenix Bird) communal bank meet every two weeks.

We met Flor, 53, here.  She’s a single mother of two children who are adult and independent.  Her two grandchildren, who are 11 and 3 years old and are the children of one of her sons, live with her and they are like children of her own; the oldest is in school.

Our friend divides her time between her job, commerce and caring for her grandchildren.  She’s a teacher at a local school but she also sells all sorts of clothes.  She tells us that most of the parents of children where she teaches are her customers.  She also sells to her coworkers there.  She sells half days from Monday through Friday because afternoons and weekends are dedicated full time to her beloved grandchildren.  She’s been doing her commercial activity for 8 years.

She’s going to use this loan to buy more merchandise like: pants, blouses, t-shirts and children’s clothes.  She’s been in the communal bank for 8 years and likes it because she started her business with her first loan.  Her dream is to continue forward with her business and with her beloved grandchildren.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, t-shirts and children's clothes.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Burgos Cabarroguis is near the market but there is a part of this village wherein the houses are in a mountainous place. Yolanda and her family live happily and peacefully in the mountainous part where there is no electric power. Her family only uses a generator as their source of light in the evening. The couple have been blessed with eight children but currently only live with their three single children.

Yolanda has been buying and selling bananas for 10 years. She is thankful because, even though their house is in the mountainous part, she still works hard to sustain their needs. She would like to buy additional bananas so that her profit will increase. So she is asking for a loan of P7,000. This amount would really help her in improving her business.

loans.use: to buy bananas for her fruit selling business

loans.name: Solaika

texts.en:
Solaika is 44 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 6 children. 

Solaika runs a shop that sells home products like flash lights, batteries and hair accessories. She's been in business for 3 years. 

She requests a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy additional home products and accessories.

Solaika has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, She hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of products like home products  & accessories.

loans.name: Cipriano

texts.es: Cipriano, de 53 años, habita en el caserío de Shururuyoc. Ahí formó su familia junto a Emilia, su esposa desde hace 24 años. Ambos tiene 2 hijas mayores: Felicita y Elisa; ahora ellos viven solos en su casa propia. Se siente muy feliz, pues ahora vive solo con su esposa, después de tanto trabajo para sacar adelante a sus hijos. Este hombre esforzado se dedica a las labores agrícolas; desde muy joven aprendió observando todas las técnicas necesarias para sembrar y cosechar la tierra, es por esta razón que en la actualidad siembra habas, papas y arvejas. El trabajo en el campo no es nada fácil y Cipriano cuida sus campos con mucha dedicación. Cuenta que en tiempo de cosecha, contrata operarios para que le ayuden a recoger la producción y luego vende todo a los mayoristas que le ofrecen buenos precios por sus cosechas y con las ganancias obtenidas puede ahorrar y vivir cómodamente al lado de su esposa. Como es un hombre bastante emprendedor para más adelante tiene planeado sembrar en mayor cantidad. Él pertenece al banco comunal “campo verde” y este es el sexto crédito con MFP, donde está muy agradecido con las personas que hicieron posible su progreso, además comenta que los integrantes de su asociación son personas responsables. Por ello promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Cipriano de recibir su apoyo, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de una bolsa de semilla de arveja, 3 bolsas de semilla de habas y fertilizantes naturales para su próxima siembra.
texts.en:
Cipriano, 53, lives in the hamlet of Shururuyoc.  He formed his family with Emilia, his wife of 24 years, there.  They have two adult children: Felicitas and Elisa.  Now, they live by themselves in their own house.  He feels very happy because he now lives only with his wife after so much work to raise their children.

This dedicated man works in farming.  He learned while still very young by watching the farming techniques needed to plant and to cultivate the land.  Because of this he currently grows lima beans, potatoes and peas.  Field work is by no means easy and Cipriano cares for his fields with much dedication.  He relates that during harvest time he hires day workers to help him bring in the harvest that he then sells to wholesalers that offer the best prices for his crops.  He uses profits earned to save up and live comfortably alongside his wife.  Because he’s quite an enterprising man, he plans later on to plant in larger amounts.

He belongs to the “Campo Verde” (Green Countryside) communal bank and this is the 6th MFP loan where he is very grateful to the people who made his progress possible.  He comments, also, that the members of his association are responsible people so he promises to be punctual with his installment payments.  

If Cipriano were to receive your support, he will invest the requested money in the purchase of one sack of pea seeds, three sacks of lima bean seeds and natural fertilizer for his next planting.

loans.use: to buy a sack of pea seeds, three sacks of lima bean seeds and sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Maria Josefina

texts.es:
María, utilizara el nuevo crédito para comprar más mercadería como el material para elaborar flores artificiales, espelma, colorantes y papel,  ya que debido a que ahora tiene más clientes quiere seguir incrementando sus ganancias.
El crédito anterior le ayudo a fortalecer su negocio ahora con un nuevo lograra aumentar en la elaboracion de las flores para poder sacar a su familia adelante y seguir trabajando con la institución.
texts.en:
María will use the new loan to buy more merchandise such as materials to make artificial flowers: wax, coloring and paper. Right now she has more customers and she wants to keep increasing her earnings. 

The previous loan helped to strengthen her business. Now, with a new one, she will be able to increase flower production to be able to get her family ahead and keep working with the institution.

loans.use: to buy paper, coloring and wax to make artificial flowers.

loans.name: Sofia Honoria

texts.es:
La señora Sofía   Honoria  se dedica a la venta de  tortillas hechas a mano, tamales, servilletas, lecha  y meme litas de manteca.
Desde hace siete años  empezó a vender  tortillas y  meme litas de manteca  y los tamales desde hace dos años  la lecha la empezó a vender desde hace  diez años.
Tiene  sesenta y dos años de edad es viuda  ya que su esposo murió desde  hace quince años  pero gracias dios pudo salir adelante con sus  hijos.
Está muy contenta  por el apoyo que le ha dado  fundación para salir adelante  y seguir vendiendo tamales que es lo que más le gusta y lo que le deja más ganancias.
Tiene  dos hijos una mujer Fabiola  de veinte años de  edad y un varón  Manuel de veinte cinco años de edad, ellos son el motivo por quien decidió  tener su propio negocio  y vender lo que se pudiera.
Pidió el préstamo para comprar  hojas  plátano para tortear la masa  para hacer los tamales, manteca, maíz para la masa, carne de marrano, pollo y chile seco para el mole.
Uno de sus sueños es seguir trabajando por qué  es lo que la hace sentir bien  y  también puede ayudar a su hija  Fabiola para que termine sus estudios.
Le da las gracias a fundación por el apoyo que le ha dado para salir adelante  y seguir asiendo lo que le gusta que es vender tamales.
texts.en:
Sofía Honoria sells handmade tortillas, tamales, serving cloths, milk, and memelitas (small corn tortillas spread with lard, beans, cheese and salsa).  She began selling tortillas and memelitas with lard seven years ago, tamales two years ago, and milk ten years ago.

She is 62, and a widow, as her husband died 15 years ago. Fortunately, she and her children were able to move forward. 

She is very happy for the support the Foundation has given her to help her get ahead, and keep selling tamales; which is what she likes best, and earns her the most.

She has two children: a daughter, Fabiola who is 20, and a son, Manuel who is 25. They are the reason why she decided to have her own business, and sell what she could.  

She has asked for the loan to buy banana leaves for flattening the dough to make tamales, lard, corn for making flour, pork, chicken, and dry chili for the sauce.

One of her dreams is to keep working, because that's what makes her feel good, and allows her to help her daughter Fabiola finish her schooling.

She is grateful to the Foundation for the support it has given her to get ahead and keep doing what she likes, which is selling tamales.

loans.use: To buy banana leaves for flattening the dough to make tamales, lard, corn for making flour, pork, chicken, and dry chili for the sauce.

loans.name: Rovelyn

texts.en:
"To accomplish great things we must not only act, but also dream; not only plan, but also believe."
~ Anatole France

This quotation guides Rovelyn to work hard and love her work. Rovelyn is in her 40s with three children who are in elementary and high school. Rovelyn’s husband is a farmer, planting rice in the Philippines. With determination to help her husband uplift their standard of living, Rovelyn started a livestock business raising hogs. Rovelyn has two sows, 12 piglets and four fattening [hogs]. With the high cost of feed in the market, Rovelyn cannot provide enough feed for her hogs. Therefore, Rovelyn is taking out a loan of 25,000 Philippine pesos to purchase feed for the maintenance of her hogs.

loans.use: to purchase feed for the maintenance of her hogs.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita, 50, is a resident of Manila, Philippines. She is married to Jose, a checker, and they have three children. She and her family manage their household while operating their business. Anita works hard to continually provide income for the family's everyday expenses.

Anita operates a variety store which, in the Philippines, is basically a small convenience store which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, PHP 5 worth of cooking oil or an egg. Anita earns an income by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house and her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in daily sales.

To help her continue operations of her business, Anita is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan, which she will use to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Anita hopes to be able to expand soon, just as she dreams of being able to give her family a good future through all her hard work. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Ursulina

texts.en:
Ursulina is 63 years old and lives in Villalin, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is widowed with five children. 

Ursulina has a tailoring business and earns approximately PHP 3,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 4,000 to purchase new materials for her tailoring shop. . 

Ursulina has been a member of PMPC for 25 years. In the future, Ursulina hopes to have number of tailoring shops in town and hopes to have her own dress shop someday.

loans.use: To purchase new materials for her tailoring shop.

loans.name: Nong Taaba Group

texts.fr:
Mme Sylvie est la représentante du groupe NONG TAABA. Elle est  mariée et mère de 02 enfants. Le plus âgé a 10ans et le moins âgé a 7ans. Les 02 vont à l’école et elle a 02 personnes en charge.

Elle vend des habits depuis 04ans. Mme s’approvisionne au marché du secteur 10.Ses clients sont les femmes.

Mme veut s’acheter 01 douzaine de haut et des habits pour enfants.

Elle veut améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille avec ses économies. Elle ambitionne ouvrir une boutique d’habits et s’acheter une parcelle dans le futur.
texts.en:
Mrs. Sylvie is the representative of NONG TAABA Group. She's married and the mother of two children. The oldest is 10 and the youngest is 7 years old. Both children attend school. She has two persons to support.

For four years, she's been selling clothing. She gets her supplies at the Sector 10 market. Her customers are women.

She would like to buy one dozen tops and children's clothing.

She would like to improve the standard of living of her family with her savings. In the future, she ambitions to open a clothing store and buy a land lot.

loans.use: to buy one dozen tops and children's clothing

loans.name: Muktaran's Group

texts.en:
Mukhtaran is 41 years old, married, and has two sons. Due to financial constraints, she couldn’t educate her children. Her elder son is an embroidery expert while the younger one works in the factory.

Her husband is a driver while Mukhtaran herself is also a working lady. She does decorative embroidery. She is very skillful and receives a good number of orders every month.

She has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for further expansion of her embroidery business. With the loan investment, she will buy clothes and embroidery material such as beads and embroidery frames in bulk quantity to be able to prepare better quality embroidered clothes and increase her income.

She is very experienced in her work and has been operating it for the past many years. She is confident that an investment will help her to improve her business further.

Note: ”In the photo, the lady who has raised her hand is Mukhtaran.”

loans.use: To buy clothes, beads, and embriodery frames for decorative embriodery business

loans.name: Delia

texts.es:
La señora Delia tiene 43 años de edad, está casada desde hace tiempo con el señor Julio ellos viven en la ciudad de Encarnación. 
La señora Delia es modista y tiene su propio taller de costura en su casa. Se dedica a esta actividad desde hace varios años y tiene mucha clientela de la zona de San Pedro. Su esposo es Carpintero y también posee una amplia carpintería en su casa, tiene mucha clientela ya que es conocido en la zona. Gracias a estas actividades ellos han podido salir adelante, educar a sus hijos y mantener su hogar, sus metas es seguir progresando y ayudarse los unos a los otros. 
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de telas, entretelas, encajes y otros insumos necesarios para poder abastecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Delia is 43 years old and she has been married for many years to Julio. They live in the city of Encarnación. Delia is a seamstress and has her own sewing shop in her house. She has been working in this business for several years and she has many customers in the San Pedro area. Her husband is a carpenter and he also has a large carpentry workshop in the house. He has many customers and is well known in the area. Thanks to these businesses they have been able to get ahead, educate their children, and provide for their household. Their goals are to continue making progress and to help each other.

She is requesting a loan to buy fabrics, interfacing, lace, and other items needed to stock her business.

loans.use: to buy facbrics, interfacing, lace, and other necessary materials

loans.name: Margjela

texts.en:
Margjela is fifty five years old and lives in the north. She is the mother of seven children with some of them still attending schools; the youngest one is five years old and the oldest is twenty nine. 
Margjela has been selling items on the beach during summer time from a booth and also elsewhere during other seasons.” It has been profitable and I enjoy it,” Margjela said. “I have a booth that I operate it throughout the year almost, but winter,” she continued. 
Margjela has been a long time and good client of VisionFund Albania. She has paid all of her loans on time without any delays and she is requesting another loan this time to stock up on items to resell.

loans.use: To stock up the booth on inventory items to resell

loans.name: Taleh

texts.en:
Taleh is 34 years old .He settled her family with two children in Xirdalan dormitory. He is  Internally Displaced Person ( IDP ) from the war-affected region of  Azerbaijan Fizuli. His family’s living condition is not good enough.
In the beginning he sold only fruits. Since 1993 Taleh has been engaged in selling the fruits and vegetables. Having borrowed 3 loans of $300-$600-$800 from Komak Credit Union he significantly expanded his business,  to increase profits achieved progress in his business.The loans were paid back timely.
 Now he needs a loan of $1000 to further develop his business, to expand the area of his business.

loans.use: To expand his business

loans.name: Dodofiko

texts.en: Dodofiko is married with two children, all at home but ready to join nursery school. He started his business in 2001. He has some schooling. He is an self-employed driver, and he owns a motorbike which he uses for transporting people. This is the only means of transport in the area. He also operates a kinyozi where he has employed a barber. He requests  a loan of $150 from PEMCI, which will enable him to restock his barbershop and repair his motorbike for better operation.

loans.use: To create upgrade his businesses.

loans.name: Nely Judith

texts.en:
Running my convenience store helped me finish my studies three years ago. The business has also helped me buy my mother her medicine. Now I need to purchase various products to be able to provide a better service to my clientele, made up mostly my neighbors and other people in my community.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Tengo un pequeño negocio que me ayuda a terminar mis estudios desde hace 3 años. Tambien con este negocio ayudo a mi mama para la compra de sus medicinas. Ahora nesecito comprar varios productos para dar un mejor servico a mis clientes, los cuales son mis vecinos y otras persona de mi comunidad.

loans.use: Purchase bread, eggs, snacks, rice, beans, etc.

loans.name: Marhamat

texts.en: H. Marhamat is married. Sometimes her son helps her to bring women's handkerchiefs from Istaravshan. She started her business with 40 US dollars. Now she has 350 US dollars in her business. She used to work in dry-cleaning, but after her salary was reduced she decided to start her own business. She wants to purchase modern goods and increase her profit. The market plans to build new shops, and she wants to rent one of them, because in winter it is too cold to sit in the street. The income she earns supports the family's expenses because her husband is sick and her son is unemployed. Her daughters are married and they live separately.

loans.use: To purchase new goods

loans.name: Gloria Isabel

texts.es:
Gloria is married and has an 8 month baby and her husband is a shoemaker in town. He works alot and she decided to start selling the shoes he makes. Together they contribute to cover household expenses and are able to support their little girl. She started selling the shoes amongst her neighbors and friends, and upon seeing the good quality and economical price of the shoes they recommend the shoes to others, thus her clientele has grown little by little. She wants to continue her business' growth and be able to stock up with shoes to satisfy demand.

Gloria is asking for a 6 month US $475 loan to buy a sewing machine for shoes to speed up production. She and her family thank you for the support you give that allows them to increase their shoe production, fulfill their demand and expand their business.

Translated from Spanish by Nathan, Kiva volunteer.

Gloria esta casada y tiene una bebe de 8 meses, su esposo es zapatero en su ciudad, él trabaja mucho y ella se decidió a vender los productos que hace su esposo, ya que el le da a un buen precio para que ella pueda hacer negocio con los zapatos que él elabora y así poder aportar para ambos e la economía del hogar y poder mantener a su pequeña niña. Ella empezó vendiendo los zapatos entre sus vecinos y amigos, y ellos ahora al ver la buena calidad de los zapatos que ofrece y el buen precio que les da la recomiendan y poco a poco su clientela ha ido incrementándose, por ello desea seguir creciendo y poder abastecerse de producto para cubrir su demanda.

Gloria esta solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de US $ 475 para comprar una maquina de coser zapatos y así poder agilizar la producción de los mismos, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en 6 meses. Ella y su familia te agradecen mucho el apoyo que les das para poder incrementar su producción y así poder cubrir su demanda y crecer con su negocio.

loans.use: Buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Mulyati

texts.en: Mulyati is a 43 years old and is married with four children ages 29, 20, 17, and 11. She is the sole provider for her daily needs and her children's education. She sells clothes on credit and by going around from place to place to meet customers. In this way, Mulyati earns $33 per week. She is a member of MBK and asks for a IDR 500,000 loan to expand her business. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To expand her clothes selling business

loans.name: Subgroup A Of Group Tuwezeshane

texts.en:
GLADIS, age 32, sells powdered soap and new dresses and shoes from door to door to homes, schools, and offices. She works from 10am to 6pm, with a lunch break which she uses to spend time with her children. She began this business in 2001 and now makes about $9 a week from powdered soap sales and $18 from clothing sales.

Before this business, Gladis was a stay-at-home mother. She started working because her husband’s military income wasn’t enough to cover their family’s expenses. Gladis’s business has helped their 3 children (ages 7, 8, and 12) attend school. It has also allowed them to begin building a new house, which they are still in the process of doing.

Gladis is the leader of Subgroup A of group Tuwezeshane (meaning “let’s help each other” in Swahili), which totals 24 members. Gladis will be sharing this loan with her subgroup members: Asha S. (selling clothes), Catherine M. (shop owner), Rose M. (selling groceries), Zuhura K. (selling vegetables), Zuwena C. (selling clothes), and Alex M. (selling clothes). While a few of the members are new, most of this subgroup has shared a previous loan together, which they paid back successfully.

Gladis used the previous loan to buy more stock of powdered soap and new clothes. She hopes to use the new loan for the same purpose.

loans.use: To buy stock of powdered soap and clothing

loans.name: Salma's Tuimarike Group

texts.en:
Salma, 45, is married and has 5 children (ages 20, 18, 16, 9, and 2). She is a food vendor and works from 6 am to 5 pm daily, selling a variety of dishes and snacks. She began this business in 2004 and now makes a monthly profit of about $82 from this business.

Salma hopes for a loan to increase her food stock. She will share this loan with Edith, a member of her loan group. Edith, also a food vendor, is Salma's neighbor.

loans.use: To buy food stock

loans.name: Oliver

texts.en: E. Oliver is 32 years old, still single, and lives in Benin City. He has a store in one of the famous markets in Benin City where he sells shoes, bags and female clothing. He learned this business for 4 years and started in 2001 and has been in LAPO for 2 years. He is soliciting a loan of $850 to enable him to buy more shoes, bags and female clothing for sale.

loans.use: To buy more shoes, bags and clothing for sale

loans.name: Elchin

texts.en: Elchin was born in 1975. He is married, and has 3 children. He lives in the town of Khachmaz. Elchin has been in the produce selling business for 5 years. He needs a loan of $1200 to buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Chea

texts.en: Mrs. Chea R., a 74-year-old widow, makes around $8 per day selling bags from her home in the Prek Krobao 3 Village, Kandal Province. She has two married children who sell bags at the Prek Leap Market. R. now requests a loan of $800 to purchase more bags to sell. With the income generated by her business, she will be able to support her family’s financial stability easily. She appreciates Kiva for their support. R. and her client appear in the photo.

loans.use: To purchase more bags to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy agricultural supplements, seeds, fertilizer, small equipment and other necessary supplies, rent machinery and contract labor to continue working her land.

loans.name: Ni Wayan Palma

texts.id:
Ni Wayan Palma was able to paid off her 1st loan with Dinari which was amounted to IDR 1.4 million (around USD 175) in a 6 month period. She also made a profit of USD 125 during that period, thanks to the opportunity provided to her by the loan.

She is now planning to more expanding her business by taking the 2nd loan from Dinari. She wants to buy more piglets and pig feed. She hopes her business can be more expanded to help her family's welfare.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva volunteer.

Setelah memperoleh hasil yang cukup lumayan dari pinjaman periode pertama dan dipengaruhi juga oleh semakin meningkatnya kebutuhan keluarga maka Wayan Palma memutuskan untuk melanjutkan dengan pinjaman periode kedua. Dari pinjaman pertama sebesar Rp. 1.400.000.- selama 6 bulan Wayan Palma meraup keuntungan sebesar Rp. 1000.000.- yang mana sangat membantu suaminya yang berprofesi sebagai petani musiman dalam memenuhi kebutuhan keluarganya. Semua ini bisa terjadi karena ketekunan Wayan Palma dan pendampingan secara rutin dari para staf DINARI. Melalui pinjaman periode kedua ini, Wayan Palma berharap bisa menambah jumlah babi peliharaannya dan juga akan dimanfaatkan untuk membeli pakan babi. Sehingga nantinya akan diperoleh keuntungan yang juga akan meningkat dan tentunya akan berpengaruh sangat besar untuk perekonomian keluarga.

loans.use: To buy piglet and pig feed (Membeli bibit dan pakan)

loans.name: Thim

texts.en: Mr. Thim T. is a bricklayer while his wife grows crops, including lemon tree and other Cambodian crops. They live with one child in Sret Lich Village, Siem Reap Province. Because of their increasing cost of living, T. wants to expand his wife's crop-growing business to support the family’s expenses sufficiently. Therefore, T. is asking for a loan to purchase a plot of farmland to expand his crops, and to purchase fertilizer. The loan will allow him to increase his family’s income.

loans.use: To purchase a plot of farmland to expand his crops, and to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel is employed as contract cleaning staff. On the weekends she works in a launderette. Isabel uses the income she earns from these two jobs to support her five children. Her home is located at 16 de Julio in the Zona Villa neighborhood of the city of El Alto [a suburb of La Paz].

Isabel is requesting a loan to cover her eldest son’s boarding and tuition at the Universidad Salesiana [local Catholic university].

This is Isabel’s third loan from IMPRO. Her loan application was approved on the basis of her good payment history. In addition, her support is providing her son with more opportunities for a better life in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson

Isabel, trabajo como empleada de limpieza a contrato; los fines de semana trabaja como lavandera y de estas dos actividades deriva sus ingresos mensuales con los que cubre la manutención de su cinco hijos que dependen de ella; su vivienda esta ubicada en la Zona Villa 16 de julio de la ciudad de el Alto.

El crédito que ahora solicita es requerido para cubrir las pensiones y matricula en la Universidad Salesiana de su hijo mayor.

Es el tercer crédito con IMPRO, el buen comportamiento de pago permite aprobar la solicitud de Isabel, además de que así ella está ayudando para que su hijo tenga más posibilidades de una mejor vida en el futuro.

loans.use: Payment of university boarding and tuition fees for her eldest son

loans.name: Foster

texts.en:
Foster A., 33 years old, is married and the father of two kids who are currently in school. He operates a clothing shop and sells jeans, blouses and skirts, women's slippers, dressing bags, and headscarves. He also has been sewing unisex clothing for the past four years.

Foster is constrained by insufficient funds to run the business. He needs this loan to inject more working capital into the business to scale up his business progress. He believes the loan will help him to purchase good quality and larger quantity to upgrade his inventory. He wants to use the loan to purchase jeans, ladies' wear, headscarves, and slippers. He belongs to the community group called Great Provider Trust Group. Members of this group guarantee for one another as social collateral to access loans and peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To purchase jeans, ladies' wear, slippers, etc.

loans.name: Naddiya

texts.en: N. Naddiya has a beauty salon in Kabowa that she has been running for three and a half years now. She is married with one child, but also cares for her three brothers and sisters and pays their school fees. In her salon, she braids hair and applies chemicals to the hair; she also sells the same chemicals to customers who prefer to do their hair in the comfort of their own homes. With the loan, she plans to stock her salon with more chemicals, braids, wigs and weaves in preparation for the festive season.

loans.use: Namatovu Naddiya plans to stock her salon with more chemicals, braids, wigs and weaves in preparation for the festive season.

loans.name: Honorata

texts.es:
Doña Honorata tiene 62 años de edad, estudió cuarto año de secundaria, es conviviente  y madre de 02 hijos varones de 27 y 23 años de edad, vive en el Jr. Bolognesi Nº 543 del Distrito y Provincia de Yunguyo – Puno.

Es integrante del Banco Comunal “Wiñay Marca”- Yunguyo, desde el año 2001, con el crédito inicial de S/.300.00 nuevos soles compró: azúcar, arroz, verduras para cocinar en su restaurante. A los a los 30 años de edad trabajó en su salón de belleza, durante 08 años y en 1994 aperturó su restaurante que a la fecha atiende.

Con el crédito de S/.1000.00 nuevos soles, que pagará en 04 cuotas, comprará: 02 bolsas de arroz con S/.290.00, 02 bolsas de azúcar con S/. 152.00, 02 quintales de papa con S/.120.00  y  con el saldo comprará verduras y carne.

Su sueño es comprar una casa en la ciudad de Puno y que su hijo menor termine sus estudios superiores (estudia en Bolivia).

“El Banco Comunal es muy bueno porque las señoras son puntuales en el pago y asisten a la hora exacta y no tenemos problemas” dijo muy contenta doña Honorata.
texts.en:
Honorata is 62 years of age, studied up to the fourth year of secondary school, lives with her partner and is the mother of two sons ages 27 and 23. She lives at Jr. Bolognesi Nº 543 of the District and Province of Yunguyo – Puno. She has been amember of the Communal Bank “Wiñay Marca”- Yunguyo since the year 2001. With the initial loan of S/.300.00 new soles she bought: sugar, rice, vegetables to cook in her restaurant. At 30 years of age she worked in a beauty salon for 8 years and in 1994 she opened her restaurant which she has to date. With the laon of S/.1000.00 new soles, which will be repaid in 4 installmente, she will buy: 2 bags of rice with S/.290.00, 2 bags of sugar with S/. 152.00, 2 100 lb. pages of potatoes with S/.120.00 and with the remainder she will buy vegetables and meat. Her dream is to buy a house in the city of Puno and that her younger son finish his higher education (he studies in Bolivia). “The Communal Bank is very good with the women are punctual with payments, arrive on time and we do not have any problems" Honorata said very contently.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of materials (vegetables, meats, potatoes, etc.)

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es:
La señora Beatriz pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Tigresas”, ubicado en el Jr. Masisea Mz. A Lt. 26, distrito de Yarinacocha, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 62 años de edad, es madre soltera con 8 hijos mayores de edad. Beatriz. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en la venta de agua. Tiene 4 años trabajando con el banco comunal.

En la actualidad cuenta con el mismo negocio. En su casa tiene un tanque de agua, el cual le permite brindar todos lo días a sus vecinos y amigos agua a sus hogares.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,700, el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará 20 tubos, 2 docenas de codos para tubos, 6 pegamentos, limpieza de tanque, etc.

Beatriz se siente contenta porque todo lo que ha logrado es gracias a su esfuerzo y voluntad.
texts.en:
Mrs. Beatriz belongs to the community bank of Las Tigresas, located in the district of Yarinacocha, department of Ucayali. She is 62 years old, single mother of 8 children who are all adults now. With the first loan received from Manuela Ramos of $/.300 she invested on selling water. She has 4 years working with the community bank. She has the same business currently. She has a tank of water at her house and sells it to her neighbors and friends for theirs homes. With the S/.1,700 loan she is requesting which will be paid in 6 months, she will buy 20 tubs, and 2 dozen of connectors, 6 glues and cleaning supplies, etc. Beatriz feels happy because all she has obtained is due to her effort and will.

Translated from Spanish by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 20 tubs, and 2 dozen of connectors, 6 glues and cleaning supplies, etc.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: Julia tiene 45 años, es separada de su esposo y actualmente vive con su hijo. Inició siendo agricultora, pero con el paso de los años encontró en el comercio, una de sus mejores capacidades, y desde que lo descubrió supo aprovechar las oportunidades, hace 2 años empezó a vender dulces en el colegio de su localidad, negocio con el cual pudo mejorar sus ingresos económicos gracias al gran consumo  de los estudiantes y maestros del colegio. Julia desea ir mejorando la atención a sus clientes, aunque para ello tenga que viajar constantemente a la ciudad para traer nuevas golosinas para los colegiales. Con mucho entusiasmo está iniciando su primer crédito, está muy comprometida con los pagos que hay que realizar. Con la cantidad que solicita comprará mayor cantidad de dulces para su tienda.
texts.en:
Julia is 45 years old, separated from her husband and currently lives with her son. She began as a farmer, but in time she found herself in commerce, one of her best talents. Ever since she discovered her skill in commerce she knew how to take advantage of opportunities.

Two years ago she began to sell sweets at the school in her neighborhood, a business that betters her income thanks to the great consumption of the students and teachers of the school. Julia wishes to improve her service to her customers, although in order to do this she must constantly travel to the city to bring new candies to the schoolchildren.

With much enthusiasm she is asking for her first loan and is very committed to making the necessary payments. With the amount that she asks for she will buy a larger quantity of sweets for her store.

Translated from Spanish by Breanne Kochert, Kiva Volunteer
