loans.use: Increase of the merchandise that she sells

loans.name: Marcelita

texts.en:
Marcelita O. is already 31 years old, married to Argie who is an OFW (Overseas Filipino Worker). They were blessed with two children: Trisha Mae – 8 years old, grade III student, and Angeline – 2 years old. Though apart from her husband, Marcelita does not consider the distance as a factor affecting her emotional aspect; instead, she considers it as a challenge to pursue what they have started in their family and keeps on holding her trust to her husband towards the progress of their lives.

While her husband works abroad, Marcelita has also established a little business in their village where she is able to earn at least PHP 580 in weekly income. The business started up three years ago and it’s been good enough to cover some of the needs of the family. As of the moment, Marcelita wants to request a loan amounting to PHP 4,000 in order to sustain the business for the future of her children. She believes that her husband's working abroad is not for a lifetime, thus she prefers to invest in her business. She is now managing and developing her business for sustainability and hoping to support their current and future needs. Also, according to Marcelita, she only needs to be patient to succeed.

loans.use: additional working capital

loans.name: Jose Enrique

texts.es:
José es socio del Banco Comunal Fe.
José es soltero, tiene 49 años y 2 hijos, José tiene un taller de carpintería en su casa, realiza diferentes trabajos dependiendo del pedido que hagan sus clientes, actividad que realiza solo.
José necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de madera.
Los sueños de José son comprar todas las maquinarias necesarias para implementar su taller.
texts.en:
José is a member of Faith Communal Bank. He is 49 years old, single, and has two children. Jose has a carpentry workshop in his home where he does a variety of jobs, depending on what his customers request. He works alone. José needs a loan of 3000 soles to purchase wood. Jose's dream is to buy all the machines necessary to equip his workshop.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase wood

loans.name: Naseem Akhtar M. Ishaq Group

texts.en:
Naseem akhtar baji has been a resident of the city of Vehari, Pakistan for the past 10 years. Her husband, M. I., works in a factory. Naseem baji is the mother of two children; one son and one daughter. Both of her children get an education at the local school. Naseem baji is a very hardworking lady. She sews clothes without caring whether it is day and night. She sews clothes to pay off the school fees of her children. Her family is very happy with her kind and loving behavior. She is applying for a loan to buy an electric sewing machine so that she sews more clothes and save time. 

She is a group leader of several other women of her locality. Naseem begum baji wants a loan to pay the installments of her auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Syeda touqeer baji wants a loan to buy cigarettes to sell. Hamidan baji wants a loan to buy thread to sell. Anwar begum baji wants a loan to buy beams for her window shutter business. Taish naz baji wants a loan to buy clothes for her clothing selling business. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy an electric sewing machine

loans.name: Fidel

texts.es: El Señor Fidel trabaja con nuestra institución desde el año de 2006 en todo este tiempo siempre demostró  puntualidad y responsabilidad con sus créditos, cuenta con un minibús con el que trabaja todos los días, el es divorciado y vive en un pequeño cuarto, tiene una hija casada quien es su garante y siempre lo colabora. Trabaja desde la 06:00 hasta las 23:00 Todos los dias inclusive sabados y domingos. En este momento el vehiculo tiene varias fallas, por el mismo trajin a que lo somete diariamente.
texts.en:
Fidel has worked with our institution since the year 2006 and, over this time, has shown himself to be very punctual and responsible with his loan payments. He has a minibus that he drives every day; he is divorced and lives in a small room. He has a married daughter, who is his guarantor and collaborator. He works from 6 am to 11 pm every day, including Saturdays and Sundays. Currently, his vehicle has several malfunctions due to all the comings and goings he subjects it to on a daily basis.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For replacement parts for his vehicle.

loans.name: Balaba

texts.fr: Balaba G. est une femme mariée de 45 ans. Son activité consisté à transformer l’arachide en pâte qu’elle vend après. Les revenus générés lui permettent de satisfaire les charges familiales.
texts.en:
Balaba G. is a married woman, 45 years of age. Her work involves processing peanuts into peanut butter, which she sells afterwards. The revenues generated will enable her to meet family expenses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To process peanuts into peant butter for sale

loans.name: Jumbe

texts.en: Jumbe  H. is a microbusiness entrepreneur in Tanzania. He runs a stationery shop in the Tabata Kimanga ward in Dar es Salaam. He purchases his business items from the wholesale stationers in the Kariakoo shopping city center. He manages to meet his family's daily needs from his business income. He has been in this business for three years. He is requesting a loan of Tshs 600,000 to buy more goods for sale in his business.

loans.use: To buy more goods for sale in his stationery business.

loans.name: Sen

texts.en: Sen S. is 37 years old.  She has owned a plot of land in Pursat Province since 1979.  There, she grows all types of crops, which she plants twice a year. She is a good mother of five children, three of whom are single and two of whom are married and live away from home. She is married to Mr. You, 43, who is also a crop farmer and sells carving wood from their home. To help alleviate the hard physical labor of farm work, Sen S. is looking for a loan from Kiva to purchase a water buffalo in order to plow farmland during the rice growing season.

loans.use: To purchase a water buffalo to plow farmland

loans.name: Roberto

texts.en:
Farming is the major source of income in the village of Pangal Norte in Echague, Isabela, and Roberto is no exception. He has been managing his rice field for almost ten years. He wanted to develop his business but due to lack of capital, he could not sustain all the farm inputs he needed.

He is asking for a loan of 12,000 Philippine Pesos from the lenders as additional working capital. With the business alone, Roberto was able to support his family. He is now 36 years old and his wife Anita is a public school teacher in their village teaching elementary students. Roberto is hoping that his loan request will be approved for it is of great help towards the sustainability of his farming business. He also believes that aside from having enough capital, patience and hard work are also some factors towards the success of every business endeavor.

loans.use: Business capital for rice farm

loans.name: Lola

texts.en: Lola is 34 years old and married with two children. She sells paint in her shop and is requesting the loan of N50,000 to purchase more paint to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more paint to sell

loans.name: Mejalbeth

texts.es: Mejalbeth tiene 33 años, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos en su casa propia. Hace más de 5 años tiene un taller donde fabrica muebles; junto a su esposo realizan los diseños de acuerdo al pedido del cliente y también realizan el cambio total y reparación del forro de los sillones dejándolos como nuevos. Su esposo es el encargado de hacer las estructuras de madera y ella se encarga del relleno y tapizado, dándoles el acabado final. Mejalbeth realiza este trabajo generalmente por las tardes, ya que por las mañanas realiza las labores domésticas. Debido a la calidad de los servicios que brindan los clientes han aumentado y son estables, eso es muy favorable para la sostenibilidad de su negocio, por lo que están planificando para el futuro ampliar sus horizontes de venta. Esta es la séptima vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, ella se siente muy comprometida y está dispuesta a seguir colaborando para el desarrollo de su banco comunal. El dinero que viene solicitando será destinado a la compra de telas para tapizado y pegamento industrial.
texts.en:
Mejalbeth is 33 years old and lives with her husband and 3 children in their own home. She has been operating a furniture workshop for more than 5 years. Together with her husband, they design pieces based on customer specifications and also reupholster armchairs, making them look like new. Her husband is in charge of the wooden framing, while she takes care of the upholstery, trim and finishing details. Mejalbeth generally works on furniture in the evenings and reserves her mornings for household chores. Due to the quality of services they offer, she and her husband have developed a reliable client base that is growing. To promote the sustainability of their business, they plan to increase their sales in the near horizon.

This is Mejalbeth’s seventh loan with MFP. She feels very committed and is prepared to continue the development of her communal bank group. The money she is requesting will be used to purchase upholstery cloth and industrial adhesives.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabric and industrial adhesives

loans.name: Aureliano

texts.en:
Señor Aureliano L. is from the rural area of Espartillar in Carapeguà. He is married to Señora Lucila Matto, with 2 children of school age. They live in a house of their own. They have dedicated more than 15 years to selling their artisan products and own a truck that helps them do so. They are very well known in their area for being hardworking people and entrepreneurs who have progressed with so much sacrifice and determination.

He is asking for a loan so that he can buy bedspreads.

loans.use: The purchase of bedspreads

loans.name: Sarantuya

texts.en:
Sarantuya C. is a 43-year-old businesswoman who lives with her husband and three children in the province of Arkhangai. She started her used clothing business with 300,000 tugrugs of working capital.  Sarantuya now sells clothes that she buys in Ereen, a Chinese border city. Because of her experience and hard work, the business has been growing , allowing her to purchase home electronic appliances with her business profits. She is planning to repair her house in the near future.  

She is requesting a loan of 500,000 tugrugs to bring more and different types of clothes from Ereen. She said, “I want to expand my business by operating a grocery store."

loans.use: To purchase clothing apparel for her business

loans.name: Bibi Saheb Group

texts.en:
Bibi Saheb is the group leader of Bibi Saheb Group. There are four members in this group and they would each like to expand their business. They want to take a loan of 30,000 Afghani.

Sabry Gull wants to take a loan for her business of quilt-making.

Bibi Saheb wants to take a loan for her family’s general store.

Gull Chahra wants to take a loan for her embroidery business.

Abdull M. wants to take a loan for his business as a butcher.

So they are all very thankful to AFS and to Kiva lenders who are able to support entrepreneurs.

loans.use: To use as additional working capital

loans.name: Roca Fuerte Group

texts.es:
Roca Fuerte es un grupo de personas que forma parte del Centro Focal Alto Lima, una de sus integrantes es Esthela Patricia P. de 20 años, cuenta que desde muy niña colaboró a su madre a vender alcancías y cuando cumplió la mayoría de edad su madre le regaló  dinero  para que ella pueda vender de manera independiente. Esthela desea hacer crecer su negocio, por este motivo a invitación de una amiga se animó  a formar parte del grupo Roca Fuerte y necesita el préstamo para comprar mayor mercadería, para luego venderlo en diferentes ferias y pueblos de la ciudad de La Paz. 
Las demás integrantes de Roca Fuerte tambien tienen sus propias actividades económicas, como la venta de lana, vajillas, celulares, carne y juguetes, también necesitan el préstamo para adquirir mercadería.
texts.en:
Roca Fuerte (Strong Rock) is a group of people that is made up of members of the Centro Focal Alto Lima. One of the members is Esthela Patricia P., a 20-year-old woman who from a very young age has worked with her mother selling piggy banks. When she legally came of age, her mother gave her money so that she could begin selling independently. Esthela wants to grow her business, and for this reason joined the Roca Fuerte group at the invitation of a friend. She needs this loan to purchase more merchandise to later sell at different markets and in different areas of the city of La Paz. The other members of Roca Fuerte also have their own businesses, such as the sale of wool, dishes, cellular phones, meat, or toys. They too need this loan to purchase more merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Credo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise for sale.

loans.name: Silbio Antonio

texts.es: El señor Silbio Antonio Cáceres C. , tiene la edad de 40 años habita en el barrio , San Juan de los Ríos , ubicado en el municipio de Ticuantepe , junto a su esposa la cual trabaja como comerciante para apoyarle con los gastos del hogar , ya que ellos tienen tres hijos a su cargo , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida y apoyar a sus hijos en sus estudios , don Silbio desde hace 31 años se dedica a la agricultura ya que fue beneficiado con las reforma agraria . Le agradece a la institución por su buena aprobación ya que durante ocho ciclo le hemos brindado apoyo financiero para que obtenga mejores precio en la venta del producto. Con este financiamiento comprara fertilizantes y venenos y poder aplicar al cultivo para una mejor producción lo cual es de mucho beneficio ya que vende su productos a mejor precio en el mercado.

loans.use: Comprar fertilizantes y venenos para una mejor produccion

loans.name: Chukwuka

texts.en: Chukwuka has a photo studio where he snaps pictures. He is 27 years old and single without any children. He is requesting a loan  of N100,000 to purchase a digital camera to enable him meet the desires of his clients. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a digital camera

loans.name: Soem

texts.en:
Soem K. is 59 years old and a resident of Pursat Province, Cambodia. She earns a living as a tailor, providing her service to neighbors, sewing both traditional clothes and modern clothes. On the other hand, Soem K. and her husband always cultivate rice and raise pigs as well. From these businesses, Soem K. can earn an average of US$6 per day.

Soem K. is a married woman blessed with seven children, three of whom are employed in various jobs and the remainder are students.

Soem K. doesn't have her own vehicle, so she always faces difficulties with her traveling needs. Because of this obstacle, she is applying for a loan to buy a used motorcycle to ride.

loans.use: To buy a used motorcycle to ride

loans.name: Agya

texts.en:
Agya is 35 years old. He is married with two children. Currently both his children are in school. He is a chemicals seller and sells various kinds of drugs like blood tonics, pain killers, malaria drugs, etc. in his neighborhood. He has been in business for nine years now and he is among the few people or licensed chemical shops who supply pharmaceutical products in the community. His chemical shop is registered and has the right to operate by Ghana pharmaceutical council.

Agya wants to use the loan to buy more supplies of drugs to include others that are frequently demanded by his customers. He hopes to make a good income to take care of his family. He would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy more pharmaceutical drugs

loans.name: Rolly

texts.en:
Rolly U. is from the village of Quirino, Solano, Nueva Vizcaya. He is 36 years old. Rolly is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Rolly owns & operates a motorcycle transport business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing transportation services to local community members. Rolly has been engaged in his business for over 2 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Rolly joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rolly is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. This will be the first loan taken out by Rolly from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair a transport vehicle used in the business

loans.name: María De Los Ángeles

texts.es: María D. los Ángeles C. D. V. D. 31 años D. edad, ResiD. en Ciudad Delgado y vive junto a su esposo y sus tres hijas. Ella posee una venta D. ropa, la cual esta ubicada en las calles del centro D. San Salvador, en la capital del país. María solicita un préstamo con el fin D. poder comprar más ropa, sobre todo pantalones ya que son estos lo que más se venden en esta temporada D. fin D. años, y es por esto que ella desea poder obtener el capital necesario para poder invertir en estos días. María compra y venD. su mercadería al contado y tiene la característica D. ser muy responsable y puntual con los negocios.
texts.en:
María D. los Ángeles C. D. V. is 31 years old and resides in Ciudad Delgado. She lives together with her husband and three daughters. She owns a clothing store which is situated in the streets of San Salvador city centre, the capital of the country. María is requesting a loan in order to purchase more clothes, above all pants as these sell most in this holiday season. For this, she wishes to obtain the necessary capital so she can invest these days. María buys and sells her merchandise in cash and is characterized as very responsible and punctual with her business.

Translated from Spanish by karl baumgarten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pants

location.town: Ciudad Delgado en el departamento de San  Salvador

loans.name: Samiullah Ahmadzi Group

texts.en:
This is the Samiullah A. Group The group has four members, all of whom are men. The members want to improve their businesses so they have requested a loan of 56000 Afghani. 

Samiullah, the group leader, is a tailor. He owns a shop in which he sews different kinds of clothes. With the loan, he would like to buy more sewing machines, because he has problems with the old ones. He also needs more material to make new and different clothing to sell.

Another member, Abdullah, has a general store. He wants to use the loan funds to buy things that are in high demand in his market but are not available in his shop.

The third member, Nasir, sells second-hand clothes. He would like to improve his business and change it. So, he would like to take a loan to purchase the supplies to do it.

The last member, Zabiullah, does embroidery. He has a small shop where he works and most of his clients like his work.

loans.use: To improve their businesses

loans.name: Alhamdulilia Group

texts.en:
These are members of the 'Alhamdulilai' Group. They are small-scale businesswomen based in Makeni city, in northern Sierra Leone. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit, and consequently improve their standard of living.

Fatu B. in the middle of the photo is the leader of this group. Fatu was born in Makeni. She is age 55, married with 4 children all of whom are now grown-ups and on their own. Her husband is a tailor. For 20 years now, Fatu has been selling rice and 'gari' (food made out of ground cassava). She also sells fried cakes, meat, dried fish, and bread. With her share of the loan, she will buy rice, 'gari', and frying (cooking) material – oil, fish, onions, meat, etc.

loans.use: Buy rice, 'gari', and frying (cooking) material – oil, fish, onions, meat, etc.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice is a thirty eight years old woman. She is married with two children who are in school. She is a food vendor. She prepares rice and tomato sauce with fish and sell to her community on one of the principal street of her town. Alice’s lack of significant business progress is influenced by inadequate working capital.  She is constantly disturbed by price hikes since she is not able to buy food ingredients in bulk. She needs the loan to enable her inject additional capital into the business to scale up production and improve her meal quality.  She would be buying food ingredients like bags of rice, vegetable oil, spices and firewood in bulk. She is expecting to increase her profit to support her family’s finances.

loans.use: To purchase food ingredients in bulk.

loans.name: Las Sirenas Group

texts.es:
El grupo Las Sirenas tiene 10 integrantres.  Ellas se reúnen cada semana  para realizar sus pagos se consideran unas señoras emprendedoras y trabajadoras.  Este grupo está ubicado en Tierra Blanca VeraC..  

L. representante del grupo se llama C. Maria Gómez AndraD. tiene 34 años D. edad, y tiene  2 hijos.  ElL. se dedica a L. venta D. colchas D. hilo que trae con gran esfuerzo del Estado D.  Oaxaca y necesita el préstamo para surtirse nuevamente ya que dice que le va muy bien.  El sueño D. doña C. Maria es  poner una tienda D. ropa para seguir ayudando a su esposo en L. economía del hogar y darles mejor calidad D. vida a sus hijos.

Los integrantes son: Verónica A. López elL. venD. ropa, Consuelo López D. L. C. elL. venD. ropa,   Maria Del carmen T. A. elL. venD. comida,   Juana R. M. elL. venD. ropa y perfumes, Jacqueline M. V. elL. renta sillas para fiesta, Milagros Gómez AndraD. elL. venD. comida, Yoshelin Gómez AndraD. elL. venD. manualidades, C. Maria Gómez AndraD. elL. venD. colchas, Consuelo V. V. elL. venD. ropa, Ciria O. Hernández elL. venD. zapatos.
texts.en:
The group "Las Sirenas" ("The Mermaids") has ten members. The women get together every week to make their payments. They consider themselves entrepreneurial and hard-working. The group is based in Tierra Blanca VeraC.. The group's representative is C. Maria Gómez AndraD.. She is 34 years old and has two children. She works selling bedspreads, which take great effort to bring from the state of Oaxaca. She needs the loan to get a new supply, because she says she is doing very well. Mrs. C. Maria's dream is to have a clothing store, so that she can continue helping her husband with their household costs and give her children a better quality of life. The members of the group are: Verónica A. López, who sells clothes; Consuelo López D. L. C., who sells clothes; Maria Del Carmen T. A., who sells foods; Juana R. M., who sells clothes and perfume; Jacqueline M. V., who rents chairs for parties; Milagros Gómez AndraD., who sells food; Yoshelin Gómez AndraD., who sells handicrafts; C. Maria Gómez AndraD., who sells bedspreads; Consuelo V. V., who sells clothes; and Ciria O. Hernández, who sells shoes.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase supply of clothes and bedspreads

loans.name: Francisca Elsa

texts.es:
La señora FRANCISCA ELSA F. C. tiene 57 años, vive en el distrito DE  MOCHE, provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. Pertenece al Banco Comunal SAN BORJA. La socia presenta estudios hasta 5to de Secundarias, es soltera y se dedica a la venta de cosméticos como: labiales, colonias, perfumes, talcos, cremas, etc. Estos productos los vende de forma directa, mediante  catálogo o con producto en mano (stock), ella obtiene los productos mediante una compañía muy reconocida e internacional.
FRANCISCA vende los productos a sus familiares, amistades pero preferentemente a los  trabajadores de las fabricas de alrededor  de Moche quienes son sus clientes mas frecuentes.
Con su primer crédito de 300.00 nuevos soles compró: labiales, colonias, talco, cremas, etc. y ahora con su próximo crédito de 500.00 nuevos lo utilizará para comprar mas cosméticos como: labiales, colonias, perfumes, talcos, cremas, etc. Para cubrir sus pedidos y aumentar su stock.
Ella sueña con aumentar sus ventas  y mejorar asi sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Francisca Elsa F. C. is 57 and lives in the Moche District, Trujillo Province, Department of La Libertad, Perú. She's a member of the San Borja Village Bank. She is single, and has a fifth-year secondary school education. She earns her living selling cosmetics, including lipstick, cologne, perfume, powders, creams, etc. She does direct sales from catalogs and stock on hand. Her products come from a well-known international company. Francisca sells her product to friends and relatives, but prefers selling to the factory workers around Moche, who are her most active clients. Francisca used her first loan, for 300 soles, to buy lipsticks, colognes, powders, creams, etc.. She plans to use her second one, for 500 soles, to buy more product so she can fill outstanding orders and carry more inventory. She dreams of growing sales so she can increase her profits.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cosmetics, including lipsticks, colognes, perfumes, powders, creams, etc.

loans.name: Unity Five Group

texts.en:
Oretha T. is the leader of a group five borrowers called Unity Five. She is 38 years old, married, and has a 12-year-old child. She was not able to continue her education past elementary school and for 10 years has been selling dishware at the Red Light Market in Paynesville, Liberia. She always encourages customers to buy from her in a friendly way, which keeps them returning.   Oretha plans to use her portion of this 30,000 LRD group loan to purchase more dishware for sale. Her goal is to increase and improve her business.   In the photo that accompanies this profile, Oretha is the one holding the sign. Naomie K. is inset at upper right.

About LEAP:
The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution with 13 branches across the country.  Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship.  LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

Join the Team LEAP - Liberia lending team on Kiva today: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=10019

loans.use: To purchase more dishware for selling.

loans.name: Paz Y Progreso Group

texts.es:
Guadalupe venD. comida hace 5 años en la puerta D. su casa con mucho esfuerzo pudo conseguir una carreta la cual es D. mucha ayuda para ella, porque pueD. exhibir los diferentes comidas que hace. Además los fines D. semana venD. golosinas, todo esto lo hace por amor a su familia. Con el préstamo recibido y algunos ahorros que tiene desea comprar un trimovil para aumentar sus ingresos.
Ines se dedica a la venta y renovación D. calzados juntamente con su esposo con los pocos ingresos que tiene pueD. educar y mantener a sus tres hijos, el préstamo obtenido lo invertirá en la compra D. materiales para mejorar los acabados del calzado que ofrece.
Con mucho esfuerzo Fausta pudo aperturar un restaurant hace muchos años este negocio la ayuda a pagar  a la manutención y  educación D. sus hijos. Además ella pudo construir su vivienda y dentro D. ella un local para eventos sociales: como fiestas D. cumpleaños, bautizos etc D. lo cual percibe ingresos por el alquiler del local y así pueD. tener mayores ingresos.
El grupo esta muy comprometido con los créditos y se comprometen a realizar sus pagos en las fechas establecidas.
texts.en:
Guadalupe has been selling food for five years from the doorstep of her house. With much effort, she was able to obtain a cart that proved to be of great help to her because she is now able to display the different foods that she prepares. On the weekends she sells candy. All of this is done out of love for her family. With the loan she will receive and some of her savings, Guadalupe wants to buy a “trimovil” (a three-wheeled motorcycle taxi) so that she can increase her earnings.

Ines sells and repairs shoes with her husband. With the little income that they make, they are able to support their three children and send them to school. Her loan will be invested in the purchase of materials to improve the finished shoes that she offers.

With great effort, Fausta was able to open a restaurant many years ago. This business has helped to support and educate her children. In addition, she wants to build a home and next to it an events hall for hosting social gatherings such as birthday parties and christenings. She hopes to generate rental income that would increase her earnings.

The group is very committed to their loans and promises to make their payments on the specified due dates.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase products & supplies

loans.name: José Alfredo

texts.es:
José Alfredo M. Rodríguez, tiene la edad de 31 años, está casado, y vive con su esposa y 4 hijos que tienen 9, 6, 4 y 2 años, ellos son su mayor prioridad. El crédito lo quiere para asistir su finca, específicamente para el cultivo de café, la idea es comprar el abono y el fertilizante. Desea darle el adecuado mantenimiento al cultivo de café para lograr una mejor calidad y para obtener el mayor ingreso posible cuando sea tiempo de cosecha. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Don José también trabaja desde hace muchos años en la agricultura. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productor. 

About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
José Alfredo M. Rodríguez is 31 years old, married, and lives with his wife and 4 children who are 9, 6, 4, and 2 years old. They are his main priority. The loan that he wants is for his farm, specifically for the cultivation of coffee. The idea is to buy various fertilizers. He wants to provide good maintenance of the coffee crop to achieve a better quality and obtain the best possible income when it is time for the harvest. This is the first time that he seeks a loan with FUDECOSUR and he is very satisfied with the assistance they are offering him. Don Jose also has worked for many years in agriculture. He hopes in the future to provide his family with a better quality of live and increased economic stability and to be able to continue growing as a person and a producer. About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Assistance with the cultivation of coffee

loans.name: Kalsoom's Group

texts.en:
Kalsoom is the wife of A. K. and they reside in a city named Borewala (famous for its shrines) in Pakistan. She is a very active lady. She performs her household duties along with her clothes-sewing business very efficiently. 

She is the mother of three kids: two sons and one daughter. All of her children are enrolled in a school and are getting an education. They all are living with a dream; her daughter's dream is to be a doctor; the younger two want to be professors in renowned colleges. This thinking gives her motivation to grow her sewing business. 

Her husband runs a grocery shop in the community. His shop is the busiest one in the community. People are used to coming to him for purchasing so he always needs of a good stock of groceries. Presently, his stock of groceries is insufficient to meet the requirements of his customers. 

Kalsoom is applying for a loan from Asasah to purchase groceries in bulk so he may increase the profits of his shop as well as the number of customers.

Note: "In this picture she is showing herself with her sewing machine because she does this work to share the financial burden with her husband."

loans.use: Purchase stock for grocery store

loans.name: Babi Rahayu Group

texts.en: Ni Ketut W. is a 46-year-old female living in the town of Melaya, Bali. She is the group leader of this fourteen-member group loan offered by MUK. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Babi Rahayu Group (PK-10151). Ni Ketut is married and has two adult children. She owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over ten years and earns approximately 100,000 IDR a month from these activities. In 2010, Ni Ketut joined MUK to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is now requesting a loan of 1,500,000 IDR which will be used to invest in expanding her business. The loan will be her first from MUK. Ni Ketut plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. About MUK: The mission of Koperasi Mitra Usaha Kecil (MUK) is to assist small businesses in Bali by providing training, business consultation and loans thereby helping the owners and their families improve their everyday lives. ***************************************************** Ni Ketut W. (0) merupakan 46 tahun wanita. Dia (perempuan) tinggal di kota Melaya - Bali. Ni Ketut adalah pemimpin kelompok sebuah kelompok peminjam yang terdiri atas 14 anggota. Meskipun setiap anggota kelompok menerima pinjaman perorangan, mereka semua bertanggung jawab untuk mengembalikan pinjaman rekan anggota kelompok mereka jika ada yang menunggak atau gagal membayar. Nama resmi kelompok peminjam ini adalah Babi Rahayu (PK-10151). Meskipun bukan satu-satunya sarana untuk menghasilkan pendapatan, sumber utama penghasilan bisnis tersebut terutama berasal dari beternak babi untuk dijual. Ni Ketut sudah menjalankan bisnis ini selama lebih dari 10 tahun. Dari kegiatan-kegiatan ini, Ni Ketut menghasilkan sekitar 100,000 IDR. Dalam 2010, Ni Ketut bergabung MUK untuk mendapatkan akses ke layanan keuangan untuk membantu meningkatkan -nya kondisi kehidupan dan kemampuan untuk menjalankan kegiatan bisnis. Ni Ketut meminta pinjaman untuk pertama kalinya dari MUK. Dia (perempuan) sekarang meminta pinjaman baru sebesar 1,500,000 IDR. Pinjaman ini akan menjadi 1st pinjaman yang diambil oleh peminjam dari MUK. Tentang MUK: Misi Koperasi Mitra Usaha Kecil (MUK) adalah untuk membantu usaha kecil di Bali dengan memberikan perlatihan, konsultasi bisnis, dan pinjaman uang, dengan demikian membantu pemilik usaha dan keluarga mereka memperbaiki hidup sehari-hari.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Reyna Elisabeth

texts.es:
la sra. Reyna Elisabet V. R. tiene 47 años de edad, es viuda y vive con sus 4 hijos que todos estan estudiando.
tiene 40 años de vivir en la aldea el Moraicito su un nivel de vida es modesto y se dedica a la  venta de abarroteria y refrescos, ademas recibe ingresos de un molino que tiene en su casa, en donde vienen a moler maiz los pobladores de la comunidad.
su negocio se ve fuerte y esta ubicado en muy buen lugar, cuenta con parqueo para vehiculos para los clientes, el credito lo utilizara para la compra de refrescos, abarroteria en general.
las ganancias las necesita para salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en:
Reyna Elisabet V. R. is a 47 year old widow. She lives with her four children; all of them are in school. She has lived in the Moraicito village for 40 years. She has a modest standard of living. She sells groceries and soft drinks. She also receives income from a mill that she has in her house. Community members come to her house to grind corn. Her business is strong. It is located in a very good place, and it has a place for customers to park. She will use the loan to buy soft drinks and general groceries. She needs the income to get ahead with her family.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy beans, rice, sugar, bread, soft drinks, shortening, toilet paper, sanitary napkins, candles, eggs, tortillas, corn and wheat flour, preserves, milk, cheese, sausages, chicken, soup, condiments, salt, salsas, and basic grains

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase farming supplies

loans.name: Maura

texts.es:
Maura es casada y tiene 4 hijos D. los cuales 2 estudian, Maura venD. alfalfa D. casa en casa y tiendas, su producto lo adquiere D. los productores a donD. viaja por las tardes y por las mañanas venD.. Maura necesita un préstamo D. 1600 soles para la compra D. alfalfa.
Maura es socia del Banco Comunal Sarita.
El sueño D. Maura es que sus hijos sean profesionales y comprar un carro para que su hijo trabaje.
texts.en:
Maura is married and has 4 children, 2 of whom are in school. Maura sells home-grown alfalfa from her house and in stores. She acquires the product from the farmers that she visits in the afternoons. In the mornings, she sells. Maura needs a loan of 1600 Nuevos soles in order to buy alfalfa. Maura is a member of the Sarita Communal Bank. Maura’s dream is for her children to have professions and to buy a car in order for her son to be able to work.

Translated from Spanish by Emma Felten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy alfalfa.

loans.name: Livingston Javier

texts.es:
Livingston Javier A. R., tiene 21 años.  Es soltero  y vive con los padres, vive en Ventanas provincia de Los Ríos. No tiene  hijos.

Livingston es un socio de la ventanilla rural la “Valle Alto”, que está ubicada en el Recinto Voluntad de Dios a hora y media de Ventanas. Son 23 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura. Esto es el segundo préstamo que ellos realizan en la Cooperativa San José.

Livingston se dedica a la agricultura, siembra arroz, maíz y fréjol. Realiza sus compras cada mes en la ciudad de Ventanas en Fertiza y en el comercial Peña y las vende en la misma localidad.

Solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de semillas de  arroz, maíz y fréjol. Piensa que el crédito es una oportunidad para salir adelante. Sus sueños es comprar una casa y salir adelante en los estudios. Enfrenta desafíos como las plagas.

Le gusta jugar indor y dolí.
texts.en:
Livingston is 21 years old, single and lives with his parents in the village of Ventanas, province of Los Rios. He does not have any children. Livingston is a member of the Valle Alto community bank, which is located in Recinto Voluntad de Dios, an hour and half from Ventanas. There are 23 members total, the majority of whom make a living in agriculture. This is the second loan they have taken out with Kiva partner Cooperativa San José. Livingston makes a living planting rice, corn and beans. He makes his purchases every month in the towns of Ventanas and Peña and makes his sales in the same places. He is requesting the loan to invest in the purchase of seeds for rice, corn and beans. He thinks the loan is an opportunity to make headway. His dreams are to buy a house and pursue his studies. His crops face challenges like pests. Livingston enjoys playing indoor soccer.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase seeds for rice, corn and beans

loans.name: Julio Olmedo

texts.en:
Julio Olmedo N. is 43 years old. He lives in Chillanes in Bolivar Province in Ecuador. He has 4 children, ages 25, 23, 16, and 8 years old. Julio is a member of the rural loan group ¨San Jose del Eden.¨ The group is located about an hour and a half from the town of San Jose del Tambo. The group consists of 20 members, the majority of whom work in agriculture.  

Julio works in agriculture. He does the buying and selling of his products in the nearby town of Matilde Esther. Julio plans to use the loan to maintain his cacao crops. With the help of the loan he hopes to become more productive in his agricultural business. His dream is to buy a house within the next five years. 

In his free time, he likes to play sports and enjoys the annual community festivals of the patron saint San Juan.

loans.use: to maintain his cacao crops

loans.name: Imeleta Lina

texts.en:
Imeleta Lina L. L. is 49 and married with 6 children.  She owns a business venture, driving a taxi.  Imeleta Lina has 2 years of experience in this business.  Imeleta Lina needs a loan of 1000 talas to renew her vehicle license.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 350 talas or US $142 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2010, Imeleta Lina joined SPBD.  This is her 1st loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Imeleta Lina's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

loans.use: to renew vehicle license

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita B. is a married woman who lives in Prk. Ipil-ipil, Brgy Vito, Sagay City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating 3 business ventures: sari-sari (general) store, fishing, and pig fattening businesses. Her husband Francisco B., who is 45 years old, works as a fisherman to earn his living, and also helps in his wife's business activities. Their only child is 19 years old. 

Carmelita  joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1992 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 29 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Carmelita  has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 29,500, which was funded by Kiva lenders, helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 10,000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  

This time, for her 30th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 35,000, which she intends to use to purchase more stock to sell in her general store and also to buy a side-car for her motorcycle transport so that she can continue to save up for the future to sustain their daily needs and to educate her daughter. Carmelita B. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To prchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Casimiro

texts.es: El señor Casimiro es un cliente que ya trabajo con la institución casi año y medio, el trabajo en banca comunales, las bancas comunales son grupos de personas la mayoría son mujeres que sacan en grupo y la garantía es el mismo grupo, el señor Casimiro es contratista de obras, el trabaja con una empresa de servicio de alcantarillado, su trabajo es duro por que el a pesar que hace los contratos con los albañiles también trabaja como albañil, su esposa en este momento esta viaje en su pueblo de origen en ahí ellos  tienen ganado, el tiene tres hijos pero ellos ya trabajan y son independientes,  el crédito será invertido en la compra de tubos para la construcción de alcantarillados, el señor es una persona de buena actitud y muy consciente.
texts.en:
Casimiro is a borrower that has worked with Emprender for almost a year and a half. He has worked in communal banks, which are groups of individuals (mostly women) that take out a loan in a group and are backed by that same group.

Casimiro is a work contractor and works with a sewerage company. His work is hard because despite contracting the builders, he also works as one. His wife is currently away in hometown where they have cattle. Casimiro has three children but all of them work and are already independent. He has a good attitude and is very sensible.

The loan will be invested in the purchase of pipes for sewer system construction.

loans.use: To purchase pipes for construction.

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es: El señor Oscar C., es una persona  soltera, muy sencillo y humilde,el nunca se ha casado, ya que vive al lado de la casa de su hermana mayor, pero el piensa en el futuro y tabaja para mantenerse y ayudar a su familia,  y ha logrado tener su casita en ocasiones su mama que ya es de la tercera edad, se queda con el y oscar, penso en terminar un cuarto de baño con mejor comodidad, para cuando su mama lo visita por varios dias, ya que ella de repente  se  enferma y el quiere su cuarto de baño, para cuando vienen los frios o las lluvias,y asi no salir a la interperie, que en un descuido salga peor y enfermen.
texts.en: Oscar C. is a bachelor and a very simple and humble man. He has never married, and he lives next to the home of his older sister. However, he is thinking about the future and working to support himself and help his family. He has been able to obtain his own little house, and sometimes his mother, who is already elderly, comes to stay with him. Oscar is planning to finish building a bathroom for greater convenience. His mother can use it when she stays with him for several days, because sometimes she suddenly takes ill. Oscar would also like to have a bathroom to use in times of cold weather or rain, so he would not have to go outside and perhaps get sick.

loans.use: Finishing the construction of a bathroom

loans.name: Jolly

texts.en: Jolly owns and runs Jolly Enterprises, a photo studio.  He has been able to employ two people.  He has been running his business for thirteen years.  He also works as a house agent so as to earn an extra income.  He hopes to open an outlet for his business in the future.  He has been guaranteed a loan of 80,000 Kes by his group members in Faulu Kenya.  He will use the loan to buy a digital camera and decorations for his business premises.

loans.use: To buy a digital camera and decorations for his business premises

loans.name: Mujeres Alfreras Group

texts.es:
El grupo Mujeres Alfareras está conformado por tres mujeres trabajadoras, esforzadas y emprendedoras originarias de Managua, una de ellas Losgia María R. de 40 años desde 1999 se dedica al comercio de ropa usada la cual tiene la meta de tener un tramo con una gran variedad de ropa.. Ella inicio con una pequeña paca de ropa con la cual le dio la oportunidad de crecer y apoyar a sus cuatro hijos de los cuales tiene a su cargo los dos menores de 10 y 11 años. 

Las otras integrantes son Odilia María B. quien vende ropa usada desde hace 13 años y Francisca G. quien es distribuidora de cajetas de leche, de masa, de coco, piñonate, coyolito etc.  Las cuales van a vender a sus colaboradores. Ella invertirá en gran cantidad de producto por la época en especial por la purísima donde es costumbre dar este dulce tradicional como brindis en esta celebración.
texts.en: The Mujeres Alfareras group consists of three hard-working, determined and enterprising women from Managua. One of them is Losgia María R. who is 40 years old. Since 1999 she has sold used clothing with the goal of getting a small store with a large variety of clothing. She started with a small section of clothes which gave her the opportunity to take care of and support her four children, the younger two at 10 and 11 years old being in her direct care. The other group members are Odilia María B. who has sold used clothing for 13 years and Francisca G. who is a distributor of milk, dough, coconut, piñonate (a type of candied pastry), coyolito (dessert with banana, sugar and cinnamon) etc. which she will sell to her partners. She will invest in a large quantity of products to sell during the Catholic holiday celebrating the Immaculate Conception, during which time it's customary to give traditional candies to others as a celebratory gift.

loans.use: The purchase of merchandise for their store.

loans.name: Mujeres De Fe Y Amor 3 Group

texts.en:
Claudita is the coordinator of her group, Mujeres de Fe y Amor 3 (Women of Faith and Love). She makes her home here in a simple structure with her two children. She operates a cafeteria and business selling underwear. Claudita says that her most difficult challenge is to finish her schooling. In the meantime she plans to continue enjoying to serve the Lord and share with her family.
Claudita is excited to be taking her first loan with Kiva partner, Esperanza. She has had her business for about five years, which she started with her savings. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying snacks, soda, candies and underwear. She will use the profits to invest in her business and pay for her studies. Her dream is to expand her business and be able to depend on it.
This associate began with Esperanza because she wanted to overcome economic crisis. Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients, many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti. Her group is located in Puerto Plata, a port town on the north coast where the economy is based on tourism. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable electricity and running water, none of which is potable.

loans.use: To buy snacks, soda, candies and underwear

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is an 18-year-old single man living with his parents in Lebanon. He has a technical school education and a strong and proven business intuition. He owns a successful hardware store which sells equipment and different materials. Today, he is requesting a loan of $800 from Kiva's partner, Ameen s.a.l., to expand his enterprise and purchase additional merchandise to reinforce his sales and increase his profit. His business is vital to help his father with the family's expenses. In the future, he hopes to develop his business so he can support and employ additional workers from the area and create a source of income for others.

loans.use: To expand his enterprise and purchase additional merchandise

loans.name: Wael

texts.ar:
وائل في عمر 45 سنة يعمل في نقل الخضار والفواكه الموسيمية متزوج وله على عاتقه اربعة
اولاد يحب عمله وله في المصلحة اكثر من 15 سنة يريد من خلال طلب قرض له من المجموعة الى تكملة شراء ارض وزرعها
يريد ان يعتمد على نفسه وان يؤمن مستقبل افضل له ولعائلته يسعى جاهدا الى تحسين الوضع المادي والاجتماعي يلقى 
دعم كبير من محيطه فهو مميز بعمله ومتطور وطموح
texts.en: Wael, 45, is married with 4 children.  He has been working in transporting vegetables and seasonal fruits for 15 years. Wael has a passion for his work. He wishes to get a loan from Al Majmoua to fulfil the price of buying a plot of land and planting it. He wishes to be independent and to secure a better future both for himself and his family. Wael works hard to improve his family's social and economic conditions. He enjoys huge support from people who know him. Wael is known for his outstanding work, ambition and willingness to develop.

loans.use: To fulfill the price of buying a plot of land and planting it

loans.name: Juan Francisco

texts.es:
Don Juan de 51 años de edad, vive con su esposa y cuatro hijos de 20, 17, 12 y 10 años de edad, residen en Lolotiquillo departamento de Morazán,  se dedica a la fabricación de artesanías, su trabajo específicamente es fabricar faldones de montura de caballos, yaguales y petates, estos últimos son hechos con tule, estos son los productos que comercializa dedicándose a tiempo completo.
El está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de materia prima para mantenerse activo con su fabricación de productos, la compra seria en tule y cuero, de esta manera contar con lo necesario para realizar los trabajos.
Sus propósitos son trabajar para mejorar su vivienda y apoyar a sus hijos en los estudios.
texts.en:
Mr Juan, age 51, lives with his wife and four children ages 20, 17, 12 y 10. They live in Lolotiquillo, in the Morazán department. He makes crafts. Specifically, he makes saddles, woven rings and bedrolls. He makes the bedrolls from reeds. This is a full-time business.

He is requesting this loan for the purchase of basic materials to keep making his products. He will purchase reeds and leather in order to have the necessary items to do his work.

He intends to work in order to improve his home and to support his children with their studies.

loans.use: the purchase of reeds and leather

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en: Marlyn G. is a married woman who lives in Pangobilian, Brooke's Point, Palawan. She earns her living by operating three business ventures: food production, buying and selling medicines, and buying and selling rice. Her husband, Orly G., who is 41 years old, works as a farmer to earn his living. They have one child who is 11 years old. Marlyn joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2004 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 15 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Marlyn has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 10,300 Philippines pesos (PHP) helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 20,000, thus uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 16th loan, she is borrowing PHP 21,000, which she intends to use to buy spices and ingredients for the food she makes. She would like to continue to save up for the future education of her children and family needs. Marlyn G. is a Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable) woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon. Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team: http://www.kiva.org/team/nwtf_philippines

loans.use: Fund the operations of food production

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David S. is 28 years old and lives in the town of Kyengera in the Kampala central region of Uganda.  He is married and has one child.  His child is not currently in school.  David has a small hardware shop, which he has had for two years.         

To help expand his business, David has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase hardware items for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, David hopes to generate greater profits and buy basic needs for the family.  In the future, David hopes to further expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase hardware items for resale

loans.name: Fabiola  Tomasa

texts.es:
Fabiola es una madre de familia de 31 años de edad que reside  en su casa propia junto a su  esposo y sus hijos en el caserío Yencala Boggiano, zona agrícola  y ganadera que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Lambayeque.

Fabiola se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales ganado ovino, caprino y aves de corral, en un corral situado cerca a su domicilio. Ella los alimenta de granos y pastos naturales, cuando ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que frecuentemente visitan la zona en donde reside. Esta actividad la realiza desde hace 03 años conoce el negocio a la perfección por ello cuenta con clientela establecida.

Ella desea adquirir más animales y alimento balanceado para ampliar su negocio y percibir mayores ingresos que le permitirán realizar arreglos e el ambiente donde cría a su ganado.  Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Fabiola is a 31-year-old mother who lives in her own house with her husband and children in the Yencala Boggiano hamlet, a farming area that is located in the Lambayeque province.

Fabiola raises and sells sheep, goats, and poultry in a corral near her residence. She feeds them natural grains and pasture. Once they hit the optimum level in their development, she sells them to buyers who frequent her area. She has been in business for 3 years and knows the trade to perfection, which is why she has a well-established clientele.

She would like to obtain more livestock and feed in order to expand her business and earn bigger profits, which will allow her to repair her farmyard. Thus, she sees fit to request a 1,000.00 PEN loan from Edpyme Alternativa, which will help her reach her goal.

loans.use: Purchase livestock and feed

loans.name: Fanny Marilu

texts.es:
Fanny Marilu G. C. tiene 28 años, Vive en Unión Libre vive con el compañero y con los hijos Provincia de Bolívar. No tienen hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R. C CALZADO SOLIDARIO se encuentra ubicada en el recinto   el Calzado pertenece al Cantón San Miguel, a media hora de la oficina esta ventanilla de 12 miembros se dedica a las labores agrícolas en ciclo corto de siembra maíz, papas fréjol, y a la cría de animales de corral y ganado vacuno.

Fanny se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, papas, fréjol y a la cría de corral. Compra sus productos en el mercado de San Miguel cada semana y los vende en la feria de los jueves en San Miguel.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de semillas de sus cultivos y comprar comida para los animales. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es tener una tienda de abarrotes.

Le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Fanny Marilu G. C. is 28 and lives with her common-law husband in Bolívar Province. They have no children.

The members of CALZADO SOLIDARIO [Calzado Solidarity] communal bank live in Calzado Recinto in San Miguel Canton, a half hour from the Cooperativa office. The 12 members of this group do short cycle agricultural work, planting corn, potatoes and beans, and raise farmyard animals and cattle.

Fanny does agricultural work growing corn, potatoes and beans, and raising farmyard animals. She purchases her products in the San Miguel market each week and sells them at the Thursday market in San Miguel. 

She is requesting the loan to purchase seeds for her crops and to buy food for the animals. The support of this loan will help her financially meet her needs, and face challenges such as insect infestations, illnesses, and the vagaries of the weather. Her dream is to have a small grocery store.

She likes playing sports.

loans.use: to purchase seeds for her crops and to buy food for the animals.

loans.name: Bobbie

texts.en:
Bobbie G. is an independent insurance agent with The Woodlands Financial Group (TWFG) Insurance Services.  Bobbie, who has been in the insurance business for nine years, started her business with TWFG Insurance Services in 2007.  Her business offers personal and commercial insurance lines to customers, including health and life insurance.

Bobbie has two employees who work with her in Corpus Christi, as well as agents in Laredo, New Braunfels, and Lufkin (all cities in Texas).  Until now, Bobbie has relied on referrals and word-of-mouth advertising to bring in business, in addition to networking extensively with local realtors and the Hispanic Chamber of Commerce.  With this loan, she will print and distribute a brochure promoting the services TWFG offers.  Having already established a strong clientele in Corpus Christi, this mail-out will focus on reaching potential clients in nearby towns.  This marketing effort will hopefully generate new business and provide a better understanding of possible new markets.  Bobbie’s long-term goal is to open a second local office, and she will use the response from this mail-out to evaluate potential locations.

For Bobbie, owning her own business means that every day is interesting.  With the insurance industry as competitive and time-intensive as it is, she says that “burn-out” is a major problem for insurance agents.  She thinks that she stays engaged because she is always doing different things.  As a single mother, Bobbie says that owning her own business allows her to set her own schedule.  She loves being able to spend time with her son and attend his various activities.

This is Bobbie’s second loan with ACCION Texas-Louisiana.  Her first loan provided the capital to start her business.  She says that without ACCION Texas-Louisiana’s help, her business never would have survived.

loans.use: to pay for advertising brochures.

loans.name: Rwemengo Tumanyane Group, Ibanda

texts.en:
K. Prosper is the leader of Rwemengo Tumanyane group in Ibanda. He is 53 years old and married with seven children, out of whom four are in school. Prosper has a grocery store plus being in charge of selling produce, which includes selling coffee, beans and bananas, and he is able to make over $22 in weekly profits. His store is in the Rwemengo trading center.

Fourteen years ago he started his business after selling a cow.  He is very hard working and social and he says that working with his wife has enabled him to succeed. He is also involved in the sale of milk from his cows and this supplements his income. He needs a loan to be able to purchase produce for the store.

loans.use: to purchase produce for the store

loans.name: Uheri Group

texts.fr: Kubuya B. Luendo est entrepreneur, vice présidente du groupe d’affaire de Trio « Uheri »,  âgée de 32 ans, mariée, mère de 6 enfants et tous fréquentent l’école. Son mari est un constructeur Maitre maçon. La cliente Kubuya B. Luendo est vendeuse des denrées alimentaires. Elle s’installe au long de la rue, au centre commercial Birere  parfois devant les grands dépôts, près de la mosquée Musulmane de Birere. Elle vient de réaliser 5 cycles opérationnels en bénéficiant de crédit de l’IMF  Hekima. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir de s’approvisionner avec des nouveaux produits vers Kichanga dans le Masisis, ancien fief du chef rebelle du CNDP (2 sacs de haricots, 4 sacs de maïs, 4 sacs de sorgho, etc.).  En plus, elle ambitionne agrandir son entreprise et construire une maison.  La cliente Kubuya B. Luendo remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres exclus de banque classique.
texts.en:
Kubuya B. Luendo is an entrepreneur, vice-president of the Trio « Uheri » group. She's 32 years old, married, and the mother of six children, who all attend school. Her husband is a master mason.

Kubuya B. Luendo sells food products. She finds a spot along the road, at the Birere commercial center, sometimes in front of large depots, or near the Birere muslim mosque.

She has completed her fifth loan cycle with Kiva's partner, MFI Hekima. She will use her new loan to buy new products in Kichanga in Masisis, former stronghold of the CNDP rebel's chief. She will buy 2 sacks of bean, 4 sacks of corn, 4 sacks or sorghum, etc. 

Furthermore, she ambitions to expand her business and build a house. Kubuya B. Luendo thanks Hekima for its actions in favor of the poor who are excluded from classical banks.

loans.use: to buy 2 sacks of bean, 4 sacks of corn, 4 sacks or sorghum, etc.

loans.name: María Isabel

texts.es:
María Isabel vive en el municipio de El Sauce del departamento de León, es acompañada y tiene 2 hijos a su cargo  quienes son su razón y motivo de sus esfuerzos. Trabaja actualmente en su propio negocio en una pulpería en su casa de habitación donde también vende refrescos y  tiene 1 año de estar dedicándose a esta actividad.
El destino del crédito es para darle un mejor surtido a su negocio, comprando productos tales como comestibles, golosinas y productos varios como jabones. Esto le permitirá obtener mejores ganancia diarias y sus ventas se han con un mejor aprovecho. Esto le permitirá mantener en mejores condiciones el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en: Maria Isabel lives in the municipality of El Sauce in the department of Leon. She has 2 children in her care, who are the source of her motivation to work hard. She currently has her own business. It is a small grocery and soft drinks business, installed in her own home. She has been in business for 1 year. Her loan will be used to purchase inventory for her business. She will purchase various products such as food, snacks and variety products such as soap, which will help her obtain better daily earnings and to increase her sales. This will help her improve the well-being of her family.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of grocery store merchandise.

loans.name: Ma. Luisa

texts.en:
Ma. Luisa is 45 years old and married with 2 children.  She works hard to provide for her family.  She runs a Sari sari store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 24500 loan through NWTF, to buy items like shampoo, groceries etc. to sell in her store .

Ma. Luisa has borrowed and paid 17 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the Sari sari store for 11 years and also earns an income from buying and selling vegetables and spices.

Ma. Luisa aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: Buy items to sell in her sari-sari store

loans.name: Mena

texts.en:
Mena is married and has three children. Her husband works with Zoom Lion Company, a waste management company. She assists her husband in the general upkeep of the home. 

Mena sells gari, detergent, sugar, rice and other items in both small and large quantities in Elmina. Her loan will be used to buy more gari, Omo-brand detergent, rice and other items. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a shop.

loans.use: to buy gari, Omo-brand detergent, rice and other items.

loans.name: Jean Batiste

texts.en: Jean Batiste is 36 years old. He has three children who are ages 6- 16 years of age. He sells different kinds of items which include sugar, salt, cooking oil and soap. Jean Batiste has had this business for 8years and his business is doing well. Jean Batiste is requesting a loan to buy  more items such as sugar, salt for  his store. He hopes to make profits from this capital and plans to save all his profits

loans.use: To buy items such as sugar and salt.

loans.name: Numan

texts.en: Numan is a 42-year-old man, married, and a father of two daughters and two sons. Numan lives in the Jabalia Refugee Camp in Gaza Strip. He is a taxi driver; he took out a loan from FATEN to perform car maintenance. The taxi is the only source of income for the six family members. Numan doesn't have enough cash to pay for the car maintenance, therefore FATEN's loan is necessary to improve the family's financial situation. Numan appears in the picture next to the taxi. About this loan product: FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the cultural context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see fundraising includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information, please visit Kiva's article on Lending in the Muslim World

loans.use: to pay for taxi maintenance so the car works for longer hours and increases his income

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora Group

texts.es:
El comité denominado Maria Auxiliadora está constituido por 16 mujeres, todas amigas y vecinas de Ciudad del Este. Ellas se encuentran en el décimo tercer ciclo. Son señoras muy activas y solidarias, ellas realizan actividades en el barrio para recaudar fondos.
Ellas se denominan como mujeres luchadoras y muy trabajadoras. Ellas luchan día a día por conseguir un mejor estilo de vida y brindarle a sus hijos una educación adecuada.
La Sra Francisca se dedica a la venta de ropas. Se dedica a esto hace ya un buen tiempo, por lo que ya tiene un grupo de clientes que siempre vienen a comprar de ella. Se siente muy conforme con lo que hace, pues ayuda a solventar los gastos que día a día surgen. Comenta que todo lo que ella hace es para brindarle un mejor futuro y una vivencia diga a todos aquellos que de ella dependen.
Ella solicita el credito para la compra de ropas de estación, lo cual le ayudara a cumplir con las demandas de sus clientes.
texts.en:
The 'Maria Auxiliadora' committee is made up of 16 women who are all friends and neighbors from Ciudad del Este.  They are on their 13th loan cycle.  The ladies are all very active and supportive, and they carry out activities in their neighborhood in order to collect funds.  They describe themselves as very hard-working and tenacious women.  They work hard every day in order to achieve a better lifestyle and provide their children with a decent education.

Francisca sells clothes.  She has been in this business for some time now and already has a group of customers who always come to buy from her.  She feels very happy with what she does as it helps to cover her daily expenses.  She says that everything she does is aimed at providing a better future and a decent home for everybody who is dependent on her.

Francisca is requesting this loan to buy seasonal clothes which will help her to meet her customers' demands.

loans.use: to buy seasonal clothes to sell

loans.name: Veronica Petrona

texts.es: Esta señora es originaria de de san Isidro las marías , es maestra y está ubicada  en el colegio de la comarca cruz de apante, tiene 10 años de laborar, su núcleo familiar  consta de 2 personas que son su hijo,  y su esposo, esta señora solicito su segundo financiamiento atraves del convenio con el mismo colegio, los mismos le han ayudado a mejorar sus condiciones y nivel de vida, ya que este ultimo lo utilizara para la compra de cemento, ladrillo, clavos, madera y mano de obra, para la remodelación de su casa y de esa manera ha mejorado sus condiciones y nivel de vida.
texts.en:
This woman is originally from San Isidro las Marías. She is a teacher at a school located in the town of Cruz de Apante. She has been working for ten years. Her nuclear family consists of two people, her child and her husband.

She is requesting her second loan through an agreement with her school, which has helped her improve her condition and standard of living. She will use this last loan to purchase cement, bricks, nails, wood and to pay for manual labor to remodel her house. In this way she will improve her condition and standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase cement, bricks, nails, wood and to pay for manual labor.

loans.name: Melitona

texts.en:
Melitona, a 39-year-old married mother of four children, works hard to provide for her family. The operator of a variety store in the Philippines for the past six years, she has requested her fourth loan for PHP 25,000 through NWTF to purchase additional supplies to sell in her store. She also earns an income from selling vegetables.

Melitona aspires to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more supplies to sell in her store

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is 39 years old. She is married to a local farmer and together they raise four children. Mercy and her husband did not finished their education due to financial hardship. To generate income and provide support for the education of her children, they are both involved in the farming business. They plant and harvest rice and have been managing a half-hectare rice field for almost 10 years. 

Mercy wants to improve her crop production.  That is why she is requesting a loan of P12,000 to buy seeds, fertilizers and pay for labor cost in transplanting the rice seedlings. 

In the future, with the help of this loan, she will save enough money to continuously send her children to school so they can have a degree someday to achieve a successful life.

loans.use: buy seeds, fertilizers and pay for farm labor

loans.name: Marlon

texts.en:
Marlon is 41 years old and lives in Macabayao, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. He is married and has four children. 

Marlon owns and operates a motorcycle to earn a living. It is called habal-habal, a single motorcycle capable of carrying two to six passengers and commonly seen in remote or rural areas. He has been doing this for over six years already. Each month, he earns approximately PHP 2,000. 

He has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 from GDMPC to repair the motorcycle and provide better service to passengers.  

Marlon joined Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative in 2010. This is his second loan cycle from the cooperative. 

In the future, Marlon hopes to pursue business operations sooner and improve service offerings. He also plans to lay aside a portion of his earnings for the education of his growing children.

loans.use: To repair the motorcycle.

loans.name: Ife Lodou Group

texts.fr: Le groupe IFE LODOU est formé de trois personnes qui mènent des activités complémentaires. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Marie, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la deuxième fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Marie est âgée de 29 ans et est mariée à Alain, un conducteur. Le couple a trois enfants. Des trois enfants, deux sont scolarisés. Marie vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants, et assure ensemble avec son mari les diverses charges familiales. Marie n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges, Marie mène comme activité depuis cinq ans environs, la vente de bijoux et de vêtements par le système de distribution. Marie s'approvisionne au Bénin et au Togo. La demande de sa clientèle devient de plus en plus grande et compte tenu de ses moyens limités, Marie n'arrive plus à bien répondre à leurs exigence. Eu égard à cela et compte tenu de leurs ressources limitées, Marie et les autres membres du groupe IFE LODOU sollicitent ensemble un second crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en: IFE LODOU group consists of three people who run complementary activities. The representative of this group, Marie, is the one with the raised hand in the picture. This is the second time this group is seeking financial support from ALIDé to improve the level of their activity. Marie is 29 years old and is married to Alain, a driver. The couple has three children, two of which are attending school. Marie lives with her husband and their children and together with her husband she takes care of family expenses. Marie does not have a school education. To deal with her different responsabilities, including the business that she has been running for five years, the sale of jewelry and clothing by distribution system. Marie purchases her supplies in Benin and Togo. The customer demand is growing and given her limited resources, Marie can no longer respond to it. For this reason Marie and the other members of the IFE LODOU group are requesting a second loan from ALIDé.

loans.use: to purchase jewelry and clothing

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
Lidia D. 56 años, vive con su familia en su casa propia, cuenta con el servicio sólo D. luz, ubicado en el distrito D. Cayaltí que pertenece a la provincia D. Chiclayo.  Zona D. actividad agrícola y ganadera.

Lidia cuenta con su negocio D. comida, el cual es ambulatorio y lo tiene en el parque principal D. lazona donD. vive, actividad que realiza desD. hace varios años, cuenta con su propia clientela, es conocida por la limpieza y la buena sazón que tiene, con los ingresos que adquiera podrá tener una mejor calidad D. vida.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa  D. 800 nuevos soles para comprar insumos para seguir preparando sus ricas comidas, brindando un buen servicio a sus clientes y con sus ganancias cubrir sus gastos familiares.  Lidia con su trabajo y sus ganas D. salir adelante se ha ganado la confianza D. sus clientes, con la finalidad D. que más adelante tenga un negocio granD. D. todo tipo D. comida.
texts.en:
Lidia, 56, lives with her family in her own house that only has electricity and is located in Cayatlí District that belongs to Chiclayo Province; it’s a farming and livestock raising area.

Lidia has an ambulatory food business located in the park in the neighborhood where she lives.  She’s been doing this activity for many years and has an established clientele.  She’s known for her cleanliness and tasty preparations.  Income obtained will help her have a better quality of life.

She has asked Edpyme Alternativa for an 800 new sol loan to buy the ingredients she needs to continue preparing her delicious meals providing good customer service so that she can uses profits earned to cover family expenses.  With her work and drive to get ahead, Lidia has earned the trust of her customers with the aim of having a large business with all types of food.

loans.use: to buy food preparation ingredients.

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es:
María, es soltera ella se dedica a vender pupusas de queso, chicharon, revueltas y bebidas, gaseosas, chocolate y refrescos  por las tardes sábado y domingo.
