Apolinar and his wife comment that the death of their 22-year-old son two months ago brought about some unexpected high expenses that made it impossible for them to be able to buy organic manure and potato seed. They came by our CIDRE offices in person to request a loan because they had prepared fields ready. According to them, they produce potatoes, lima beans, oca (a tuber), papalisa (an Andean tuber). This is their only source of yearly income with which they support the family and pay for the education of their two children who are in primary school. Lastly, they say they will plant larger surfaces.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy organic manure and potato seed.

loans.name: Jose

texts.pt:
José F. conseguiu comprar todos materiais acordados e foi para o proposito que se havia planificado.

Foi possível pagar de acordo o calendário estabelecido e não teve nenhum problema, a sua obra esta decorrendo normalmente.

Houve mudanças na sua vida porque melhorou uma parte da sua residência e com o novo empréstimo no valor de 19.700.00mt pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, areia, pedra e outros) para dar continuidade com a construção da sua residência.

Sente se feliz com o empréstimo porque esta conseguindo dar melhores condições de habitabilidade a sua família. No futuro pretende solicitar mais empréstimo para continuar com ampliação da sua casa.
texts.en:
José F. was able to purchase all of the agreed upon materials and they were used for the purpose that had been planned.  

He was able to pay in accordance with the established schedule and he did not have any problems.  His project is proceeding normally.  

There have been changes in his life because he improved part of his home, and with a new loan for 19.700.00mt he plans to purchase construction materials (cement, sand, stones, etc.) to continue building his house. 

He is happy with the loan because he is able to provide better living conditions to his family.  In the future he plans to request more loans to continue enlarging his house.

loans.use: purchase construction material (cement, sand, stones, etc.)

loans.name: Josefina Aquino

texts.es: Para la señora Josefina Aquino, quien tiene 49 años de edad,  comenta que su vida siempre la ha dedicado al comercio, ella nos comenta que vende ropa típica,  los fines de semana en la puerta de su casa juntamente con sus frutas pero viaja 3 veces por semana a otro departamento para la venta de ropa típica, ella se siente realizada ya que con el apoyo que recibe del crédito a través de sus ganancias ella sigue pagando la compra de  su casa que es su mayor sueño y que está casi por terminar, y el dedicarse a su negocio también ayuda económicamente a su hermana al cuidado de sus 4 sobrinos ya que ella es soltera y dice ver lejos la posibilidad de formar su propio hogar, y hacer lo que hace la hace feliz.
texts.en: Josefina Aquino, 49 years old, says that her life has always been dedicated to sales. She tells us that she sells typical clothing on the weekends out of the doorway of her home along with fruit, but she travels three times each week to another department (county) to sell typical clothing. She feels fulfilled because with the help of the loan she received as well as through her revenue, she can continue paying off her house, which is her greatest dream, and she is almost done paying for it. By working in her business, she is also helping her sister financially to care for her four nieces/nephews since her sister is single and, Josefina says, far from being able to afford her own home and do what makes her happy.

loans.use: Purchase typical clothing

loans.name: Avelina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE LOS TEMBLORES II”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco  y departamento de Cusco.


La socia es la Sra. Avelina; ella tiene 47 años de edad y es viuda y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de fabricación y venta de helados, ella trabaja desde las 5:00 a.m hasta 8:00 p.m y después lo vende en las diferentes calles de la ciudad de Cusco, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de helados. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar insumos para hacer los helados.


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the community bank “SEÑOR DE LOS TEMBLORES II”. The bank is located in the district of Cusco, which belongs to the province and department of Cusco.

The member is Ms. Avelina, she is 47 years old and a widow with 3 children.  She alternates her daily activities with her business of making and selling ice cream. She works from 5:00 am to 8:00 pm and then sells her product directly on the streets of the city of Cusco. She wants to expand her business of selling ice cream. She is requesting a loan to buy ingredients to make ice cream.

She thanks those who are a part of this dream by means of this loan and agrees to comply with the payment of her loan within the established time.

loans.use: Buy ingredients to make ice cream.

loans.name: Ekua Atta Martha

texts.en: Ekua Atta Martha A. is married to a driver and they live together with their two children. She has not received any formal education. Ekua smokes fresh fish  for sale at Abura. Ekua will use the loan to purchase more fresh fish to smoke for sale. She assists her husband in taking care of the children. She hopes to reinvest her additional income.

loans.use: purchase more fresh fish to smoke for sale

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana es socia del  Banco Comunal “Micaela Bastidas”, ubicado en el distrito D. Ilave, provincia D. el Collao, Departamento D. Puno, tiene 61 años D. edad, es viuda y tiene cuatro hijos.  Solo pudo estudiar la primaria.
Juana está trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace ocho años, el primer préstamo solicitado fue D. S/.300. 00 nuevo soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio D. venta D. cuero D. alpaca.
La señora solicitará un nuevo crédito D. S/ 1200.00 nuevo soles, éste dinero lo invertirá en su negocio y comprará más insumos. 
Su sueño  es seguir adelante con su negocio.
Lo  que le gusta del Banco Comunal  es la facilidad D. los préstamos.
texts.en:
Juana is a member of the communal Bank "Micaela Bastidas", located in the district of Ilave, province of El Collao, department of Puno. She is 61 years old, widowed and the mother of four children. She could only attend elementary school.

Juana has been working with the microfinance institution Movimiento Manuela Ramos for eight years. Her first loan amounting to 300 nuevos soles was invested in her business selling alpaca leather. She applies for a new loan of 1200 nuevos soles which she will invest in her business and buy more supplies. Her dream is to go ahead with her business.

What she likes about the communal bank is the simplicity of the loan process.

loans.use: To buy alpaca leather

loans.name: Martin

texts.es:
Martin vive en casa propia cuyo domicilio esta ubicado en la comunidad Chahuira pampa. El es productor lechero y su esposa le colabora en todas las actividades agrícolas. Es su principal fuente de ingreso para su manutención. Martin tiene tres hijos con su esposa. 
 
El préstamo lo destinara para la compra de una vaca lechera. Esto le permitirá aumentar su producción de leche y mejorar sus ingresos.
 
Es primer crédito con Impro.
texts.en:
Martin lives in his own house; this residence is located in the community of Chahuira Pampa. He is a dairy farmer, and his wife helps him in all of his agricultural work. This is his main source of income and support. Martin and his wife have three children. 

The loan will be used to buy a dairy cow. This will permit him to increase his milk production and improve his income. 
 
This is his first loan with Impro.

loans.use: Buying a dairy cow to increase his milk production volume and improve his income

loans.name: Sauda

texts.en:
Sauda is 33 years old and is married with one child who is 9 years old. Sauda provides secretarial services. She has been in this business for about five years and she works from 8 a.m. until 7 p.m. every day except Saturday. She currently employs two people.

Sauda has requested a loan to purchase additional items such as a photocopier, more printers and paper.  If successful, Sauda hopes to continue building a secure future for her family by reinvesting any profits into her business.

loans.use: To purchase more equipment for the business

loans.name: Tahreer

texts.en:
Tahreer is a young woman from Rafah city in Gaza Strip. She is engaged and preparing for her wedding in a few months. Tahreer's fiance is a Palestinian National Authority employee. Tahreer took out a loan from FATEN in order to help her fiance prepare for the wedding. She will use the $700 loan to purchase bedroom furniture.

Tahreer's father appears in the picture here as she is a religious woman.

loans.use: To purchase bedroom furniture

loans.name: Felipe Santiago

texts.es: Felipe hombre emprendedor con su esposa apoyándolo han logrado ir mejorando su vivienda le falta algunas mejorar pero están seguro que llegaran a lograr una mejor infraestructura.  De profesión Ebanista creó su propio negocio iniciándolo con apoyo de su hermano y esposa en la trayectoria se le presentado dificultades con la falta de financiamiento para invertir en el negocio. Ahora gracias al financiamiento que le hemos ofrecido ha logrado construir unas de la parte de su vivienda. El préstamo que solicitad es para invertirlo en el negocio en la compra de maderas e insumos necesario para seguir creciendo y generando ganancia para mejor su nivel de vida.
texts.en: Felipe is an enterprising man who, with his wife's support, has been improving their home. There are some improvements left to do but he is certain to achieve a better condition for their house. By profession he is a carpenter and he formed his own business with his brother's and wife’s support. He is facing some challenges now because he doesn't have the funds he needs to invest in the business. Thanks to the loan we have offered him he has been able to build a section in their home. The loan requested will be used to invest in the business with the purchase of wood and materials he needs to develop his business and to generate an income to improve their quality of life.

loans.use: To purchase wood and other carpentry materials.

loans.name: Rodolfo Antonio

texts.es:
El Senor Rodolfo D. E., es casado, de 38 anos de edad, tiene 3 hijos, habita en la Comarca El Espinal en Esteli, por razones financieras, nunca pudo asistir a un centro de educacion; desde muy corta edad se dedica a la agricultura.
Don Rodolfo recuerda que mas o menos desde los 13 anos de edad le ha tocado trabajar con sus padres en las actividades agricolas, sobre todo en la siembra de granos basicos.
Actualmente trabaja la tierra que le dejo de herencia su Papa y sigue cultivando granos basicos.
Realizo este credito para Capital de Trabajo, para compra de Insumos y Herramientas.
Su meta es tecnificar su herramientas de trabajo, para ser mas eficiente y productivo.
texts.en:
Rodolfo D. E., age 38, is married and has three children.  He lives in the El Espinal region of Esteli.  For financial reasons he has never been able to attend school.  He started working in agriculture at a very young age.  Rodolfo recalls that at about 13 years of age he started working with his parents in their agricultural activities.   They mostly worked at growing basic grains.

He currently works the land that his father left him, and he continues growing basic grains.

He is requesting this loan for working capital to buy supplies and tools.  His goal is to use 
modern technology as work a tool in order to be more efficient and productive.

loans.use: To grow basic grains

loans.name: Bashir

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 37 years old, married and has three children. Bashir used to work at repairing bicycles. In 2007, he opened his own shop for repairing bicycles and selling spare parts. He is well known and has a good reputation in his community.

Bashir is requesting a $2000 loan to extend the shop and install an external ceiling. He is aiming to expand and develop his work. This will help him to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: To extend the shop and install an external ceiling

loans.name: Julienne

texts.en:
Julienne is nearly 48 years old, and was born in Porto-Novo, Benin's administrative capital. Thirteen years ago she moved to the country's largest city, Cotonou, where she sells fish and fish-products at her stall. She keeps these in the cooler units pictured above, while sellind derivative products from the bottles. Julienne lives with her husband, Louis, and their two children, who have received education.

This is the sixth loan Julienne has taken from ALIDE, which she will use to purchase new stock of fish to process or sell directly, having repaid the last five loans successfully. In the long term, she hopes to expand and strengthen her business.

loans.use: purchasing fish and meat for processing

loans.name: La Fortuna Group

texts.es:
el grupo La Fortuna esta integrado por tres personas, dos mujeres y un hombre, se conocen desde hace varios años y trabajan juntos para salir adelante. se ayudan mutuamente cuando tienen problemas.
a continuacion se detallan las diferentes actividades que ellos realizan:

el señor Antonio M. G. esta casado y se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo diario, tiene una pulperia, tambien vende mariscos.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de redes para pescar y abarroteria para surtir su pulperia.

la señora Maria Saturnina G. esta soltera y se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva y ropa usada en las colonias y aldeas aledañas a la comunidad de Agua Fria .
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de un fardo de ropa usada.

la señora Nancy Noelia R. U. esta soltera y se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo diario, tiene una pulperia ubicada en su casa de habitacion, Nancy es una mujer solida en sus negocios y es muy anciosa por lograr lo que se propone.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de abarroteria para surtir su negocio.

los integrantes de este grupo tienen muchos deseos de salir adelante.
texts.en:
The 'La Fortuna' group has three members: two women and one man.  They have known each other for several years and work together in order to get ahead in life.  They help each other whenever they have problems.  We will now detail the different business activities that they are engaged in: 

Antonio M. G. is married and his business is selling essential food products.  He owns a grocery store and also sells seafood.  He will use his loan to buy fishing nets and groceries for stocking his store. 

Maria Saturnina G. is single.  She sells new and used clothing in the developments and villages neighboring the community of Agua Fria.  She will use her loan to buy a bundle of used clothing.

Nancy Noelia R. U. is single.  Her business is selling essential food products.  She owns a grocery store which is located in her home.  Nancy is a woman who is firm in her business and is very keen to achieve her goals.  She will use her loan to buy groceries to stock her store.

The members of this group have a great desire to get ahead in life.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, new and used clothing, beans, rice, butter, sugar, oil, coffee, soft drinks, soap, juice, soup, pasta, cookies, churros, candles, batteries, matches, bleach, toilet paper, sanitary towels, chilis, cereal, milk and sausages

loans.name: Progreso Mazahua Group

texts.es:
El siguiente grupo se encuentra a unos metros de una presa, la gente de esta comunidad Rioyos Buenavista pesca diario, desde las 6 y 7 de la mañana la gente viene a la presa para pescar, la gente comenta que los peces grandes no se dejan atrapar tan facil y llegan a pesar como dos kilos o un poco mas los grandes, pero nesecitan una lancha para ponerse enmedio de la presa y atrapar a los grandes, el Grupo se llama Progreso Mazahua porque dan a entender que el grupo quiere progresar y como es una comunidad Mazahua donde los adultos hablan el dialecto y los niños lo aprenden en la escuela, por eso el grupo desidio llamarse de esta manera, el grupo lo integran 9 personas, 7 mujeres y 2 hombres, en el grupo hay gente que tiene comercio como actividad pero tambien es gente que tiene animales, reces, caballos pollo y borregos, La Sr. Teresa es la encargada del grupo es la representante, ella se dedica al bordado de telas y costuras, hace manteles, abrigos, servilletas, tambien le hace a sus dos hijos su ropa, son chambritas como bulgarmente se le conoce en las comunidades. Doña Teresa tiene 39 años de edad, tiene 9 años de casada y dos hijos pequeños, el mayor va a cumplir 5 años y el menor 2 años, todavia no van a la escuela, su esposo trabaja en el negocio de compra y venta de reces, cria animales. Viven en casa propia y doña Teresa quiere apoyar a su esposo con los gastos en su casa por eso hace bordados para vender, nos comenta que lo dificil en su negocio es buscar los clientes para que compren las costuras eso es un poco dificil porque en la actualidad poca gente se interesa en comprar un arte,"el prestamo me va hacer de mucha ayuda haciendo las costuras y de ahi sale para poder ayudar en los gatos y con las ganancias hacer otra cosa, por ejemplo otro negocio y ver la forma de mejorar y pagar el prestamo, Mis deseos con el prestamo son mejorar y poder sacar provecho de las ganancias". Los nombres de los 9 integrantes son los siguientes:
1.-Zenaida G. R., tiene 60 años
2.-Juana P. R., tiene 54 años
3.-Alejandra L. P., tiene 30 años
4.-Teresa E. M., tiene 39 años
5.-Julia R. A., tiene 69 años
6.-Matilde R. R., tiene 30 años
7.-Norma Angelica H. C., tiene 34 años
8.-Andres I. V., tiene 29 años
9.-Andan E. E., tiene 60 años
texts.en:
This group is located a few meters from a dam because the people from the community of Rioyos Buenavista fish every day.  At 6:00 or 7:00 am, people come to the dam to fish.  They say that the big fish are not easy to trap and weigh about two kilos or more, but they need to take a boat to the middle of the dam to catch them.  

The group is called Progreso Mazahua [Mazahua Progress] because the group wants progress, and they come from the community of Mazahua, where adults speak the Mazahua language and children learn it in school.  The group has nine members, seven women and two men.  Members of the group are involved in trade, but also people who have animals: cattle, horses, poultry, and sheep.

Teresa is the representative of the group.  She works doing embroidery and sewing.  She makes tablecloths, jackets, napkins, and she makes her children's clothes.  Teresa is 39 years old and has been married for nine years.  She has two young children.  The oldest is about to turn five and the youngest is two years old.  They don't go to school yet.  Her husband works buying and selling cattle and raises animals.  They live in their own house.  Teresa wants to help her husband with the household expenses, so she sells her embroidery.  She said a difficulty she has in her business is finding customers who want to purchase her products because few people are interested in purchasing art right now.  "The loan will give me a lot of help making embroidery and from there I can help with the costs and with the income I can do something else, for example, another business and see the way to improve and pay the loan.  My wishes with the loan are to improve and and take advantage of the profits."  

The names of the nine members are:
Zenaida G. R., 60 years old
Juana P. R., 54 years old
Alejandra L. P., 30 years old
Teresa E. M., 39 years old
Julia R. A., 69 years old
Matilde R. R., 30 years old
Norma Angelica H. C., 34 years old
Andres I. V., 29 years old
Andan E. E., 60 years old

loans.use: to purchase cloth and thread for embroidery.

loans.name: Kabagambe

texts.en:
Kabagambe B. is an individual client from Ibanda. He is 36 years old and married with three children. 

He has a business of selling timber and firewood to builders, constructors and schools, and he employs workers to help him in his business. He is able to make 350,000 UGX as weekly income. He also has a grinding mill that supplements his income. 

He has been in this business for 10 years. He started this business as a result of selling produce and saving. He is very determined and he has built a strong clientele over the years. 

His dream is to be able to get into the construction industry and supply construction timber to big firms. 

He needs a loan to buy a motorcycle as another business as well as to buy more trees for firewood and timber.

loans.use: to buy more trees for timber and to buy a motorcycle to start another business

loans.name: Mattenneh

texts.en: Mattenneh is 26 year old and lives in Paynesville. She is enrolled at a university. Her partner works at the U. S embassy and they have two children. Mattenneh started her used clothes sales business two years ago. She sells bed sheets, comforters, and women's and men's clothing.  She is requesting a loan to purchase additional bed sheets, comforters, and clothing.  She plans to open her boutique in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase bed sheets, comforters, and women's and men's clothing

loans.name: Haja

texts.en: Haja is 55 years old, married and has two children. In 1995, she went into business selling wall clocks, household decorations, soap and clothing. She began selling these items to pull herself out of poverty and meet her family's needs. Today she works six days a week, 10 hours a day and earns about Le 1,300,000 a month. She has applied for a loan for Le 5,000,000 to buy more goods to sell to her customers and increase her monthly profits by about Le 300,000. In the future, Haja plans to finish working on her home and pay for the education of her children. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy decorations, soap and clothing to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Mehrangez

texts.en:
Mehrangiz is 29 years old. She is a hardworking woman. She is married and has two children. Her husband works as a butcher. Mehrangez sells perfume and different spirits in the center of market “Farovon”. She buys her goods from Khujand city from the company of “Oriflame.” She always buys high quality products and that’s why she has many regular clients and many orders. Mehrangiz would like to get a loan of 5,000 TJS to purchase new assortments of perfume in order to increase cosmetics and fragrance sales. 


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: purchase new assortments of perfume in order to increase cosmetics and fragrance sales.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en: Simon is single, living with his parents. He is a maize  farmer. He’s been in this line of work for several years having learned it from his father. He is asking for his third loan to buy farming supplies such as manure, insecticide and fertilizer. This will be of great help to him because, having everything on hand, he can initiate the planting and care properly for his crop. His goal is to help his parents, contribute to his family’s development, and forge his future.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies

loans.name: Cristobal

texts.es:
El Sr. Cristobal, tiene 38 años, esta casado con la señora Ismelda, de 28 años, ellos son de la Ciudad de Concepción, están casados desde hace más de ocho años , tienen dos hijos, uno está iniciando su ciclo escolar y el otro esta en el tercer grado.
Ambos dejaron sus estudios, la Sra. Ismelda lo dejo al casarse con el Sr. Cristobal, y este actualmente se encuentra cursando sus estudios en el mismo colegio que sus hijos.
Anteriormente vivian en otra ciudad, donde donde el Sr. Cristobal se dedicaba a trabajar como chofer en la empresa de los Hermanos Hurbieta, después vendió su casa de ahí para mudarse. Actualmente se dedica a la produccion de carbon, con lo que lleva el sustento a su familia.
Solicita el credito para poder equipar un poco mas sus hornos de produccion de carbon, con lo cual cree que pdra aumentar sus ingresos. Piensa que este crédito le sera de gran ayuda.
texts.en: Cristobal is 38 and married to his wife Ismelda, 28, and both live in Concepción.  They have been married for 8 years and have 2 children, who are studying. Cristobal and his wife did not finish their studies, but are taking supplemental courses in the same school where their children are enrolled. He had lived and worked in another city, working as a driver for the Hermanos Hurbieta, but after selling his house there, he now works producing charcoal to support his family.  Cristobal seeks this credit in order to increase production by establishing more brick ovens, and thus hopes to increase his income.

loans.use: to buy equipment for charcoal production

loans.name: Sonya

texts.en:
Sonya is 59 years old. She is a widow and lives in Yerevan with her son, daughter-in-law, and three grandchildren. She has a high school education and 26 years of experience as a mathematics teacher.

After retiring on a pension, Sonya refused to be out of work, and nine years ago she decided to organize her own business selling women's clothes and underwear. Owing to this fact, she shares the family's expenses with her son. Sonya is renting a trading stall in the trade market in Yerevan.

Sonya says she likes her present business very much, and she is very happy that she has her occupation in her mature age. Sonya received loans from Nor Horizon eleven times without repayment delay. This is Sonya's second loan from Kiva.

In her stall, she sells swimsuits and women's underwear, and she is asking for a 500,000 AMD loan to increase her stall's swimsuit assortment, as swimsuits are in popular demand during summer months.

loans.use: to increase the swimsuit assortment in her trading stall.

loans.name: Flor

texts.es:
La Sra. Flor pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Golondrinas II” del Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de  San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Está separada, tiene 38 años y 02 hijos que están estudiando en el nivel primario.

Cuando se separó de su esposo se vió en la necesidad de mantener a sus hijos.  Inició su negocio con unpequelo capital de S/300.00, con éste dinero compró una vitrina y empezó vendiendo dulces de harina y refrescos de frutas, posteriormente compró una parrilla para dedicarse a la venta de comidas preparadas. 
Actualmente cuenta con una amplia clientela que la busca por la amabilidad y el buen trato que les brinda.  Gracias a este negocio, ha salido adelante con sus hijos a los que mantiene y educa.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1000.00,  comprará  productos para implementar su negocio, comprará pollos vivos, ingredientes para sazonar, carbón para asar sus  parrillas, con esta inversión podrá captar nuevos clientes y mantener satisfechos a sus clientes actuales, pues su negocio está bien ubicado.

Flor es una mujer luchadora y emprendedora,  su sueño es contar con un negocio que vaya.  Está muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por brindar la oportunidad a mujeres como ella de poder hacer realidad sus sueños.
texts.en:
Flor is a member of the "Las Golondrinas II" (Swallows II) community bank which is located in Tarapoto district, in San Martín province, in San Martín department.  She is 38 years old, separated, and has two children who are in elementary school.  

When she separated from her husband, Flor found herself needing to support her children.  She started her business with just 300 Peruvian soles in capital.  With this money she bought a display cabinet and started selling flour-based sweet treats and fruit drinks.  She then bought a grill so that she could start selling prepared meals.

Currently, Flor has a wide customer base who seek her out for her kindness and the good customer service that she provides.  Thanks to this business, she has managed to get ahead with her children who she supports and educates.

With this loan for 1,000 soles, Flor will buy products to stock her business.  She will buy live chickens, seasonings and charcoal for her grills.  With this investment, she will be able to attract new customers and keep her current customers happy as her business is well located.

Flor is a tenacious and entrepreneurial woman.  Her dream is to own a business that does well.  She is very grateful to Movimiento Manuela Ramos for giving women such as herself the opportunity to make their dreams come true.

loans.use: to buy chicken, fruit, charcoal and bananas

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es: Maria Isabel: de 44 años de edad tiene 5 hijos, ella se dedica a la agricultura como a la siembra de maiz,siembra de frijol, entre otros,ella nos cuenta que en el tiempo que lleva dedicandoce a esta actividad le a ido bien gracias a Dios, ella esta solicitando este crdito para la compra de abono para cultivo y compra de semillas,el sueño de ella es crecer mas en siembra y darles lo mejor a sus hijos, para que en un futuro tengan mas oportunidades.
texts.en: Maria Isabel is 44 years old and she has 5 children. She is a farmer and she grows maize and beans among other crops. She reports that things have been going well for her, "gracias a Dios" [with thanks to God], during the time she has been engaged in this activity. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy manure for her crops and to buy seeds. She wishes to continue growing with her activity and to be able to offer the best to her children in order for them to have better opportunities in their future.

loans.use: To buy manure and seeds.

loans.name: Yosia

texts.en:
Yosia is a married father of six children age 13 to 2 years old, living in his own house in Hioma, Uganda.

The responsibility to look after the family solely rests on him and his dream is to educate his children. 

He has been operating a bar business for one year and the only challenge he faces is lack of adequate capital to meet the demands of the customer base.

His dream is to move into a more spacious place that can accommodate 100 clients. 

Yosia needs the loan to buy beers and sodas for resale.

loans.use: To buy beers and sodas for resale.

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
Sylvia is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Sylvia has a shop that sells clothing and beauty products from NATASHA and AVON. She has had this business for six years. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy stock from NATASHA and AVON to sell.   Sylvia has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Sylvia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks from NATASHA and AVON to sell

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida is a happy person.  Though she encounters daily problems on how to budget her income from the business, she is still optimistic that someday she will gain enough profits and will not have to live scarcely anymore.

She is 50 years old and has five children.  Two of them are enrolled in a university while the rest are in their elementary education.  Her daily minimum profit of P200 goes to their expenses such as meals and necessities for the children.  She needs to obtain more profits and that is why she is asking for an additional capital of P9,000 to buy eggs, coffee, milk, and sugar to sell in her store.

In the future, Leonida would like to keep increasing sales so that she can have good financial management to lift her family out of poverty. 
She also would like to continuously educate her children so they can pursue their own career someday.

loans.use: to buy eggs, coffee, milk, and sugar to sell in her store.

loans.name: Seur

texts.en: Seur is 52 years old with five children. Her youngest son works in Thailand. She has been with VisionFund since 2010 and her family has been farming on the rice field for many generations. She requested a loan to buy fertilizer for her rice field and spice plantation. With this loan, she hopes to increase her crop yield and also earn more income from her plantation.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her rice farm

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Oswaldo

texts.es: Oswaldo de 34 años de edad, es casado labora como docente de Educación Primaria en la Colonia La Fonseca desde hace 11 años, solicita su 3er crédito para invertirlo en mejoramiento de su casa de habitación reforzando las paredes que estan dañandose, y a ver si puede embaldosar la sala, es muy reconocido en su comunidad  como un hombre trabajador, honesto, que siempre esta apoyando a sus vecinos y que es muy unido a su familia que es por quien lucha cada día para lograr verlos viviendo dignamente, el cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa quien en conjunto con él también realizan cultivos en el campo en sus tiempos libres del que obtienen alimentos y así solventar los gastos económicos del hogar, el sus anhelos son tener siempre a su familia y brindarle mejores condicones vida.
texts.en: Oswaldo is 34 years old and married. He has worked as an elementary school teacher in Colonia La Fonseca for 11 years. He is requesting his third loan to invest in improving a room of his home whose walls are giving way and to see if he can tile the living room. He's very recognized in his community as a hardworking, honest man who always supports his neighbors. He is very close to his family whom he fights for every day to see living with dignity. He relies on the support of his wife, who, together with him, farms in the country in her free time to obtain food and as such pay household expenses. His desire is to always have his family and give them better living conditions.

loans.use: to improve his home.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria pertenece al banco comunal “San José de Urubamba” de la ciudad de Urubamba. Las reuniones de las socias del banco comunal son cada treinta días en la ciudad de Urubamba de la provincia de Urubamba del departamento del Cusco. 

Maria vive en la ciudad de Urubamba y donde realiza sus actividades económicas. Su actividad económica principal de Irene es trabajar en unos programas especiales de educación del estado. Ella también se dedica a la agricultura ósea vende y comprar choclo.  Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. 

En esta oportunidad Maria requiere el préstamo para comprar choclo.   

Maria agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Maria belongs to the communal bank "San Jose de Urubamba" of the city of Urubamba. The members of the communal bank meet every 30 days in the city of Urubamba in the province of Urubamba and the department of Cusco.

Maria lives in the city of Urubamba where she carries out her economic activities. Irene's main business is working in one of the state's special educational programs. She also farms or rather she sells and buys corn. She has been doing this work for several years now and she is doing very well thanks to the effort she puts into her work.

This time Maria needs the loan to buy corn.

Maria is grateful for and values the loan and agrees to make her monthly repayments.

loans.use: to buy corn.

loans.name: Oliver

texts.en:
Oliver  lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with five children and all go to school. She takes care of two additional family members (her mother and sister). She has a restaurant at the market. She works seven days a week. She has been in this business for the last year. 

Oliver has requested a loan of 600,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy more bunches of bananas, beef, rice, sweet and Irish potatoes. Her major business challenges are transportation and rainy seasonality. Her goals and aspirations are to own a fully stocked restaurant and build rental houses. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses are school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas, beef, rice, sweet potatoes and Irish potatoes.

loans.name: Zuhura

texts.en:
Zuhura is a 26-year-old married woman with five children, four of whom are enrolled in school while one is too young for school. Her husband Mwarobo, who is employed, also contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs. She owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for her children. 

Zuhura has operated a retail shop for the past four months; her potential clients are the local area residents. She faces a major challenge of customers not paying their debts in time. She dreams of expanding her business to a wholesale shop in the future.

With the Kshs 15,000 she wants to purchase stocks of beans, maize flour, wheat flour, sugar, and soap for her shop. She decided to join Yehu to access funds to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of beans, maize flour, wheat flour, sugar, and soap for her shop.

loans.name: Tuc's Group

texts.en:
Tuc is 42 years old and lives in Dong Thon village, Yen Phong district, Bac Ninh city. She has three children, one of them has a job and earns an income. 

Tuc and her husband are farmers. Not only does she grow rice but she also raises pigs and poultry and sells vegetables. She has a monthly income of about 3.000.000 Vietnamdong (VND). The last time she received a loan, she borrowed 5.152.000 VND and repaid this loan punctually. This is the second time she has borrowed from SEDA. In this loan cycL., she would like to borrow 7.392.000 VND to buy vegetables to sell. She is the leader of an eight member group requesting a loan from SEDA. 

The other borrowers in the group are:  Nam, age 58, who wants to borrow 7.392.000 VND to breed pigs; Thanh, age 26, and Ha, age 21, who each want to borrow 7.392.000 VND to buy chicken feed; Xuan, age 47, who wants to borrow 7.392.000 VND to buy pigs; Ai, age 32, who wants to borrow 5.152.000 VND to breed pigs; Muon, age 51, who wants to borrow 5.152.000 VND to buy pig feed and Mai, age 46, who wants to borrow 7.392.000 VND to buy pig feed.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Maria Antonia

texts.es: María, vive con su familia, ella es comerciante, vende productos variados como los cosmeticos, zandalias, en ocasiones tambien vende antojitos, ella es muy emprendedora busca cualquier ocupacion que le deje un beneficio economico, actualmente no cuenta con mucho dinero para invertir en el negocio, esto le ha llevado a solicitar un préstamo, invirtiendo en sandalias, cosméticos, cremas, labiales, y también reparará la cocina industrial; este préstamo le permitira a María mejorar su condición de vida, por eso se esfuerza cada día para vender y no descuidarse de su negocio.
texts.en: María lives with her family; she’s a merchant.  She sells various products like cosmetics and sandals.  Sometimes she also sells snacks.  She is very enterprising and looks for whatever occupation will produce an economic benefit for her.  She currently does not have much money to invest in the business so she’s turned to a loan request to invest in sandals, cosmetics, creams and lipstick as well as to repair her industrial stove.  This loan will make it possible for María to improve her living condition and this is why she strives daily to sell and not to neglect her business.

loans.use: to buy sandals, cosmetics, creams and lipstick.

loans.name: Dung

texts.en:
Dung is a 40-year-old married woman with two sons. She lives with her husband and sons in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Dung has been running a food stall for nearly eight years. She sells noodles for people in the local community. She intends to take a loan to buy a greater quantity and variety of food to sell in her food stall to better meet her customers' demand. 

She hopes that through the loan she can earn more money with her current business and save additional amounts for reinvestment.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity and variety of food to sell

loans.name: Vanessa

texts.es:
La señora Vanessa con un crédito anterior a FVP puso sus protecciones en las ventanas y puertas, ahora desea seguir realizando mejoramientos y con este crédito quiere construir la loza de concreto al frente de su vivienda para protegerse de las inclemencias de los climas extremosos que tenemos en la ciudad. 
Doña Vanessa es empleada de una tienda de muebles desde hace dos años y su esposo trabaja en otra tienda de ventas, tiene cuatro años con su empleo. Entre los dos solventan los gastos de su casa y los estudios de sus tres hijos uno de preparatorio, uno de secundaria y el mas pequeño que tiene tres años de edad. 
Desean darles lo mejor a su familia  y que tenga un lugar seguro donde vivir.
texts.en:
With her previous loan from Credituyo, Sra. Vanessa was able to install security bars on her windows and doors. Now she wants to continue with her improvements, so this loan will be used to build a concrete slab in front of her home to provide protection from extreme weather conditions that are experienced in the city.

Doña Vanessa has been employed at a furniture store for two years. Her husband works at another store where he has been employed for four years. Between the two of them, they are able to meet their household expenses and the educational expenses of their three children. One child is in preparatory school, one is in secondary school, and the youngest is three years old.

Vanessa and her husband want to provide the best for their family and have a secure place in which to live.

loans.use: to build a concrete slab in front of her house.

loans.name: Caciano

texts.es: Caciano, de 28 años, es un joven muy trabajador, vive en su propia casa, construido a base de material rustico. Caciano es un joven centrado en sus responsabilices y trabaja con mucho esmero para sobresalir adelante con sus plantas de cacao, los cuales después de cosecharlos los lleva a vender a la ciudad de San Francisco, en donde ya tiene diversos compradores, que sabiendo de la calidad de su producto no dudan en esperarlo para comprarle al por mayor. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es sembrar sus tierras y hacerlas fértiles y productivas, lleva  05 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es fumigar sus chacras de las plagas, ya que tiene que hacerlo con mucho cuidado por que los productos químicos causan reacciones y teme por su salud posteriormente. El crédito solicitado es para el mantenimiento de sus cultivos. En adelante, espera seguir ahorrando sus ingresos por que desea comprar nuevas tierras. Este será su crédito número 01 con MFP, sabe que el dinero del crédito le será muy beneficioso para el desarrollo de su trabajo. Se siente contento por pertenecer al grupo de socios de su banco comunal. Con los 1,000 nuevos soles, contratará jornaleros para que lo apoyen en el mantenimiento respectivo de sus cultivos como: la poda, el desmonte y la fumigación.
texts.en:
Caciano, who is 28 years old, is a hard-working young man. He lives in his own house, which is constructed of rustic materials. Caciano is a young man who is focused on his responsibilities and works with great conscientiousness to excel with his plantings of cacao. After he harvests the cacao, he takes it to the city of San Francisco to sell. There are various buyers there, who, knowing the quality of his products, don't hesitate to wait for him so that they can buy his harvest wholesale. What he likes most about his work is planting his fields and making them fertile and productive. He has been doing this work for five years. He considers the most difficult part of his work to be fumigating his plantings for pests, since he has to do it with great care, because the chemical products cause reactions and he fears for his future health. 

The loan he is applying for is for maintaining his crops. In the future, he hopes to continue saving his income, because he wants to buy new fields. This will be his first loan from MFP. He knows that the money from the loan will be very beneficial for the development of his work. He feels happy to belong the group of members of his communal bank. With the 1000 PEN, he will hire day workers so that they can help him in the maintenance of his fields, for example, by pruning, clearing, and fumigating.

loans.use: to hire laborers.

loans.name: Achol

texts.en:
Achol lives in bor. She sells charcoal, and has been in business for one years. She is 30 years old, marriage, and has three children; two of them are still in school. 

Achol heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 46 years old, married and has six children. She sells cakes, doughnuts and bread to earn a living. She has engaged in the business for two years and has employed two people. She also does farming for extra income. Previously, she owned a van for a transport business. 

Rebecca hopes to open another outlet of his business in the future. She needs a loan of 65,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES) to buy an oven.

loans.use: to buy an oven

loans.name: Lindaura Ventura

texts.es:
Lindaura es una mujer de 46 años, vive en la ciudad de Nazca con su esposo y sus 3 hijos, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que junto con su esposo dedican todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente Lindaura no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional, ya que desde muy joven tuvo que trabajar para apoyar a sus padres, ya que eran una familia muy humilde, pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta escuchar música y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Saltado de Brocoli, el cual es el plato favorito de su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Lindaura trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de comida, ella trabaja todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 6 horas, ella cuenta con un pequeño espacio en su vivienda, el cual utiliza para atender a sus clientes, ella se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por su buena sazón y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Lindaura se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar el tarrajeo, pintado y la puesta de un piso de concreto en la parte delantera de su vivienda, ya que ahí acondicionará un pequeño espacio para su negocio de venta de comida, de esta manera podrá atender con mayor comodidad a sus clientes, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose con el deseo de poder lograr su gran sueño de terminar la construcción total de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Lindaura, 46, lives in the city of Nazca with her husband and three beloved children, who are her reason for living. She is a likable, hardworking, and enthusiastic woman; she and her husband put all their efforts into helping their family get ahead. Sadly, Lindaura wasn´t able to study a for a career because she had to support her parents and her modest family; however, she would have liked to pursue her studies. She likes listening to music in her free time, and occasionally she makes her family´s favorite dish, the delicious "saltado de brocoli."

On her own initiative and with dedication and effort, Lindaura works at her small food stand every day from early morning for about six hours. The stand occupies a small space in her house where she serves cutomers. She likes her work and believes it is successful because she treats her customers well and her food tastes good. 

Lindaura thanks the Kiva lenders whose support will allow her to plaster, paint, and install a concrete floor in the patio of her home. She will air condition a small space for her food business so that her customers are more comfortable. She will keep working and trying to achieve her dream to finish her house.

loans.use: to make improvements to her house.

loans.name: Las Vecinas Group

texts.es: Es un grupo formado por tres socias emprendedoras una de ellas es Lila se dedica a vender nacatamales desde hace cuatro años, es una mujer casada, y ella misma es la que atiende su negocio, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de materia prima como carne de cerdo, hojas de chagüites, vegetales, maíz, leña etc. Gloría vende también nacatamales  y Rosa tiene una pulpería en su domicilio.
texts.en: This group is made up of three entrepreneurs.  Lila sells nacatamales and has done so for four years.  She is married, runs the business herself, and will use the money from this loan to buy ingredients such as pork, chagüite leaves, vegetables, corn, firewood, etc.  Gloria also sells nacatamales, and Rosa has a grocery store in her home.

loans.use: to buy ingredents.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: She bakes flour products and sandwiches for sale to community members. She has trained others to learn her trade. She is also a learner of the TEACH skills lending program of Kraban. She wants a working capital loan of $1100 from Kraban Foundation

loans.use: Working CApital

loans.name: Suzana

texts.en:
Suzana is married and has six children. She lives in the Vingunguti area in Dar es Salaam. Suzana is in charge of her family after her husband died three years ago. She owns a food shop near her residence. She sells maize flour, rice, beans, cassava flour and other dry food. 

Suzana has decided to specialize in selling dry food to avoid the risk involved in selling perishable food items. Within the area, she is the only one with a shop selling different types of dry food.

She needs to increase the stock of these items before the rainy season is at its peak. During rainy season the supply of food from the "up country" is mininmal. The rainy season in the coastal areas of Tanzania is from March to June. She is in need of USD 750.

loans.use: to add Stock

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
For the past five years, Juana has dedicated herself to the manufacture and sale of tamales, a typical Mexican dish. Her product has been in great demand among her customers, and little by little she has increased her production to fulfill their orders. She started her business because of the need to pay for the education of her children, since her husband's salary is very low and doesn't cover all the necessities of the home.

Juana makes tamales for special events and banquets. Right now she needs to fulfill large orders and in order to invest in the supplies she needs a loan of $250, which she will repay over a period of 3 to 6 months. Your help will contribute to the growth of this business and the well-being of this family. They need you, and they are grateful for your generosity.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

Desde hace cinco años, Juana se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tamales, este es un platillo típico de México, estos productos han tenido gran demanda entre sus clientes y poco a poco ha tenido que incrementar su producción para cubrir los pedidos. Ella inició su negocio ante la necesidad de pagar la educación de sus hijos, ya que el salario que recibe su esposo en su empleo es muy bajo y no cubre todas las necesidades de su hogar.

Juana elabora tamales para eventos especiales y banquetes, actualmente tiene que surtir grandes pedidos y para invertir en los insumos necesita de un préstamo de $ 250 dólares, que devolverá en un lapso de 3 a 6 meses. Con tu ayuda contribuyes al crecimiento de este negocio y al bienestar de esta familia, ellos te necesitan y agradecen tu generosidad.

loans.use: To buy supplies

location.town: San Nicolás de los Garza, Nuevo León

loans.name: Carmela

texts.es:
Carmela is a very hard-working woman. She is single and she has a 15-year-old daughter, who is in school. She started selling jewelry 16 years ago, later she took a course to make traditional candies. She started her own business to be able to support her daughter and to have the resources to send her to school. Little by little she has been investing more in her business and thanks to the good quality of her products, she has managed to increase her sales considerably.

Now, she is requesting for a loan of $750 that she will use to buy the ingredients that she needs to make her candies. She hopes to increase her production and to cover all the orders that she has. She promises to repay the loan in 6 months. Help Carmela and her daughter, they are very grateful for the opportunity that you offer them to improve and to keep on growing with her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

Carmela es una mujer muy trabajadora, es soltera y tiene una hija de 15 años de edad, que se encuentra estudiando. Desde hace 16 años inició con las ventas de joyería, después tomó un curso de elaboración de dulces regionales y para poder obtener los recursos necesarios para el sustento y la educación de su hija inició su propio negocio, poco a poco ha ido invirtiendo más en su negocio y gracias a la buena calidad de sus productos ha logrado incrementar sus ventas considerablemente.

Ahora esta solicitando un préstamo de $ 750 dólares que empleará en la compra de insumos que necesita para la elaboración de sus dulces, con lo que espera incrementar su producción y cubrir todos los pedidos que tiene, ella se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en 6 meses. Decídete a apoyar a Carmela y a su hija, ellas agradecen mucho la oportunidad que les brindas de mejorar y continuar creciendo con su negocio.

loans.use: Buy

loans.name: Etimad

texts.en: Etimad is a 28 year old resident of the town of Saatli. He is single and lives with his parents. He buys cattle, raises them and sells them alive to the local market or to butcheries. He has been engaged in this business since 1997 and is now quite experienced in this business. As cattle breeding is traditional in the nearby region, it can bring in a good income. Etimad wants to develop his cattle rearing business by increasing the number of cows. He is requesting a $500 loan to buy two more calves to add to his livestock.

loans.use: To buy two calves

loans.name: Reyna

texts.es:
Reyna has seven married children, and one child who is still single and living at home. When the children were young, the family lived on her husband’s earnings. Now that most of the children are married, her husband no longer works. They rely on a small pension that he receives which is not enough to cover their living expenses. Reyna therefore decided to start selling plastic products and now, between her neighbors and other acquaintances, she has a good customer base. Because she was often asked about clothing, she began selling apparel as well.

Unfortunately, she receives numerous orders that she cannot fill since she relies on any earnings she makes for living expenses. She is asking for a loan of $675USD, to be repaid over a six month period, to purchase more merchandise such as clothing and other items that her customers request. With your help we can improve Reyna and her husband’s standard of living, despite their not having stable work.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Reyna, es una mujer que tiene ya 7 hijos casados y uno soltero, quien vive todavía con ella. Desde que estaban chicos sus hijos la familia vivió de lo que ganaba el esposo, sin embargo ahora que todos sus hijos están casados, el esposo ya no trabaja y el único sueldo que reciben es el de la pensión con la que quedó, sin embargo con esta no les alcanza para vivir, por lo que Reyna se decidió a vender artículos de plástico, entre sus vecinos y conocidos, hoy ya tiene más clientela que poco a poco le hace pedidos, y la gente después fue preguntándole por ropa y hoy maneja las dos cosas.

Sin embargo hoy tiene varios pedidos que ella no puede surtir, puesto que vive al día con lo que gana, y está solicitando un crédito de US $675 para pagarlo en un plazo de 6 meses y así poder comprar mercancía como ropa de la temporada y artículos que ya le solicitaron. Con tu ayuda, lograrás que Reyna y su Esposo, tengan una manera de superarse y salir adelante a pesar de no tener un empleo estable.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to sell over the holiday season.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en: Mariam K. is a dynamic 34-year-old woman. She is married and has three children. Mariam is a farmer and owns a piece of land that her parents gave to her. She cultivates several vegetables, such as tomatoes, cucumbers, carrots and eggplants. Mariam sells her products wholesale in the markets of Sassandra, a rural city on the southwest Atlantic coast of Cote d'Ivoire. Mariam belongs to some women's trade cooperatives. She would like to acquire new equipment, such as watering cans, shovels and wheelbarrows.

loans.use: To purchase agricultural equipment

loans.name: Osawu

texts.en: Mrs. Osawu A. is 38 years old. She is married with five children and lives in Benin City. She sells foodstuffs. She learned the business for a period of 18 months, after which she started hers in 1992. She is soliciting a loan of $875 to enable her buy more foodstuffs for sale. She is a LAPO client.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs for sale

loans.name: Busei A South E Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Nuru Z.. She is currently in the retail shop business and is requesting a loan to increase stock in the shop. Nuru is 26 years old and is married with a husband who works as a farmer. She has 4 children ranging from age 6 to 12, and her children go to school. Each week, Nuru makes approximately UGX 35000 in profits, and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to bank the money and save it.

Nuru is joined in her small group by Zainabu N., Fida K. and Sania K.. Zainabu N. has a business in tailoring and wants to uplift the business. Fida K. is currently operating a business in tailoring and selling new clothes, and wants a loan to trade old clothes as well. Sania K. operates a business of retail shop and wants to buy a fridge.

loans.use: To stock more shop items and boost business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To improve the range of  products she sells in her gift shop

loans.name: Amela

texts.en: Amela is 24 years old, a married woman  from the town of Zenica. Her husband  is a seasonal worker and he can earn  approximately  700 KM (about US$ 550).  Amela works at the market selling clothes. This is her first loan  in the amount of  US$ 1200 and Amela plans to use it to buy additional clothing for sale. Her goal is to invest the money in new clothes, and to earn additional money  for her and her husband.

loans.use: To buy additional clothes for re-sale

loans.name: Awura

texts.en: Awura P. sells soft drinks and mineral water. She is married and has two children. Business is going very well and she wishes to increase sales but she is running out of stock. She is asking for additional capital to buy more drinks to sell.

loans.use: To buy more drinks to sell.

loans.name: Tofu

texts.en: Tofu L., 51, is divorced with 6 children.  She has 4 years of experience in the potted plants and flowers business. She sells to the public and villagers 3 days per week. She has received 3 previous loans from SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 500 Tala (approximately 208 USD).  SPBD loans are Tofu’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. She will also use the loan to buy cement and timber for home repairs. Three of her children are assisting her with her business.

loans.use: Purchase new potted plants, fertilizers, tools and plastic bags

loans.name: Samiq

texts.en: Samiq Q. is a 32-year-old trader who has kept a food store in the small village of Imishli since 1998. His shop is located in a very good place near to the road. In addition to locals, other people who pass his store while traveling to other villages come to buy something from his store. Now Samiq has applied for 1000 USD to expand the inventory of the products he sells.

loans.use: To expand his inventory

loans.name: Señor De Luren Group

texts.es:
The Cangallo community is in the capital of the district. Most people grow fruit trees, but some also grow cereals.

Marlene sells clothing and small livestock that she sells at the Cangallo market. Marlene dreams of opening a clothing store, but right now her most important investment is in the education of her children. Marlene would like Finca Perú to teach her more about business and values.

Erika sells kebabs, and every afternoon she washes clothing in her home. Erika also sells vegetables on the weekends, and sometimes she buys and sells cereals. Erika would like to improve her family life, buying things for her home so that her children can have a comfortable place to live. Erika would like to save to expand her house. She’d also like to buy tools for her husband, who is a shoemaker. Erika says that before Finca Finca Perú, no institution has ever taught the people, or held their hands so that they can walk. She has learned that the best legacy that she can give her children is an education.

Lucydonia has a clothing store in Alcamenca. She also buys and sells cereals, as well as tara and suckling pig. Lucydonia was at a Finca Perú meeting in Huancaraylla, but she never thought that she’d also find a chapter in Cangallo. Lucydonia came to Finca through a friend, and now she is a partner. She’d like to build a house, own her own grocery store, and educate her children so that they can become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer.

La comunidad de Cangallo esta ubicado en la capital del distrito, esta comunidad mayormente se dedican a la producción de frutales, pero es poco la producción de cereales y la mayoría de la gente se dedica a este negocio

Marlene, se dedica a la venta de ropa, también vende animales menores los compra y lleva a la feria de Cangallo Marlene sueña con abrir una galería de ropa, por ahora lo mas importante es la educación de sus hijos. Marlene quisiera que Finca Perú le enseñe muchas cosas más, como valores y les eduque sobre los negocios.

Erika, se dedica a la venta de anticuchos, pero todas las tardes lava ropa en su casa. También vende verduras los días sábados y domingos, y otras veces compra y vende cereales. Erika, quiere mejorar su vida familiar, comprar cosas para la casa y ver más por sus hijos para que tengan un buen lugar donde vivir. Quiere ahorrar para poder ampliar su casa y comprar las herramientas para su esposo que es zapatero y necesita muchas herramientas. Erika dice: Nunca ninguna institución nos enseño y nos lleva de la mano para poder caminar, aprendí sobre las mejores herencias que tengo que dar a mis hijos es el estudio.

Lucydonia, tiene un negocio de ropas, ella vive en Alcamenca, y estuve en una reunión de Finca Perú en Huancaraylla, nunca pensó encontrar nuevamente a FINCA Perú en Cangallo, se enteró mediante una amiga y ahora es socia. Lucydonia, se dedica a la compra y venta de cereales, tambien compra tara y cochinilla. A Lucydonia le gustaría tener una tienda de abarrotes, hacer estudiar a sus hijos para que sean profesionales. Quiere ahorrar para poder construir su casa, hacer su tiendita y educar a sus hijos.

loans.use: The partners need different loan amounts. Some need 600 soles, some need 400 soles, for a total of 4,500 soles to the Community Bank.

loans.name: Hands Together Group

texts.en: This group is called Hands Together. Its members are Hawa F. and Kadiatu T.. They are petty-traders in Makeni City. These entrepreneurs have received previous loans from Kiva through SMT. Those loans have created significant impacts on the businesses and lives of these people.  Nevertheless, they want a new loan of Le 1,600,000.00 to further enhance their businesses. Hawa is the leader of this group. She is 30 years old, married with 5 children.

loans.use: Expand their businesses

loans.name: Favour

texts.en: Favour O. owns a tailoring store. He sews clothes of different styles for people. His customers are both male and female. He is 35 years old and is married with four children. He lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. Since the festive season is fast approaching, he is requesting a loan of $525 to buy more clothing materials for sale and also for sewing. He thanks all those that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To buy more tailoring materials for sale

loans.name: Yory

texts.en:
Mrs. Yory C. is a farmer in Doeum Pring village in Kandal province.  Since her field is far from irrigation, and she does not have any irrigation to generate water for her field, she decided to ask for a loan to buy a pump in order to water her crop.  With the rest of the money, she will buy rice seeds to cultivate.  

Her husband, Mr. Kuy Cheng, is a wedding chef who is able to make a small income to support his family.  Mrs. Yory C. is 50 years old and the mother of six children, three of whom help their parents in their current business, while the others are enrolled in the local school.

loans.use: To buy a pump in order to water her crop, and rice seeds to cultivate.

loans.name: Juana Julia

texts.es:
La señora Juana pertenece al Banco Comunal “La Positiva”, ubicado en el Jr. Huancavelica Nº 440, distrito de Callería, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 62 años de edad, es viuda y madre de 4 hijos mayores de edad. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en la venta de ropa usada. Tiene 7 años trabajando con el banco comunal.

En la actualidad cuenta con 2 motokar como herramienta de trabajo. Tiene el apoyo de sus hijos para el manejo de la movilidad.

Con este préstamo de S/. 3,000, el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará 4 llantas, arreglará el motor, tapizará los asientos, comprará 6 focos, amortiguadores, etc.

Juana manifiesta que su familia es unida. Agradece a Manuela Ramos por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Ms Juana belongs to the community bank "La Positiva", located in Jr. Huancavelica Nº 440, district of Callería, in the province of Coronel Portillo, department of Ucayali. She is 62 years old, a widow, and the mother of 4 adult children. With the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos for S/. 300, she invested in the sale of used clothing. She has been a member of the community bank for 7 years. She currently has 2 motorized carts which are a source of income. She has the support of her children, who drive the motorized carts. With this loan of S/. 3,000, which she will repay in 5 months, she will buy 4 tires, fix the motor, upholster the seats, buy 6 lights, shocks, etc. Juana says that hers is a close family. She thanks Manuela Ramos for their support.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 4 tires, fix the motor, upholster the seats, buy 6 lights, shocks, etc.

loans.name: Le Thi

texts.vi: Chị Lê Thị Huệ 50 tuổi, chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2004. Hiện nay ngoài chăn nuôi, trồng trọt gia đình chị Huệ còn làm thêm nghề đánh bắt cá trên biển, đây cũng là công  việc đem lại nguồn thu chủ yếu cho gia đình chị với thu nhập 3.000.00đ/ tháng. Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 9.000.000đ để mua thêm dụng cụ  phục vụ cho công việc đánh bắt cá tăng thu nhập cho gia đình.
texts.en:
Mrs Lê Thị Huệ is 50 years old. She participates in TYM fund since 2004. Beside raising poultry and some cultivation, she and her family also fish at sea, this is their main source of their income which amounts to 3.000.000 VND a month. This round of loan she is requesting 9.000.000 VND to buy fishing gear to catch more fish and increase their revenue.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy fishing gear

loans.name: Johana Patricia

texts.es:
La señora de Nombre Johana Patricia G. tiene la edad de 36 años, su estado civil es soltera, Doña Johana tiene 2 hijas su edades son las siguientes su hija mayor de 17 años cursa el 1 año de estudios generales y su otra hija de 12 años cursa el 6 grado de primaria, sus propósitos con este nuevo crédito es de satisfacer su demanda ya que con ello depende su ganancia por consiguiente tiene que proporcionar el aporte económico al hogar   sus sueños son de adquirir una vivienda propia por que en la que habita actualmente es de su Mama su deseos es sacar a su hijas adelante por lo que su importancia es que sus hijas logren tener una buena educación para que proporcionen progreso para nuestra sociedad y al país.


La actividad económica es la venta de cosméticos y ropa, la ubicación de su negocio es de forma ambulante, el tiempo que tiene de poseer su negocio es de 9 años, Doña Johana inicia este negocio por la necesidad de tener una fuente de ingresos ya que tenia a su familia a cargo y tenia que cumplir con la responsabilidad de proporcionarle a sus hijas lo necesario por lo que decide ofrecer ropa y cosméticos por lo que sus clientes eran trabajadores de oficina y  empresas locales por lo que decide incursionar en este negocio pero decide empezar con pocos productos como lo es camisas, pantalones y perfumes y es así como obtiene este medio de trabajo por lo que ahora necesita el financiamiento para capital de trabajo ya que tiene que realizar compras en los diferentes departamentos por lo que no quiere perder a sus clientes por no ofrecer lo que estos le piden ya que su mayor interés es obtener mas mercadería para ofrecer.
texts.en:
Ms. Johana Patricia G. is 36 years old and single. She has two daughters, one of whom is 17 years old and has one year of general studies, while her other daughter is 12 years old and has six years of primary education. The purpose of this credit is to meet the demand that already exists since she depends on the profits of her business to support her home economically. Her dream is to acquire her own home because she currently lives in the home of her mother and would like her children to gain a better life. Getting a good education is an important part of her children's progress and for society and the country. Ms. Johana's economic activity is the roaming sale of cosmetics and clothes. She has worked in this business for nine years. Ms. Johana started this business because of the necessity of having an income stream to care for her family and to meet the responsibility of giving her children basic necessities. She decided to offer clothes and cosmetics because her clients are office workers at local businesses. She started with just a few products such as shirts, pants and perfumes and in this manner was able to obtain work. She now needs working capital to purchase products from different departments in the country, since she doesn't want to lose clients if she cannot offer them the products they request and her main goal is to obtain a greater variety of merchandise to offer them.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kahn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Jorge Enrique

texts.es: Jorge Enrique R. S. tiene 66 años, está casado, y tiene 3 hijos. Todos sus hijos trabajan y tienen 38, 25, y 23 años individualmente. El negocio da inicio con el dinero que ha ganado vendiendo lotería, es por medio de este trabajo que logra establecer una pulpería en su vivienda. Ya que la administración de cada uno de los financiamientos ha sido provechosa para sacar adelante su negocio. Es por eso que solicita el monto de C$ 4.000 córdobas a un plazo de 12 meses. Sus sueños son de ampliar su negocio para que pueda más adelante pueda proporcionarle a su familia lo que ellos necesitan con la ayuda de las diferentes organizaciones.
texts.en:
Jorge Enrique R. S. is a 66-year-old married father of three children. His children are 38, 25, and 23 years old and are all currently employed. He started his business with the money he earned from selling lottery tickets, which is how he was able to set up a general store in his house. Each loan that he has received has been beneficial in helping his business thrive. For this reason, he is requesting a loan for C$ 4,000.00 Nicaraguan Cordobas, which will be repaid in 12 monthly installments. He dreams of expanding his business in the future so that he can provide his family with everything they need with the help of different organizations.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Silvia  Elena

texts.es:
En el municipio de Cinco Pinos de la ciudad de Chinandega, la señora Silvia P. con mucho esfuerzo se dedica a su negocio de pulpería el cual posee desde hace tres años con el propósito de llevar el sustento a su hogar y brindarle las condiciones de vida necesarias a sus hijos. Se dedica arduamente a asu actividad día a día y ha logrado salir adelante en su negocio. Ademas es importante destacar que ella posee conocimientos en la actividad de ganadería por lo que también puede desempeñarse en esta por medio de la crianza de ganado.

La razón por la cual ella ha acudido a Ceprodel es para ser beneficiada con un crédito para la compra de la mercadería ya que sus estantes se están agotando. Con este crédito se beneficia grandemente y beneficia a su familia que tanto requiere de su apoyo.
texts.en:
For the past three years, in the city of Cinco Pinos, in the town of Chinandega, Mrs. Silvia Perez has dedicated herself and put all efforts toward a convenience store business. She wanted to able to provide support to her household and the necessary living conditions for her children. She works very hard everyday in order to make her business prosper. Additionally, it is important to mention that she possess cattle raising knowledge and she could work in this area as well. The reason she was lead to Ceprodel was to benefit from a credit line that could enable her to purchase merchandise to fill up her business' emptying shelves. This loan would greatly benefit herself and, specially, her family that needs so much support.

Translated from Spanish by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Merchandise purchase

loans.name: Edith

texts.en: Edith A. is married and has 1 child. She has received schooling through junior high. Edith sells ladies' underwear, and also bakes bread for sale at Kissi in Elmina, which she has done for the last year. Her husband is a taxi driver. Edith uses her income to help her husband pay rent, utility bills, and other basic expenses of the family. Edith plans to use the loan as additional capital to enable her to increase the sale of ladies' underwear, and also the bread she bakes for sales to meet the increase in demand by her customers. With the new profits from her expanded business, Edith plans to reinvest in her business to expand her trade.

loans.use: Additional capital to purchase more ladies' underwear to sell and ingredients to make more bread to sell

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel G. is 37 year old father of three children. Two of his children are currently in school. He is very supportive of his wife in taking care of the children. He has operated a tailoring shop for the past twelve years, and is currently training two apprentices in sewing to equip them with skills and experience for their future careers. He sews all sorts of male and female wear with various kinds of styles; executive suits, shirts, kabas and slits, wedding dresses, funeral clothes etc. He is very creative and always want to come up with new styles. 

He wants to use the loan to buy more sewing material like linen, threads, thimbles, etc. to increase output and efficiency. He also hopes to increase savings to support his kids through school.

loans.use: To buy more sewing material like linen, threads, thimbles, etc.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 28-year-old man who lives in the Bekaa region. Ali has owned a grocery store since 2000. Ali has requested a loan of $2,000 from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his store. This is the first time that Ali has requested a loan.

Ali considers himself special because he knows how to treat his clients. His clients are his friends and neighbors. Ali decided to start his business because he wanted to improve his financial situation. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for his grocery store.

loans.name: Avaz

texts.en: Avaz R. is fifty-four years old and lives with his wife and three children. He owns a cattle-breeding business and has more than twenty years of experience in this field. Since cattle raising and selling is a profitable business, Avaz has become a very successful businessman. His wife and son help with the business because their family is always trying to help one another. Avaz works very hard and spends his weekend time with the cattle, cleaning, feeding and pasturing them. Now he wants to expand his business and buy more cattle, so he has applied for a loan. With your help Avaz can get ahead.

loans.use: Purchase two calves

loans.name: Mojeed

texts.en: Mojeed is 43 years old and married with three children. He sells VCDs (Video CDs) and building materials. He also has a phone booth. He is requesting the loan of N50,000 to purchase more building materials and VCDs to sell. He says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more building materials and VCDs to sell

loans.name: Jane's Group

texts.en: T. Jane is a hard working and bold lady who knows what she wants, no matter what. She is the leader of Kanyansheko Bakyara Twimukye group in Ibanda and a widow, with 7 children. All of her children are in O level school. She also cares for many relatives, although they do not stay with her. Jane has had a business of rearing goats for sale for 3 years, in Nyakigando village.
