La actividad que realiza Sonia es la venta de abarrotes en general y bebidas gaseosas, para eso cuenta con una bodega que abrió en su propia casa, desde donde atiende de manera amable y cordial a sus clientes, quienes en su mayoría  son sus propios vecinos que más de 04 años consumiendo lo que ella vende. Su hija es quien más la yuda en el negocio. Le agrada su negocio ya que le permite estar en casa y ver las necesidades de su hija y de su hogar, así como la cantidad que percibe y que le ayuda a solventar los gastos de su hogar, ya que con la pensión que le pasa su ex pareja no le alcanzaba. Viendo los buenos resultados que tiene hasta la fecha, tiene planes de continuar con su negocio e implementar y ampliar el negocio. Este será el préstamo número 3 con la institución MFP, por tanto espera de su colaboración, para continuar con sus objetivos. Además de estar a gusto con su banco comunal, ya que lo considera un grupo responsable y unido. Con el monto solicitado de 2000 nuevos soles lo invertirá en la compra de más abarrotes y bebidas gaseosas a precio por mayor para así tener mayores márgenes de ganancias y surtir más su negocio.
texts.en:
Sonia, age 46, is a hardworking and earnest woman. In addition, she is friendly and cordial. Sonia is separated from her partner, but she lives with her five-year-old daughter. Her nephew and his 11-year-old daughter also live with her in her home. Sonia sells groceries and soft drinks from a store she opened in her home. There she provides friendly and cordial service to her customers, most of whom are neighbors who have been doing business with her for more than four years. Sonia’s daughter helps her in the business. She is grateful to have a business in her home because she can look after the needs of her daughter and her household. The amount she earns helps to cover the household expenses since the support from her ex-husband is not enough. Sonia has achieved good results to date and she has plans to continue and expand her business.

This will be her third loan with the MFP organization. Sonia hopes to receive assistance so that she can continue with her objectives. In addition, she gets along with her Communal Bank and considers her group to be responsible and unified. The amount of 2000 PEN that she requested will be invested in the purchase of more groceries and soft drinks at a wholesale price. This will increase her profit margins and provide more inventory for her business.

loans.use: to buy groceries and soft drinks.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is from Buenavista, Oroquieta City. She is 38 years of age, married and has one school-age child. Her husband is a good farmer. 

Josephine has established a small business to help her husband earn income. She raises pigs for sale.
 
Josephine sells her pigs to her contract buyer. Josephine had been in this business for over five years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP per month. This is her primary source of income.

Josephine joined GDMPC in 2011 to access financial services to help her business. She has applied for a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase feed for the good growth and nourishment of her pigs. This is her second loan taken from GDMPC.

Josephine's revenue will be reinvested back to the business to double the return, and a portion of the profit will be used for the family and for the education of her child.

loans.use: to purchase pig feed.

loans.name: Kunjok

texts.en:
Kunjok lives in bor. She sells fish, and has been in business for three years. She is 28 years old, marriage, and has three children; two of them are still in school. 

Kunjok heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees.

loans.use: to purchase fish for sale.

loans.name: Nzyoka

texts.en:
Nzyoka is 34 years and sells snacks and soft drinks at a Voi Kenya bus stop. He is a father of four who has been in this business for the last five years with a good income.

This is his third time borrowing from VisionFund Kenya to finance his business after successfully repaying the previous loans. He will use the loan to purchase soft drinks and snacks. He will use the anticipated profit to establish a second business for his wife.

He hopes to have a happy family in future.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks and snacks to sell.

loans.name: Zeruya

texts.en: Zeruya is a single mother of six. She struggles a lot because much as she takes care of her children, she also has to take care of her aging parents, since she lives with them. Zeruya hopes that one day she will be able to start a new cloth business in order to be able to meet her customers´ demands. She is able to service her community by bringing these goods to her customers. We are proud to be associated with Zeruya as part of our PEMCI family.

loans.use: To stock her shop

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce is a client of Kraban Support Foundation. She has worked with the TEACH Lending program. She also has working knowledge of book-keeping. She needs a loan of $675 to expand her business.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Sewing and selling clothes

loans.name: Leata

texts.en:
"How would you like your dress to be sewn?" is usually Leata T.’s question to her clients. She is a seamstress, a mother, a wife, a breadwinner, and a provider. At 34 years old with six schooling children, it is not an easy task.

Leata has been able to receive two loans from S.P.B.D. already. The first one was used to buy materials for her clients' orders, then due to her increased clientele, the second was used to buy an electric sewing machine. Leata is very grateful for S.P.B.D. because it has been able to help her meet her financial/business needs.

loans.use: To buy more materials necessary due to increased clientele

loans.name: Elman

texts.en: Elman is a pharmacologist who runs his own private shop. He is 57 years old, married, and has 4 children. He lives in the Beylagan District of Azerbaijan. He has run his "green chemist shop" for several years, but he has experience in the business for 35 years. He has borrowed 4 loans from Normicro and has used them to improve his business. He is one of the best clients of Normicro. Now he wants to borrow $1,000 from Normicro to buy raw matierials to make herbal drugs to sell in his store.

loans.use: To Buy Raw Materials to Make Herbal Goods

loans.name: Sahil

texts.en: Sahil is a married man who lives in Khaladj, in the Salyan region of Azerbaijan. He is 37 years old and has 8 years of experience in this business. He would like a loan of $1200 to buy fertilizer and pesticides to develop his farming.

loans.use: To buy pesticides and fertilizer

loans.name: Uha

texts.en: Uha is 45 years old and makes a living producing and selling cakes. In a typical week, she earns about $20. She usually sells these cakes from a stall in the local market, or by going door-to-door. She is requesting a loan of $75 to produce more cakes, and will repay the loan within 12 months.

loans.use: To make more cakes to sell to her customers

loans.name: Franca

texts.en: Mrs. Franca O. is 33 years old and married with five children. She lives in Benin City; she sells beef in the open market. She is soliciting a loan of $1200 to buy more beef for sale. She learned this business for two years and started hers in 2000. She is a LAPO client.

loans.use: To buy beef for sale

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama A. has been selling women’s clothing for 5 years in a popular market.  She is single, 27 years old and does not have children.  She is requesting a loan of $325 to buy additional women’s clothing to further stock her business.  Ama is also a member of a lending group called “Everlasting Grace Association” which consists of 14 women in Cape Coast, Ghana.

loans.use: To buy additional women’s clothing to further stock her business.

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en: Khaled is a 32-year-old man. He lives with his wife and their 2 children in Borj El Barajneh. Khaled owns a mobile phone store. This is his fifthloan from Al Majmoua. Khaled is planning to buy new merchandise to sustain and develop his business.

loans.use: To buy new merchandise

loans.name: Asia's Tuvumiliane Group

texts.en:
Asia is 38 years old and is a married woman with 4 children, aged 7,10,16,and 18. She and her husband also take care of one other person, who is 22 years old. Asia owns a general store, which she started in 2005. Everyday, she works from 8am to 8pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $90 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business.

loans.name: Mathida

texts.en: Mathida I. is married with 2 children. Mathida lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She has a small store where she sells drinks, fried meat and pepper soup. Mathida is an energetic lady. She needs a loan of $525 to buy more drinks and meats for sale.

loans.use: To buy more drinks and beef

loans.name: Kong

texts.en:
Chea Chanthea, age 26, has one child and lives with her husband in Siem Reap province, Cambodia. After her housework is done, she works selling dessert in a busy market. She earns $5 per day. (Chea is pictured.)

Her husband, Kong S., is a motor-taxi driver. He normally takes a guest from the hotel and goes around the temple in Siem Reap. He also gives a one-day tour for tourists for $15. On average, he earns $8 per day.

To earn more money, Chea’s husband is requesting a loan from Kiva to purchase another motor-taxi. He plans to rent this motor-taxi to earn extra income.

loans.use: To purchase a motor taxi to rent for extra income

loans.name: Emanuel

texts.en: Emanuel O.  is resident of Kivule area in Kitunda area, Dar Es Salaam. He runs a retail shop selling household items and utensils. He also sells fruits and vegetables. He is in need of a loan to help him expand his business

loans.use: Expand business

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.es:
Guillermo has produced secure railings and other metal products for several years. At first he worked in a metal workshop as an employee, but then a year and a half ago he decided to set-up independently, together with his two brothers: they established their own workshop. Now they have a large site near his house in which several industrial machines are installed. In addition to his brother-colleagues, he also has two more employees who help them with the work. They distribute their products in commercial centres.

The loans Guillermo has received have helped to buy sheets of metal and copper. He would like to buy more machinery and in this way expand his workshop.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

Guillermo se dedica a la producción de llaves de rieles y productos de metal desde hace varios años. Primero, trabajaba en un taller de metales como empleado, pero hace un año y medio decidió independizarse, y en sociedad con sus dos hermanos, formaron su propio taller. Ahora tiene un amplio local cerca de su casa que cuenta con varias máquinas industriales. Junto con sus hermanos-socios, tiene dos empleados más quienes le ayudan con el trabajo. Ellos reparten sus productos en centros comerciales.

Los préstamos que Guillermo ha recibido le han servido para comprar las planchas de metal y cobre. A él le gustaría comprar más maquinarias y de esa manera ampliar su taller.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials, consisting of metal and copper.

loans.name: Doris

texts.en:
Doris T. is a 28-year-old woman. She is single with a child who is currently in school. She is an agro-chemical seller selling various kinds of chemicals like weedicides, fertilizers, pesticides, and spraying machines to the local farmers. Goaso, where she lives, is a farming community and because of that many local farmers patronize her shop to buy products for the current farming season where most farmers are actively preparing their farmlands.

With the loan, Doris wants to purchase more supplies of weedicides, fertilizers, pesticides and spraying machines to serve the needs of her customers. She hopes to raise enough income to sponsor her kid's education. She would be very appreciative of your assistance

loans.use: To buy increased supplies of weedicides, fertilizers, pesticides, and spraying machines for re-sale

loans.name: Genaro

texts.es:
Genaro es productor de leche de vaca, dicho producto es vendido  a la empresa procesadora de leche PIL para su transformación en derivados lácteos. También trabaja como pequeño agricultor, ambas actividades le sirven para mantener a su familia (dos hijos y esposa); vive en la Provincia Omasuyo Achacachi – Tipampa (a tres horas de la ciudad de La Paz).

El crédito lo destinara para la compra de una vaca lechera de mediana calidad, planea vender mayor cantidad de leche.

 Es el primer crédito  con IMPRO, nuestra evaluación nos diche que  califica para ser beneficiado con el préstamo
texts.en:
Genaro is a dairy farmer who sells cow's milk to the Bolivian dairy company Pil, which then uses the milk to produce different dairy products. Genaro also works as a small-scale farmer; both activities help him support his wife and two children. Gernaro lives in the Omasuyo Achacachi de Tipampa Province, about three hours outside of the city of La Paz.

He will use this loan to buy a milk cow of average quality so that he can produce and sell more milk. This is his first loan from IMPRO; he has been approved for this credit based on an evaluation conducted by the institution.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a milk cow

loans.name: Lugazi Kweyamba Women's Group

texts.en: Prossy N. is the chairperson of Lugazi Kweyamba Women, a group that was set up four years ago. She has a retail shop selling soda, juice and mineral water in Namawojjolo, a highway gathering place for selling roasted meat and chicken to passengers on the Kampala-Jinja road. Her previous loans have helped her buy more sodas, water and juice for sale and as a result, the profits have enabled her to look after her family, paying school fees for her children, repaying her loans as well as saving for her future plans. She has four children and takes care of her sister’s child. All of the children are still in primary school. She has a dream of buying another freezer that can stock more drinks. She is in need of another loan to help restock her shop with more soda, mineral water and juice.

loans.use: Prossy Nanyanzi needs to restock her shop with more soda, mineral water and juice once given a loan.

loans.name: Melania Aurora

texts.es:
La Sra. Melania tiene 37 años de edad, habita en un barrio de la capital que se llama Laureles Norte, con un hijo mayor que trabaja, su esposo trabaja en ventas y ayuda a los gastos del hogar. El negocio de doña Melania es la venta de ropa y variedades pues inicio desde hace tres años en la ventas, con un préstamo en una financiera pues logro poner su venta, a veces difícil ya que las ventas no son a como lo espera, ahora va a formar parte de Afodenic ya que le gusta la modalidad de pago como sus intereses que son. Bajos. Con la solicitud
Va invertir en infraestructura en la construcción de un muro en frente de la casa para tener un poco de seguridad para su familia, para esto va a  comprar piedra, cemento, arena y hierro. A largo plazo es invertir más en su negocio para captar mas clientes y obtener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Melania is 37 years old. She lives in the Laureles Norte neighborhood of the capital city with her oldest son and her husband. Both her son and her husband work. Her husband is a salesman and helps with the household expenses. Doña Melania has a business selling clothes and miscellaneous items. She has been a saleswoman for three years. With a loan from a finance company, she was able to start her own business. Sometimes business is tough, since sales are not what she had hoped. Now she is part of Afodenic and enjoys their repayment methods because their interest rates are low. She is going to invest this loan in infrastructure by building a wall in front of her house. This wall will give her family a little more security. For the construction project, she needs to buy stone, cement, sand and iron. Her long term goal is to invest in her business so she can pick up more clients and obtain better earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Priya Bapat, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials to build a wall

loans.name: Ahmed

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 21 year old engaged man who lives in Tyre, southern Lebanon. He has been working as a carpenter for eleven years. Ahmed does bedroom furniture, closets and he also does doors during construction. He has requested a loan of $1000 dollars from A. Majmoua in order to reimburse his debts. This is his second cycle and he has always paid on time. 
Ahmad is speciA. in his work because of his good behavior with clients. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When he first started his business, he didn’t have enough cash to open a shop, so he had to work at home. Ahmad has a good reputation for honesty and hard work. His future plan is to finish building his house in order for him to live with his wife and start a family, but in the long term, he plans to expand his business.

loans.use: Ahmed needs the loan to reimburse his debts.

loans.name: William

texts.es: William tiene 20 años, es soltero, vive solo en un cuarto que alquiló cuando llego a la ciudad de Juliaca, ya que es de un distrito llamado Cabana que queda a una hora de la ciudad. Se dedica a la venta de ropa, como mantas y frazadas, debido a que no tuvo posibilidades de lograr estudios superiores por las carencias económicas de su familia, se viene dedicando a esta labor desde hace 5 años, en los cuales ha ido progresando poco a poco para lograr ingresos económicos. A William le gusta mucho lo que hace, gracias a eso tiene esperanzas de un futuro mejor, él suele trabajar desde muy temprano y guarda su mercadería mucho más tarde para lograr mayores ventas, teniendo que soportar las inclemencias del frió por las noches y el fuerte calor por las mañanas, pero William siempre se esmera más y más, ya que sabe que todo sacrificio obtiene una recompensa. Él es un nuevo socio en su banco comunal, es así que se encuentra en su primer préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma, siendo muy puntual en los pagos, ya que agradece la oportunidad brindada y no piensa defraudar a las personas que están confiando en él. Con el dinero solicitado comprará más cantidad de frazadas para aumentar sus ingresos económicos y progresar en su negocio.
texts.en:
William is 20 years old, single, and lives alone in a room he rented when he arrived in the city of Juliaca. He is from an area called Cabana, about an hour away from the city. He earns a living by selling clothing, blankets and covers. Due to his family’s economic situation, he was unable to continue studying. For the past 5 years he has worked and progressed little by little to earn a salary. William really likes what he does, thanks to this job he has hopes for a better future. Normally he starts work very early and packs up his merchandise very late in order to increase his sales. He has to endure the cold at night and the strong heat during the day, but William always does his best because he knows that every sacrifice has a reward. He is a new member of his community bank and is applying for his first loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. He will be very punctual with his payments because he is very grateful for this opportunity and will not disappoint the people who trust him. With this money he will increase the number of blankets to sell in order to increase his earnings and help his business.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy blankets to sell

loans.name: Mrs. Saroeurn Chev Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Thirteen people living in Tang Kley village in Kampong Chhnang province comprise this village bank loan, and they will use the loan for various purposes. Mrs. Saroeurn C., the 47-year-old village bank president, is a firewood seller. Her husband, Mr. Rol Phat, is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. Even though they try do work hard, they still earn inadequate income to support their family. In order to improve their living conditions, Mrs. Saroeurn C. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding. She has five children, two of whO. are employed in a garment factory while two are enrolled in the local school and the youngest one is too young to work or study. 

Seven members in this group loans are end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows tH. to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding.

loans.name: Flor Del Carmen

texts.es: Flor del Carmen U. S., vive en Lourdes en el Occidente de El Salvador es una mujer casada con 42 años de edad, vive con su esposo y un hijo. Flor es una mujer trabadora y un pilar en la familia, hace ocho años Flor tiene la idea de poner una tienda en su casa para apoyar a su esposo y ayudar en los gastos de la familiares; pero ahora esa tienda que era hace ocho años ha ido creciendo por el espíritu emprendedor y la amabilidad que Flor muestra con sus clientes, ahora Flor también vende productos de papelería como cuadernos, lapiceros  plumones, ella trata de surtir su tienda con los productos que sus clientes le demandan. Flor solicita un crédito para compra de mercadería para su tienda, ya que quiere seguir creciendo y ofrecer variedad de productos a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Flor del Carmen U. S. lives in Lourdes in the west part of El Salvador. She's married and she's 42 years old. She lives with her husband and son. Flor is a hard-working woman and a pillar of strength to her family. About 8 years ago, Flor decided to open up a small store which she runs out of her own home so that she could help her husband pay the monthly bills. Now, that same store is growing and growing due to the enterprising spirit and amiability Flor demonstrates to all her clients. She's also selling school supplies such as notebooks and pens. She tries to stock-up her store with all the products that her clients demand. Flor is requesting a loan to purchase more merchandise for her store since she would like to keep growing and to keep offering the best products to her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise

location.town: Lourdes Colón, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Rubidia Del Carmen

texts.es: Rubidia del Carmen R. A. de 30 años de edad, reside en el municipio de Colón junto a su esposo Carlos Márquez y sus dos hijos menores de edad.  Ella trabaja a diario haciendo visitas de casa en casa para vender productos por catalogo, ella posee dos años trabajando en la misma actividad, todo con el fin de poder colaborarle a su esposo en los gastos del hogar. Rubidia solicita un prestamos,  ya que dentro de sus metas esta crecer en su negocio y de esta manera poder comprar mercadería como perfumes, cosméticos, estrés otros, todo con el fin de aumentar sus ventas y poder mantener a las ya existentes. Rubidia desea poder darles todo lo necesario a sus hijos, es por ello que se esfuerza día tras día, ya que son estos su mayor incentivo para seguir trabajando a diario.
texts.en:
Rubidia del Carmen R. A. is 30 years old and lives in the city of Colon, along with her husband Carlos Marquez and her two young children. Rubidia works everyday going door to door to sell products from a catalog. She has been doing this work for 2 years, with the objective to help her husband with the household expenses. Rubidia is asking for a loan since one of her goals is to grow her business. With the loan she will be able to buy merchandise like perfumes, cosmetics, among other things, to be able to increase her sales. Rubidia's hopes are to be able to provide everything necessary for her children, that is why she works hard day after day, her children provide the biggest incentive for her to keep working everyday.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

location.town: Lourdes Colón, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy A. is a married woman of 42 years with three children currently in school. Her husband has been very resourceful in support of the children. She lives at Cape Coast in the central region of Ghana with her children. The partial responsibility of the children rests on her. She is determined to provide for her children through hard work and commitment. To support her children, she has been selling cosmetics and products such as spray, powder and London cooking utensils etc.  from a rented store at the market center. She says selling cosmetics and cooking utensils is very lucrative and therefore she wants to expand her inventory to enable her make more income to sponsor her children’s education.

loans.use: To buy more stock of cosmetics and cooking utensils.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is a responsible wife and mother. She and her husband were gifted with six children: Rosita - 27 years old; Romulo Jr. - 25 years old; Hazel - 21 years old; Romnick - 18 years old, college student; Joyce - 13 years old, high school student and their youngest is Jay Lord - 3 years old. Three of them are already married.

She and her husband are managing a welding shop. With their need for financial assistance she is now requesting a loan of 5,000 Philippine Pesos for the maintenance of their shop. This amount will assist her husband in developing their business, making it more productive able to meet the needs of their family and provide for the education of their children.

loans.use: Maintenance of welding shop

loans.name: Usomchon

texts.ru: Усмончону 23 лет. Женат и имеет 1-го ребенка. Занимается продажей разных напитков в кафе "Ганчина" в районе "Чумчук-Арала" города Худжанда. Он закупает товар из рынка "Панчшанбе" у оптовиков. Так как район "Чумчук Арала" очень многолюдное место, там имеется парк и ботанический сад, множество магазинов и жилых домов, у Усмончона торговля идет очень хорошо. Поэтому Усмончон хочет расширить ассортимент своего товара.
texts.en:
Usimchon is 23 years old. He is married and has one child. He sells soft drinks in the cafe Ganchina in the Chumchuk-Arala region in the town of Khujand. He buys the merchandise in the Panshabe market from wholesellers. Because Chumchuk-Arala is a very busy place and there's a park and a botanical garden as well as a many stores and apartment buildings nearby so Usmonchon's sales are good. This is why he wants to increase the variety of his merchandise.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For resale of soft drinks

loans.name: Kunle

texts.en: R. is 26 years old and married with two children. She sells provisions and drinks.  She is requesting the loan of N50,000 to purchase more provisions to sell.  She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Jamuna

texts.en:
Mrs. Jamuna S. lives in Sundhara. Sundhara is located in lalitpur district, where most people are engaged in small businesses. Jamuna lives in a single family unit with her husband and their two sons. Her husband, Mr. Dhruba S., works at his own motorcycle workshop. Her older son is studying in grade 9, and her younger son is studying in grade 5.

Jamuna is engaged in the business of weaving wool sweaters, caps, gloves, socks, and other such clothing items. She accepts orders from dealers, and then she sells her goods to the local people. At present, due to the summer season, there is less demand for her wool goods, but she sells enough to cover her family's household expenses. Jamuna is now requesting a loan in the amount of $275 (20,000 NPR) to buy wool for her weaving work.

loans.use: To purchase additional wool for her weaving business

loans.name: Grupo Solidario Acosme Group

texts.es: Este es un grupo llamado Grupo Solidario Acosme, está conformado por Eulalia Carlota García y  Fanny esperanza R. García. Ellas son personas muy trabajadoras, las 2 tienen sus propios negocios. Eulalia se dedica a una pulpería y Fanny se dedica a la venta y elaboración de tortillas. Por lo que ambas tienen mucho tiempo en las diferentes actividades económicas. El financiamiento que solicitan es para capital de trabajo para materia prima que es necesaria para sus negocios. Ambas luchan por proporcionarles a sus familias estabilidad económica de sus humildes actividades.
texts.en:
This group is called Grupo Solidario Acosme, which consists of Eulalia Carlota García and Fanny Esperanza R. García. They are hardworking women who have their own businesses. Eulalia has a grocery store while Fanny makes and sells tortillas. Both dedicate a lot of time to their business activities. The loan they are requesting will be used as operating capital for raw materials needed for their businesses. Both women struggle to provide financial stability for their families with their modest efforts.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is a member of the Ikweta North,Kinyanambo,Iringa,she is 19 years old woman,she is married and  a mother of 3 children.Her children  are aged 15,8 and 22 years.

Lilian started her own Tailoring  business 3 years ago,she works 12 hours a day and earn monthly  profit approximately 30,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is lilian`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 300,000Tsh in order to buy more material.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan Lilian hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more material

loans.name: Taingkea

texts.en:
Mr. Taingkea U., age 36, and his wife, Mrs. Chamroeun Kong, age 36, live along National Road Number One approximately twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They were married in 1989 and have four children: two sons and two daughters. One of their children is married, another two are in primary school and one is a construction worker.

Tanigkea has been a construction worker for twenty years and his wife has been selling fruit for five years. She buys it from her village and some from the nearby village and transports it to sell at Phnom Penh market.

Tanigkea is applying for his first loan of $1,000 to help his wife to purchase fruit on contract for resale.

loans.use: To purchase fruit on contract for his wife's business

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is 41 years old and already a widow. She has two children: Mae Joy - 16 years old, a high school graduate, and Rona - 12 years old, an elementary school graduate. Her children are her precious treasure in life and to give them a better future, Myrna ventured into a hog-raising business and also works as a dealer of Avon, Natasha and MSE products.

Myrna dreams of becoming successful in her business for the future of her children. She is now borrowing PHP 17,000 from Kiva lenders that she will use for the improvement of her business. She will buy piglets and feed for their growth.

loans.use: To buy piglets and pig feed

loans.name: Sin

texts.en:
Mrs. Sin S. is a young married woman who is 23 years old. She is currently a good mother caring for one lovely young child. To earn a living, she works sewing clothes for a garment industry at Phnom Penh and is getting a salary of $120 a month, while her husband is a motorcycle taxi driver.

Sin S.’s husband has been using his motor for his service for years, so his motor is now too old and not attractive to customers. Therefore, Sin S. would like to seek a loan of US $500 which will allow her husband to renovate his old motor. (Mrs. Sin S.'s husband appears in the picture).

loans.use: To renovate an old motorbike

loans.name: Safina

texts.en:
Safina is 29 years old, married with two children, aged 9 and 11 years. Both her children go to school. She resides in and rents a two-roomed house where she is staying with four people. Safina takes care of additional family members. The family has access to electricity but no piped water.

Safina owns a retail shop selling day-to-day essentials and doesn’t pay rent because she works from her home. She works in the outskirts of Kampala. She has been in this business for five years and with MCDT for two years.

Safina buys merchandise from Kikuubo in Kampala and so she incurs transport costs to and from shopping. Her challenges include transportation of merchandise and the ever increasing price of goods. Safina wants to use this loan to buy more merchandise for her retail shop..She is aspiring of seeing her business grow stronger and owning a wholesale shop.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise for her retail shop

loans.name: Chaimehen

texts.en:
N. is 31 years old and lives with his wife and two young children in the Hovd province of western Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. His oldest child attends kindergarten while the youngest one stays home. N. and his wife operate a retail clothing business in their town. He is responsible for importing the products from China twice a month while his wife is responsible for selling the products in the market. He began his business in 2001 and attributes his success to his good business sense and accounting skills. In order to supplement their earnings, the family also preserves vegetables in the fall and sells them in the spring when prices for such goods rise. N. is requesting a 1,500,000 tugrug loan in order to purchase more products from China which he can sell in his market. About XacBank:
XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save.

To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team.

loans.use: To purchase more products from China which he can sell in his market

loans.name: Maria Jesus

texts.es:
La Sra. María J. es socia del banco comunal Las Pauteñitas, vive en el cantón Paute, tiene 45 años de edad, se encuentra casada siendo el fruto de su unión conyugal sus 4 hijos de 22, 18, 12, 10 años de edad, su primera hija trabaja y ayuda un poco económicamente en casa, su segunda hija se graduó del colegio y por ahora se encuentra ayudando en el negocio, su tercer hijo estudia en colegio 26 de Octubre en el cantón Paute y su ultimo hijo estudia en la escuela Isidro Ayora, también tiene a cargo un sobrino de 8 años de edad, prácticamente es como su madre por que le crio desde que tenía 6 meses de edad, sus padres son separados y viven en el extranjero y no se acuerdan de su hijo, solo su madre le envía un poco de dinero para su alimentación, su esposo trabaja como chofer de una cooperativa de transporte, con el esfuerzo conyugal han logrado construir su casa propia.

María se dedica a la venta de frutas y pollo asado, con el puesto de frutas lleva 13 años y le va bien vende los días domingo, lunes, martes y miércoles, con su negocio de venta de pollos asados al carbón lleva 2 años y vende los días jueves, viernes y sábados, en Pirincay conocido como los Jardines de Paute, tiene un gran vinculo de amistad con todas las compañeras del banco comunal, se encuentra en su cuarto ciclo trabajando con los prestamos del banco comunal y nos comenta que le han beneficiado en su negocio, con el nuevo préstamo que la FUNDACIÓN ESPOIR, le  entregara va a invertir en su negocio de pollos y frutas, su meta es de salir adelante con su negocio.
texts.en:
María J. is a member of Las Pauteñitas communal bank and lives in Paute county. She is 45 years old, married, and from her marriage has 4 children, ages 22, 18, 12, and 10. Her first daughter works and helps a little bit economically in the house. Her second daughter graduated from school and is now helping with the business. Her third child, a son, studies in the school October 26 in Paute county. Her youngest son attends the Isidro Ayora school. She is also in charge of her 8-year-old nephew, and is practically her mother since she has raised him since he was 6 months old. His parents are separated and live abroad and do not remember their child. His mother only sends a small amount of money for food and her husband works as a driver of a transportation cooperative. With the strength of their marriage they have managed to build their own house. María works selling fruit and grilled chicked. She has had her fruit stand for 13 years, which is going well, and she sells fruit on Sundays, Mondays, Tuesdays, and Wednesdays. She has had her grilled chicken business for 2 years, and she sells chicken on Thursdays, Fridays, and Saturdays. In Pirincay, known as the Jardines de Paute, she has a strong bond of friendship with the members of the communal bank. She is on her fourth loan cycle working with the loans of the communal bank, and mentions that her business has benefited from the loans. With the new loan from Kiva partner Fundación ESPOIR, she is going to invest in her chicken and fruit business. Her goal is to continue moving forward with her business.

Translated from Spanish by Josh Wilcox, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Apples, oranges, other fruit, and chicken which will be grilled and sold.

loans.name: Mah-E-Now Group

texts.en:
The pictured group is Mah-e-Now which is made up of five female members. Hasema is the group leader. She is 48 and married with 5 children. She weaves different kinds of carpets and she needs a loan to buy good quality materials to grow her business. Wahida is a good seamstress and she sews kids clothes in her house. Many of her neighbors like her work and buy their children's clothes from her. She is seeking a loan to buy a new machine for her business. Sara jan sells embroidery, which is very popular in Afghanistan. She wants money to buy supplies for her business. Mariza wants a loan for her husband who has a small cosmetics shop. He would like to buy more inventory for his shop. The last member of the group is Fatana who would like to receive a loan for her brother who has a clothing shop. She is confident that her brother's business will expand quickly.

Together they have requested a group loan of 50000 Afghani and would like to thank Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy carpet-weaving materials

loans.name: Lucrecio

texts.en:
Lucrecio A. is from the village of Del Carmen, Iligan City. He is 62 years old. Lucrecio is married and has 5 adult-aged children. To make a living, Lucrecio owns & operates a specialized retail store, selling seafood products  including fish and shrimp in the local community. Lucrecio has been engaged in his business for over 6 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Lucrecio joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and give him the ability to engage in business activities. Lucrecio is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Lucrecio from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Husam

texts.en:
Husam is 38 years old, is married, and has six children. He lives in the city of Nablus, Palestine.

Husam owns a small restaurant and wants a loan to purchase a new cooking stove, tables and chairs and to renovate his restaurant. That way, he will be able to increase his income and provide a better life for his family.

Husam is happy with the help Ryada is giving him and he would like to thank those who make the loan possible for him.

loans.use: To purchase a new cooking stove, tables and chairs and to renovate his restaurant

loans.name: Mesias Heriberto

texts.es:
Mesias Heriberto V. G. tiene 51 años.  Es viudo con 7 hijos, entre 9 años y 28 años de edad.  Vive en el cantón de San Miguel en la provincia de Bolívar.
El socio es un miembro de la ventanilla rural Yagui Grande.  Son 38 socios en total, los cuales la mayoría se dedican a la agricultura y la crianza de animales menores.
Mesias se dedica a la agricultura y también crece vacas, gallinas, y chanchos.  Vende sus productos de maíz, papas, habas, y alverjas incluso con su ganado en la feria de San Miguel los días jueves.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de abonos.  Su esperanza es que todos sus hijos menores sigan estudiando y que sean profesionales.  También, quiere crecer su cosecha.
Le gusta jugar el voleibol los jueves y domingos en su tiempo libre.
texts.en:
Mesias Heriberto V. G. is 51 years old. He is a widower with 7 children who are between the ages of 9 and 28 years old. He lives in the canton of San Miguel, in Bolívar Province. He is a member of the Yagui Grande communal bank. There are 38 members in total, the majority of whom work in agriculture and raise small animals. Mesias works in agriculture and he also raises cows, chickens, and pigs. He sells corn, potatoes, broad beans, and peas at the San Miguel market on Thursdays. He is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers. His hope is that all of his younger children will keep studying and become professionals. He also wants to grow his crops. He likes to play volleyball on Thursdays and Sundays, in his free time.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Juana Francisca

texts.es:
Juana Martinez es una dama digna de imitar porque se dedica a vender reposterías ambulantemente en las cercanías al mercado el Bisne donde vende dichas reposterías desde tempranas horas con un canasto en su cabeza dirigiéndose por varios lugares y con la exposición al sol pero esto no le es impedimento porque ella se ha planteado trabajar muy esforzadamente para llevar el sustento a su hogar.
El crédito que está solicitando lo invertirá en la compra de las reposterías para continuar ofreciéndolas en el mercado siempre vendiéndolas ambulantemente.
texts.en:
Juana is a woman to be emulated. She sells confectionery on foot around the “Bisne” marketplace. She begins selling early each morning from a basket carried on her head. She is out in the sun as she walks through many places, but this has not deterred her. She has put much effort into her work, in order to bring money into her home. She is requesting this loan so she can invest in more items of confectionery, so that she can continue to sell them on foot in the marketplace.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in confectionery items for resale

loans.name: Enrique

texts.es: El Señor Enrique nacio el 16 de julio de 1971 en la provincia Carrasco, aproximadamente hace dos años que vive en al barrio Evo Morales el la Localidad de Limoncito el señor tiene sus tierras en la comunidad los Amarillos a 20 kilometros de la carretera entrando por la localidad de Limoncito. El Cliente trabaja con su esposa en la agricultura, el credito solicitado es para la siembra de papa por las epocas que se avecinan, tiene 3 hijos pequeños que se encuentran el edad escolar, el Sr. Enrique es una persona trabajadora y responsable que desea sacar a su familia adelante y mejorar su calidad de vida, esta agradecido con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Señor Enrique was born on July 16, 1971, in the Carrasco province. He has lived in the Evo Morales neighborhood of the town of Limoncito for about two years. His lands are in the community of Amarillos, about 20 kilometers by road from the town of Limoncito. The client (Enrique) works in agriculture with his wife. The loan he has applied for is for planting potatoes for the coming season. He has three small children who are of school age. Señor Enrique is a hard-working and responsible person who wants to advance his family and improve their quality of life. He is grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the confidence offered in the granting of credit.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy seeds to plant potatoes
